Name: The Last Friday
Subtitle Data: 1 00:01:07,542 --> 00:01:13,005 Edition www.trigon-film.org 2 00:03:14,833 --> 00:03:20,174 And we begin our news tour with the A! Jazeera channel 3 00:03:21,375 --> 00:03:26,546 which said that an extensive investigation has been conducted 4 00:03:28,708 --> 00:03:34,333 by a team of international independent technical experts 5 00:03:35,500 --> 00:03:41,254 who confirmed the claim of interference of an Al Jazeera Sports Channel 6 00:03:45,417 --> 00:03:50,335 during the broadcast of the FIFA World Cup, 7 00:03:50,500 --> 00:03:56,047 and the experts were able to identify the site 8 00:03:56,208 --> 00:04:00,629 from which the interference originated 9 00:04:00,833 --> 00:04:05,301 which is near the city of Salt, Jordan, 10 00:04:05,458 --> 00:04:10,885 and noted that this site is deliberately interfering with the broadcast 11 00:04:14,042 --> 00:04:17,301 signal of A! Jazeera Sports 12 00:04:17,458 --> 00:04:22,593 resulting in interference of the live broadcast of a number 13 00:04:24,750 --> 00:04:27,298 of World Cup matches. 14 00:04:44,208 --> 00:04:45,500 "The Guardian" newspaper 15 00:04:45,667 --> 00:04:48,168 confirms this hypothesis and further more based 16 00:04:48,375 --> 00:04:49,466 on the secret documents 17 00:04:49,625 --> 00:04:53,465 that refer to the site of interference being in Jordan and more specifically 18 00:04:53,625 --> 00:04:54,798 near the city of Salt. 19 00:04:54,958 --> 00:04:57,210 which used in the process advanced equipment 20 00:04:57,375 --> 00:05:00,090 that interrupts the origin of the signal transmission 21 00:05:00,250 --> 00:05:03,841 and the British newspaper assured, based on the experts' quotes that 22 00:05:04,000 --> 00:05:07,295 this has occurred with the knowledge of the Jordanian government 23 00:05:07,458 --> 00:05:11,132 in what appears to be linked to anger in Jordan after failing to reach 24 00:05:11,292 --> 00:05:13,129 an agreement with Al Jazeera Sports 25 00:05:13,292 --> 00:05:16,752 from banks and currencies to the prices that are changing day after day... 26 00:05:17,083 --> 00:05:19,667 Well... I need two hours and I'll be back. 27 00:05:25,250 --> 00:05:27,881 Could you please turn it down a little bit? 28 00:05:31,542 --> 00:05:34,588 Of course I'm by myself! Who would I be with? 29 00:05:36,583 --> 00:05:40,293 No! Do not come by unless you give me a call first. 30 00:05:42,500 --> 00:05:45,083 Can I be honest with you? 31 00:05:45,250 --> 00:05:48,213 I don't want you in my life anymore. 32 00:12:09,750 --> 00:12:13,839 In Amman, hundreds of Jordanians protested against the 33 00:12:14,000 --> 00:12:17,211 repression and intimidation of journalists 34 00:12:17,375 --> 00:12:22,009 which took place when they organized a protest under the name. 35 00:12:22,167 --> 00:12:25,841 The Friday for Dignity and Freedom of Expression. 36 00:12:26,000 --> 00:12:29,094 The demonstrators burned an American flag 37 00:12:29,292 --> 00:12:33,084 to protest what they called the U.S. intervention 38 00:12:33,250 --> 00:12:36,426 in the policies of the Jordanian Government, 39 00:12:36,583 --> 00:12:41,419 and called for the resignation of the Prime Minister as well as 40 00:12:41,583 --> 00:12:43,966 demanding freedom of the press. 41 00:12:44,125 --> 00:12:47,052 Last Friday, a violence fight broke out 42 00:12:47,208 --> 00:12:50,669 when police tried to break up a demonstration 43 00:12:50,833 --> 00:12:55,301 that called for reform. Many journalists were injured. 44 00:12:55,458 --> 00:12:57,675 From Amman, the bureau chief, 45 00:12:57,833 --> 00:13:01,258 Yasser Abu Hilal, will report on the details. 46 00:13:01,417 --> 00:13:06,501 Yasser, what was the extent of the fight and what will happen now? 47 00:13:06,667 --> 00:13:11,632 Demonstrations swept a number of Jordanian cities south in Maan, 48 00:13:11,792 --> 00:13:16,675 and in the south, in Karak and Tafieleh and Irbid in the north. 49 00:13:16,833 --> 00:13:21,882 This Friday called for reform but brutal repression by the police 50 00:13:22,042 --> 00:13:26,925 resulted in many of journalists being injured and hospitalized. 51 00:13:27,083 --> 00:13:32,132 Prior to the demonstration, a meeting by King Abduflah II and the 52 00:13:32,292 --> 00:13:36,510 official representative of the journalist, Tareq Momani 53 00:13:36,667 --> 00:13:41,218 took place yesterday, and the message meeting was clear... 54 00:16:27,958 --> 00:16:30,376 It will do for couple of days. 55 00:16:36,083 --> 00:16:38,086 Can you take me to the airport? 56 00:16:38,750 --> 00:16:39,841 What for? 57 00:16:40,000 --> 00:16:42,003 I finally got my visa. 58 00:16:43,542 --> 00:16:45,343 So what about the money? 59 00:16:45,542 --> 00:16:47,177 Be patient with me. 60 00:16:47,750 --> 00:16:48,793 I need it now! 61 00:16:48,958 --> 00:16:50,131 What's the rush? 62 00:16:50,292 --> 00:16:51,678 I have to have surgery. 63 00:16:51,833 --> 00:16:52,876 Surgery for what? 64 00:16:53,667 --> 00:16:56,464 When was the last time you checked the oil? 65 00:17:01,125 --> 00:17:03,294 No need... the engine is the problem. 66 00:17:11,125 --> 00:17:13,424 The car keeps shutting off... 67 00:17:14,500 --> 00:17:16,420 This isn't working... 68 00:17:16,833 --> 00:17:19,168 You want me to keep going on like this? 69 00:17:19,333 --> 00:17:21,550 I don't get it... what do you want? 70 00:17:22,917 --> 00:17:24,801 Just fix the engine. 71 00:17:27,292 --> 00:17:30,835 Fouad, get me the notebook... it's in the drawer. 72 00:17:58,500 --> 00:18:01,462 You've got 300 dinars worth of fines since last year. 73 00:18:02,042 --> 00:18:05,420 When are you going to pay them? 74 00:18:05,583 --> 00:18:07,338 I'm going to be honest with you... 75 00:18:07,500 --> 00:18:09,669 In general, I'm unhappy with your performance. 76 00:18:09,833 --> 00:18:14,089 If you don't shape up within a week, you give me the cab back and go. 77 00:18:15,833 --> 00:18:17,255 What happened? 78 00:18:17,417 --> 00:18:19,336 The front part is totally wrecked. 79 00:18:19,750 --> 00:18:21,090 So, when will it be done? 80 00:18:21,417 --> 00:18:22,756 Half a day. 81 00:18:25,583 --> 00:18:28,261 So what are you waiting for? Get back to work. 82 00:18:36,167 --> 00:18:39,296 You think you're the only one with dignity in this world. 83 00:18:39,458 --> 00:18:41,343 And what if I told you to buzz off? 84 00:18:41,500 --> 00:18:43,882 A couple of days ago you called me a jackass! 85 00:18:44,042 --> 00:18:47,834 Or do you only use etiquette when... 86 00:18:55,208 --> 00:18:56,630 What are you up to? 87 00:18:57,083 --> 00:18:59,051 I'm bored out of my mind. 88 00:19:02,000 --> 00:19:04,050 Going to work. 89 00:19:12,250 --> 00:19:16,208 Mom, are you going out tonight? 90 00:19:23,667 --> 00:19:27,341 Then can you leave me your car keys... I'm going out but I won't be late. 91 00:19:27,500 --> 00:19:28,970 You're going out every day now? 92 00:19:29,125 --> 00:19:30,714 I'm going to a graduation party. 93 00:19:30,875 --> 00:19:32,713 Take a cab. 94 00:19:33,167 --> 00:19:38,381 You want me to step out of the hair salon into the street and hail a cab? 95 00:19:38,833 --> 00:19:40,552 No way! 96 00:19:40,792 --> 00:19:46,670 The first time I ever went to a salon was on my wedding day. 97 00:19:47,875 --> 00:19:50,127 Did you add your father on Facebook? 98 00:19:50,292 --> 00:19:51,501 I don't want to. 99 00:19:51,667 --> 00:19:52,709 Why? 100 00:19:52,875 --> 00:19:54,380 Because I don't want to. 101 00:19:54,542 --> 00:19:55,751 Add him! 102 00:19:55,917 --> 00:19:58,595 Mama, can you stop acting like a teenager. 103 00:19:58,750 --> 00:20:00,385 Let me know when you add him. 104 00:20:00,542 --> 00:20:05,093 What do you really want from all this? 105 00:20:06,167 --> 00:20:08,964 Will you give me the keys or not? 106 00:20:10,167 --> 00:20:12,798 Didn't your dad say he'd buy you a car? 107 00:20:12,958 --> 00:20:14,713 Talk to him... 108 00:20:23,667 --> 00:20:24,840 Message? 109 00:20:25,000 --> 00:20:26,126 Call him! 110 00:20:26,292 --> 00:20:27,714 I don't feel like it. 111 00:20:27,875 --> 00:20:29,960 And, anyway, I don't have credit. 112 00:20:30,125 --> 00:20:32,342 Your father doesn't answer messages. 113 00:20:32,500 --> 00:20:37,300 You'll see... I'll keep sending until he answers. 114 00:20:40,792 --> 00:20:43,636 How's your boyfriend, the mechanic? 115 00:20:43,792 --> 00:20:46,209 Mom, he's not a "mechanic". 116 00:20:46,375 --> 00:20:50,677 Jaber is a mechanical engineer. 117 00:20:52,375 --> 00:20:55,421 Darling, men are stupid creatures. 118 00:20:55,958 --> 00:20:59,419 Don't comfort him, don't ever let him feel safe. 119 00:20:59,583 --> 00:21:03,127 You have to always keep him worried... afraid. 120 00:21:03,292 --> 00:21:05,709 Don't you dare tell him that you love him. 121 00:21:05,875 --> 00:21:08,590 No! He told me loves me. 122 00:21:08,917 --> 00:21:13,717 Don't say it until he loses hope from waiting. 123 00:21:35,917 --> 00:21:37,671 Jaber... 124 00:21:41,042 --> 00:21:44,420 I've been a taxi driver for a while now... 125 00:21:44,750 --> 00:21:47,049 When will you give me my old job back? 126 00:21:47,292 --> 00:21:49,544 We still don't have any openings. 127 00:21:49,833 --> 00:21:51,671 It's been 5 years. 128 00:21:53,208 --> 00:21:56,752 You know more than anyone what I can do for the showroom sales. 129 00:21:57,375 --> 00:22:01,215 You're the one who left to go work in the Gulf. 130 00:24:09,750 --> 00:24:11,883 Imad, what were you doing on their roof? 131 00:24:12,167 --> 00:24:15,011 Do you want us to get in trouble with the neighbors? 132 00:24:15,167 --> 00:24:18,426 "After a women has found her way into a man's heart, 133 00:24:18,583 --> 00:24:20,254 she will seek to control him, 134 00:24:20,417 --> 00:24:23,462 and there are many ways she can keep that control 135 00:24:23,625 --> 00:24:27,003 like, for example, if he has a submissive personality, 136 00:24:27,167 --> 00:24:29,170 or h' he is poor and she is not. 137 00:24:29,333 --> 00:24:33,719 She could also be sadistic and he could be unable to stand up for himself 138 00:24:33,875 --> 00:24:38,047 Moreover, the women's family is could be wealthy and have power in 139 00:24:38,208 --> 00:24:41,135 society increasing the psychological pressure. 140 00:24:41,292 --> 00:24:44,835 AH of these things could cause the husband to surrender 141 00:24:45,000 --> 00:24:47,466 and remain silent in the face of abuse. 142 00:24:47,625 --> 00:24:51,133 In fact, in the Arab world today in only 7% of cases do 143 00:24:51,292 --> 00:24:54,219 men started to admit to the violence they face 144 00:24:54,375 --> 00:24:58,168 and they do not fully recognized it until they have reached 145 00:24:58,333 --> 00:25:00,799 a severe stage of depression and abuse. 146 00:25:00,958 --> 00:25:03,542 And so when we try to know and understand 147 00:25:03,708 --> 00:25:05,676 the reason for their depression 148 00:25:05,833 --> 00:25:08,216 we uncover the truth of the violence. 149 00:25:09,167 --> 00:25:11,466 I've missed you, kid. 150 00:25:15,042 --> 00:25:17,459 Pretty soon you'll be as tall as me. 151 00:25:19,042 --> 00:25:21,127 I might be taller. 152 00:25:28,167 --> 00:25:30,798 So why weren't you two talking? 153 00:25:31,583 --> 00:25:33,135 She was upset. 154 00:25:33,292 --> 00:25:34,548 Why? 155 00:25:36,750 --> 00:25:39,381 I was supposed to wait for her outside. 156 00:25:39,750 --> 00:25:43,507 Maybe she was afraid that her mom would see her with you. 157 00:25:45,750 --> 00:25:48,168 Is that why you went up? 158 00:25:48,792 --> 00:25:51,209 I waited but she didn't come out. 159 00:26:04,583 --> 00:26:07,298 No... this goes here. 160 00:26:09,792 --> 00:26:14,461 Dad, I need a new wheel for my bike. 161 00:26:26,292 --> 00:26:28,709 Don't, don't. 162 00:27:55,125 --> 00:27:57,922 And the money? 163 00:27:59,250 --> 00:28:03,208 Didn't you say it's ready? Come pick it up? 164 00:28:03,958 --> 00:28:05,713 What's wrong with you, man? 165 00:28:05,875 --> 00:28:09,335 Do I have to tell you I don't have more than 20 dinars in my account? 166 00:28:09,500 --> 00:28:13,672 If you are so in need, why don't you take from Imad's savings? 167 00:28:13,833 --> 00:28:17,342 He's still young, and when you have money again you put it back. 168 00:28:20,375 --> 00:28:23,919 So, why don't you go back to the Gulf? 169 00:28:25,917 --> 00:28:29,460 When my mother was dying and I wanted to come visit. 170 00:28:29,625 --> 00:28:34,211 My fucking employer wouldn't give me my passport back. 171 00:28:34,375 --> 00:28:36,841 So I went to the police and reported. 172 00:28:37,875 --> 00:28:43,251 They threw me in their jeep with criminals and asked him to follow in his car! 173 00:28:45,125 --> 00:28:50,715 I stayed there waiting for that motherfucker for half a day. 174 00:28:52,208 --> 00:28:54,128 And what was the response? 175 00:28:54,292 --> 00:28:56,757 Sort it out yourself". 176 00:28:58,500 --> 00:29:01,676 Well, all you can do is play and try your luck again. 177 00:29:01,958 --> 00:29:04,506 Luck? What luck? 178 00:29:05,875 --> 00:29:09,751 I lost two years of work in one night. 179 00:29:12,833 --> 00:29:16,543 Good thing I registered under her name before I... 180 00:29:17,333 --> 00:29:21,505 The apartment she didn't like because it didn't have the garden she wanted! 181 00:29:22,167 --> 00:29:26,552 By the way, does she still rent it out fully furnished? 182 00:29:32,875 --> 00:29:34,676 I still don't get it, Fouad. 183 00:29:34,833 --> 00:29:37,417 You've got your family and a good job. 184 00:29:37,583 --> 00:29:40,298 You're supposed to be doing well. 185 00:29:42,250 --> 00:29:44,668 So why do you want to leave? 186 00:29:45,833 --> 00:29:48,678 Man, it's been three months with no salary. 187 00:29:48,833 --> 00:29:51,417 And you say I'm doing well. 188 00:29:53,000 --> 00:29:55,501 And the last time I asked Jaber to pay me. 189 00:29:55,667 --> 00:29:59,506 He acted like a beggar with no money. 190 00:30:04,000 --> 00:30:07,460 What's the story with this operation? 191 00:30:13,625 --> 00:30:17,133 Today, I felt this strong pain come and go. 192 00:30:20,208 --> 00:30:22,342 It turns out I have a twisted testicle. 193 00:30:22,500 --> 00:30:24,834 So now I need surgery. 194 00:30:28,250 --> 00:30:31,047 The doctor say it's a simple procedure. 195 00:30:31,208 --> 00:30:34,882 It's going to take 15 minutes and it's over. 196 00:30:37,875 --> 00:30:40,921 But I have a bad feeling about it. 197 00:30:42,208 --> 00:30:45,254 Man, the pain will go on its own. 198 00:30:47,042 --> 00:30:52,217 The thing is, the doctor says if I don't do it before Friday 199 00:30:53,875 --> 00:30:57,004 it will get worse and they might cut it off. 200 00:30:59,042 --> 00:31:04,043 So what... if they cut it off, you still have the other one. 201 00:32:28,333 --> 00:32:31,545 Do you know which one is yours? 202 00:32:48,333 --> 00:32:49,590 Which apartment? 203 00:32:49,750 --> 00:32:51,753 Number 7. 204 00:33:01,042 --> 00:33:02,333 Do YOU pay the bill? 205 00:33:02,500 --> 00:33:04,005 I always pay- 206 00:33:06,458 --> 00:33:10,714 Seems some bastard stole your plug. 207 00:33:15,958 --> 00:33:20,011 I think I have one at my place somewhere. 208 00:33:32,958 --> 00:33:36,134 If you're looking for a meter plug, 209 00:33:36,958 --> 00:33:40,881 there's an extra one... 210 00:33:53,292 --> 00:33:56,551 Do you know which meter is yours? 211 00:33:56,792 --> 00:33:58,178 Which apartment? 212 00:33:58,333 --> 00:34:01,296 Number 7. 213 00:34:09,167 --> 00:34:12,841 ...did not reveal is identity for Britain's "The Guardian" newspaper, 214 00:34:13,000 --> 00:34:14,340 that Jordan was behind 215 00:34:14,500 --> 00:34:18,802 the confusion on Al Jazeera television channel during the 2010 World Cup 216 00:34:18,958 --> 00:34:21,424 and the source said, that these allegations 217 00:34:21,583 --> 00:34:23,669 are false and unacceptable and that 218 00:34:23,833 --> 00:34:28,918 the government is ready to cooperate with any neutral expert team to check all facts 219 00:34:29,083 --> 00:34:33,835 and the Jordanian government is confident that such an examination will reveal 220 00:34:34,000 --> 00:34:36,085 the invalidity of such allegations. 221 00:34:36,250 --> 00:34:40,173 The source expressed the government's refusal to the speculation 222 00:34:40,333 --> 00:34:42,550 and opinions expressed by Al-Jazeera, 223 00:34:42,708 --> 00:34:45,340 to the Guardian newspaper about the reaction 224 00:34:45,500 --> 00:34:47,966 of Jordan to the failure of negotiations 225 00:34:48,125 --> 00:34:51,965 of buying the rights of broadcasting locally for the world cup, 226 00:34:52,125 --> 00:34:57,044 and in this regard the source pointed out that Jordan had spoken officially with 227 00:34:57,208 --> 00:35:00,966 Al-Jazeera on the purchase of broadcasting rights four months 228 00:35:01,125 --> 00:35:03,377 before the beginning of the World Cup. 229 00:35:03,542 --> 00:35:06,256 However, Al-Jazeera began actual negotiations 230 00:35:06,417 --> 00:35:08,384 only days before the start of... 231 00:35:09,125 --> 00:35:11,922 Yusef, it's Jaber. 232 00:35:12,083 --> 00:35:14,584 I tried to call you but haven't heard back yet. 233 00:35:15,208 --> 00:35:16,381 There's a deal. 234 00:35:16,542 --> 00:35:21,377 If you close it, you'll get 500 dinars and not a penny more. 235 00:35:21,667 --> 00:35:24,428 The client will be waiting at the showroom at 8. 236 00:35:24,625 --> 00:35:26,509 Don't be late. 237 00:37:01,292 --> 00:37:02,927 Yes, Mom. 238 00:37:05,167 --> 00:37:06,755 Studying- 239 00:37:09,583 --> 00:37:11,717 I don't know. 240 00:37:13,250 --> 00:37:14,885 I can't hear you. 241 00:37:18,333 --> 00:37:20,301 I can't hear you. 242 00:37:22,958 --> 00:37:26,134 Hush him up or go somewhere else so I can hear. 243 00:37:28,750 --> 00:37:30,835 Yes, much better. 244 00:37:34,542 --> 00:37:37,303 I was alone, he wasn't home. 245 00:37:38,667 --> 00:37:40,919 He went to see a friend. 246 00:37:42,208 --> 00:37:44,591 Fouad, maybe. 247 00:37:48,958 --> 00:37:53,095 No, I'm not going to say anything. He should know by himself. 248 00:37:53,625 --> 00:37:55,344 Don't say anything, OK? 249 00:38:06,542 --> 00:38:10,500 Thank you for making coffee. 250 00:38:11,375 --> 00:38:13,876 You still haven't finished the book? 251 00:38:14,042 --> 00:38:16,803 I have but I'm just reviewing. 252 00:38:36,417 --> 00:38:39,877 Where do they sell bike wheels? 253 00:38:40,042 --> 00:38:43,502 ...the Jordanian parliament didn't agree to vote on the 254 00:38:43,667 --> 00:38:45,835 investigation committee's decision 255 00:38:46,000 --> 00:38:48,880 that accuses Prime Minister Marouf Bakhit 256 00:38:49,042 --> 00:38:52,716 of corruption by licensing the casino project in Jordan. 257 00:38:52,875 --> 00:38:56,751 The parliament session witnessed a verbal argument followed 258 00:38:56,917 --> 00:38:59,879 by scuffles between members of the parliament 259 00:39:00,042 --> 00:39:02,127 after clearing the Prime Minister 260 00:39:02,292 --> 00:39:05,089 from any accusation that needs the approval 261 00:39:05,250 --> 00:39:07,134 of two-thirds of the members. 262 00:39:07,292 --> 00:39:11,510 Meanwhile, the parliament did validate the charge of corruption 263 00:39:11,667 --> 00:39:13,919 of the former minister of tourism. 264 00:39:26,125 --> 00:39:28,009 We've got two brands for this model. 265 00:39:28,167 --> 00:39:31,260 A Chinese one for 7 dinars, and an Italian for 25 dinars. 266 00:39:31,417 --> 00:39:33,669 Unfortunately, we're out of the Chinese one. 267 00:39:33,833 --> 00:39:36,796 Well, bring us the Italian. - Sure. 268 00:41:45,958 --> 00:41:50,924 Imad, I'm leaving the country. 269 00:41:59,417 --> 00:42:03,635 Dad, the school principle wants to see you. 270 00:42:07,750 --> 00:42:11,922 What did you do? - Nothing. 271 00:42:13,667 --> 00:42:16,132 So what does he want? 272 00:42:16,292 --> 00:42:17,382 I don't know. 273 00:42:22,667 --> 00:42:25,594 Tell him I'm busy. 274 00:42:26,458 --> 00:42:31,175 He said that if he doesn't see you he won't let me take the exam. 275 00:42:54,458 --> 00:42:58,381 Take the first right and then the second street on your left. 276 00:49:10,792 --> 00:49:13,008 The electricity at my place got cut off. 277 00:49:13,167 --> 00:49:15,881 Can I charge my phone here? 278 00:49:34,542 --> 00:49:36,509 Don't look at your watch the client 279 00:49:36,667 --> 00:49:38,255 postponed the appointment. 280 00:49:38,417 --> 00:49:40,502 And you don't have a cell phone. 281 00:49:40,667 --> 00:49:43,168 You should know that we've showed her the car already. 282 00:49:43,333 --> 00:49:45,301 But she's still not convinced. 283 00:49:45,458 --> 00:49:49,760 Be careful, she's got a dirty mouth especially when it comes to men. 284 00:49:49,917 --> 00:49:51,422 Do you know her? 285 00:49:51,583 --> 00:49:53,302 She might become my mother-in-law. 286 00:49:53,458 --> 00:49:57,417 But don't mention it. She doesn't know yet the showroom is ours. 287 00:49:58,375 --> 00:49:59,631 Why? 288 00:49:59,792 --> 00:50:03,003 I don't want her to get greedy. 289 00:50:04,083 --> 00:50:05,672 So which car does she want to buy. 290 00:50:05,833 --> 00:50:07,125 The Toyota Jeep. 291 00:50:07,292 --> 00:50:10,254 And which car would you like her to buy? - The Range Rover. 292 00:50:11,042 --> 00:50:13,175 So how is this car? 293 00:50:14,375 --> 00:50:16,544 It's your call ma'am. 294 00:50:16,708 --> 00:50:20,797 But if you want to hear my honest opinion, I recommend the Range Rover. 295 00:50:20,958 --> 00:50:22,250 Why's that? 296 00:50:22,417 --> 00:50:26,423 It's got more room, it's true that it's two years older... 297 00:50:26,583 --> 00:50:30,293 but I guarantee you that in three years you wouldn't have to change a single part. 298 00:50:30,458 --> 00:50:32,296 I want the Range. 299 00:50:33,542 --> 00:50:35,794 And how's this car when it comes to steep roads. 300 00:50:35,958 --> 00:50:38,885 It's a fine. 301 00:50:39,042 --> 00:50:42,502 But the options the Range Rover has are better for all roads. 302 00:50:42,667 --> 00:50:47,711 Whether you drive around town or outside, off-road, hills, mountains. 303 00:50:49,167 --> 00:50:51,549 Slow down ma'am. 304 00:50:52,042 --> 00:50:54,720 Slowly. - Okay. 305 00:50:54,875 --> 00:50:58,715 By the way, the Range Rover has lights on the outside mirrors. 306 00:50:58,875 --> 00:51:04,339 When a car gets too close the lights turn red with an alarm tone. 307 00:51:05,375 --> 00:51:09,084 So you drive in full control and vision. 308 00:51:09,833 --> 00:51:14,669 Also ma'am, here you'd have buttons to control almost everything in the car. 309 00:51:14,875 --> 00:51:20,671 Stereo levels, the dvd player, speed and cruise control. 310 00:51:21,458 --> 00:51:24,220 Are you talking about this car or the Range Rover? 311 00:51:24,375 --> 00:51:25,584 To be clear with you ma'am, 312 00:51:25,750 --> 00:51:27,718 that Range Rover was ordered specifically 313 00:51:27,875 --> 00:51:30,127 for a client that couldn't fully pay its price. 314 00:51:30,292 --> 00:51:33,468 That's why it has all those special additions 315 00:51:33,625 --> 00:51:36,303 that you won't find in any other car. 316 00:51:41,167 --> 00:51:43,798 Have you got any grandchildren ma'am. 317 00:51:43,958 --> 00:51:47,218 I'm sorry. The reason I asked was to tell you about the special feature 318 00:51:47,375 --> 00:51:49,592 the Range Rover has that no other car does. 319 00:51:49,750 --> 00:51:52,547 You can separate the front seat from the back seat. 320 00:51:52,708 --> 00:51:56,003 With one click, right from the steering over there. 321 00:51:56,167 --> 00:51:59,296 A glass barrier would appear here. 322 00:51:59,917 --> 00:52:03,211 You won't hear a single thing. 323 00:52:03,958 --> 00:52:07,419 And from over here ma'am there's a sound recorder 324 00:52:07,583 --> 00:52:09,800 of whatever goes on in the back. 325 00:52:10,667 --> 00:52:14,969 Be careful ma'am... give me the phone. 326 00:52:30,792 --> 00:52:33,802 If you want to be with me the way I want then fine... 327 00:52:33,958 --> 00:52:37,881 If not, stay at home with your father the doctor. 328 00:52:43,958 --> 00:52:45,677 By the way ma'am, the mirror. 329 00:52:45,833 --> 00:52:49,342 When are you going to understand that all men are the same? 330 00:52:49,708 --> 00:52:51,628 You just don't listen, do you? 331 00:52:51,792 --> 00:52:53,960 Now he wants you to do things his way. 332 00:52:54,333 --> 00:52:57,628 You've always been this stubborn. 333 00:52:57,792 --> 00:53:00,968 You deserve it... Now he wants you to do things his way 334 00:53:01,125 --> 00:53:04,965 and if you want to stoop to his level, it's your own fault. 335 00:53:05,125 --> 00:53:08,336 By the way, ma'am, the Range Rover has a very special advantage. 336 00:53:08,500 --> 00:53:11,215 It's got this calm reaction, you would hardly feel these 337 00:53:11,375 --> 00:53:13,094 small jumps we're feeling right now. 338 00:54:15,583 --> 00:54:19,839 Whose signature is this? 339 00:54:26,792 --> 00:54:31,793 When you don't go to school, where do you go? 340 00:54:32,833 --> 00:54:36,128 I'm asking you. 341 00:54:39,375 --> 00:54:44,258 You were absent for 17 days. Understood? 430 01:11:14,208 --> 01:11:17,717 As you like, you are free to decide. 431 01:11:21,208 --> 01:11:24,420 But if I ever hear that you took Imad 432 01:11:24,583 --> 01:11:28,044 to a single one of your poker games... 433 01:11:28,208 --> 01:11:31,089 it will be the last time you see him. 434 01:11:31,500 --> 01:11:36,300 Dalal, have you forgotten how I bought you the apartment? 435 01:11:36,458 --> 01:11:39,006 And have you forgotten how you lost everything? 436 01:11:39,167 --> 01:11:42,876 Dalal, I didn't come here to get upset and fight. 437 01:11:45,208 --> 01:11:47,543 And I'm not here to blame anyone. 438 01:11:47,708 --> 01:11:52,592 My only concern now is my son's future. 439 01:12:04,458 --> 01:12:07,883 Are you okay? - It's nothing. 440 01:12:16,583 --> 01:12:19,298 What's this? 441 01:12:21,417 --> 01:12:26,086 This is the money I've been saving for his university. 442 01:12:34,792 --> 01:12:38,300 Youssef, what's wrong? 472 01:25:19,625 --> 01:25:23,085 I'm traveling, my son, as I told you. 473 01:25:26,458 --> 01:25:29,718 I need you to take care of yourself. 474 01:25:30,958 --> 01:25:33,755 And your mother, of course. 475 01:25:35,333 --> 01:25:39,589 Don't make any trouble for her... listen to her - every word she says. 476 01:25:40,500 --> 01:25:44,376 Otherwise I'll be upset with you.

Sorry, that came out harsher than I meant. 1084 00:49:23,898 --> 00:49:25,867 I have to catch the train. 1085 00:49:25,934 --> 00:49:27,367 [Daniel] Please, Nathan. 1086 00:49:28,035 --> 00:49:30,137 I need help. 1087 00:49:30,204 --> 00:49:33,207 Ryan asked me to come by and say "hi" to you. 1088 00:49:34,041 --> 00:49:35,442 And I did. 1089 00:49:36,711 --> 00:49:37,712 Okay. 1090 00:49:40,481 --> 00:49:41,549 Hi. 1091 00:49:53,227 --> 00:49:55,563 [playing classical music] 1092 00:50:00,467 --> 00:50:03,370 -Best first date ever. -I heard that. 1093 00:50:09,611 --> 00:50:11,044 [Allison laughing] 1094 00:50:16,985 --> 00:50:20,287 [Daniel] I used to drink whiskey until I blacked out. 1095 00:50:21,421 --> 00:50:23,691 Wake up the next morning to find out 1096 00:50:24,626 --> 00:50:27,261 what I had done, who I had been. 1097 00:50:29,697 --> 00:50:30,765 [chuckles] 1098 00:50:33,001 --> 00:50:34,802 My father was a drunk. 1099 00:50:37,539 --> 00:50:42,042 He beat me right up to the day he died. 1100 00:50:44,278 --> 00:50:48,081 And I vowed I would never lay a hand on my children. 1101 00:50:50,117 --> 00:50:51,586 And I didn't... 1102 00:50:53,621 --> 00:50:55,255 while I was sober. 1103 00:50:57,992 --> 00:50:59,661 But in the blackness... 1104 00:51:03,096 --> 00:51:07,301 I always denied because I really couldn't remember. 1105 00:51:08,870 --> 00:51:10,738 Sometimes there'd be a bruise. 1106 00:51:12,607 --> 00:51:16,109 "Oh, you must have fallen down. 1107 00:51:16,176 --> 00:51:18,412 "I'm your daddy. I would never hurt you." 1108 00:51:19,847 --> 00:51:22,482 August 11th, '99... 1109 00:51:25,520 --> 00:51:30,290 I woke up on my front porch to the sound of church bells... 1110 00:51:33,027 --> 00:51:34,762 and an ice cream truck. 1111 00:51:35,797 --> 00:51:37,632 So, I knew it was Sunday. 1112 00:51:37,699 --> 00:51:42,235 First thing I saw was my captain 1113 00:51:43,236 --> 00:51:45,607 standing over me, 1114 00:51:45,673 --> 00:51:48,543 poking me in the ribs with his nightstick. 1115 00:51:51,779 --> 00:51:53,280 An ambulance. 1116 00:51:54,716 --> 00:51:58,720 My son, Nathan, sitting in the back, 1117 00:52:00,054 --> 00:52:01,589 bleeding from the head. 1118 00:52:02,724 --> 00:52:05,627 Medics had bought him a popsicle. 1119 00:52:07,862 --> 00:52:09,764 Turns out that... [sighs] 1120 00:52:11,766 --> 00:52:13,635 in the blackness... 1121 00:52:17,105 --> 00:52:20,173 I had beat him so bad 1122 00:52:20,240 --> 00:52:23,544 that he lost the hearing in his right ear. 1123 00:52:23,611 --> 00:52:24,646 Forever. 1124 00:52:25,780 --> 00:52:29,216 And to this day, every time I see him, 1125 00:52:29,282 --> 00:52:32,854 I beg for his forgiveness. 1126 00:52:34,221 --> 00:52:36,456 It's just a little dance we do. 1127 00:52:37,692 --> 00:52:39,393 A mere formality. 1128 00:52:41,194 --> 00:52:42,864 Because we both know... 1129 00:52:45,533 --> 00:52:48,368 that there are some things that are just 1130 00:52:49,871 --> 00:52:51,839 impossible to forgive. 1131 00:52:55,843 --> 00:53:01,248 I do believe even God knows that. 1132 00:53:08,321 --> 00:53:10,858 When I was a cop, I used to eat here every day. 1133 00:53:11,826 --> 00:53:13,594 Free coffee refills. 1134 00:53:16,263 --> 00:53:17,464 You hungry? 1135 00:53:19,000 --> 00:53:20,200 No. 1136 00:53:20,802 --> 00:53:21,803 [Daniel] Hmm. 1137 00:53:24,204 --> 00:53:26,574 Funny, the things we stop caring about. 1138 00:53:28,442 --> 00:53:30,410 I used to want to travel. 1139 00:53:31,713 --> 00:53:34,082 I would leaf through National Geographic 1140 00:53:34,148 --> 00:53:36,084 and dog-ear all of the exotic places 1141 00:53:36,150 --> 00:53:38,553 I would visit once I retired. 1142 00:53:41,189 --> 00:53:43,157 Never do that now. 1143 00:53:43,256 --> 00:53:45,960 -You still could. -No, no. I couldn't. 1144 00:53:50,832 --> 00:53:56,771 I wasn't drunk, or on anything, by the way. 1145 00:53:57,605 --> 00:53:58,606 What? 1146 00:53:59,841 --> 00:54:02,375 When I saw you the other day at the meeting, 1147 00:54:03,711 --> 00:54:07,782 I instantly got worried that you may have thought 1148 00:54:07,849 --> 00:54:10,952 that I was drinking or on drugs 1149 00:54:11,018 --> 00:54:12,687 on the day of the accident, and I wasn't. 1150 00:54:12,754 --> 00:54:15,489 I was sober. 1160 00:54:42,950 --> 00:54:45,485 Maybe he wanted me to like you. 1161 00:54:46,921 --> 00:54:48,656 I doubt that. 1162 00:54:51,993 --> 00:54:56,230 I thought that raising Ryan would offer me the chance 1163 00:54:56,296 --> 00:54:58,966 to be a better father than I ever was. 1164 00:54:59,867 --> 00:55:01,434 Shit. 1165 00:55:01,502 --> 00:55:04,404 I'm in way over my head. 1166 00:55:04,471 --> 00:55:07,608 I got one of those audiobooks from the library. 1167 00:55:07,675 --> 00:55:09,010 How to Talk to a Teen. 1168 00:55:09,076 --> 00:55:10,978 [chuckles] Oh, yeah? I really wanna beat it. 1332 01:03:32,681 --> 01:03:35,650 Then I want you to do 90 meetings in 90 days. 1333 01:03:35,717 --> 01:03:37,284 -Wow. -Yeah. 1334 01:03:37,351 --> 01:03:40,187 And, um, we're gonna get you started on step one. 1335 01:03:41,255 --> 01:03:42,222 Okay. 1336 01:03:43,424 --> 01:03:44,559 Okay. 1337 01:03:44,626 --> 01:03:48,128 Also, enough hiding out, man. 1338 01:03:48,195 --> 01:03:49,564 It's time you shared with the group. 1339 01:03:51,633 --> 01:03:53,834 -All right. -Uh... 1340 01:03:56,136 --> 01:04:02,376 [nervously] Hi, I'm Allison, and I'm addicted to, uh, 1341 01:04:03,712 --> 01:04:05,079 pills. 1342 01:04:05,145 --> 01:04:07,414 [group] Hi, Allison. 1343 01:04:07,481 --> 01:04:08,550 [Allison] Uh... 1344 01:04:09,950 --> 01:04:12,052 Sorry. Can I start again? 1345 01:04:12,119 --> 01:04:14,421 I've never done this before, and I'm nervous. 1346 01:04:14,488 --> 01:04:15,557 You got it. 1347 01:04:16,691 --> 01:04:18,425 [breathes deeply] 1348 01:04:20,094 --> 01:04:25,065 Hi, I'm Allison, and I'm an addict. 1349 01:04:25,132 --> 01:04:27,234 [group] Hi, Allison. 1350 01:04:30,371 --> 01:04:31,506 I... 1351 01:04:33,708 --> 01:04:34,908 Um... 1352 01:04:37,846 --> 01:04:39,514 I was the driver 1353 01:04:40,881 --> 01:04:42,851 of a car 1354 01:04:42,916 --> 01:04:44,952 that was in a really bad accident. 1355 01:04:47,955 --> 01:04:49,456 Two people died. 1356 01:04:52,960 --> 01:04:54,395 The woman was... 1357 01:04:57,998 --> 01:05:01,536 The woman was about to be my sister-in-law. 1358 01:05:05,305 --> 01:05:08,208 We were on our way to try on my wedding dresses. 1359 01:05:10,745 --> 01:05:12,446 [shudders] 1360 01:05:12,514 --> 01:05:13,581 And then we weren't. 1361 01:05:14,982 --> 01:05:16,383 It wasn't my fault. [sighs] 1362 01:05:17,719 --> 01:05:21,488 I wasn't on drugs or booze, or drunk, or anything. 1363 01:05:23,558 --> 01:05:24,692 But, uh... 1364 01:05:35,035 --> 01:05:39,039 [voice breaking] Surviving that day was, is... 1365 01:05:42,109 --> 01:05:44,011 the most painful thing 1366 01:05:44,077 --> 01:05:46,146 I will ever have to live through. 1367 01:05:48,382 --> 01:05:51,051 [sniffles] I got hurt, too. 1368 01:05:51,853 --> 01:05:53,621 They put a hole in my head. 1369 01:05:54,656 --> 01:05:56,457 And, um, [sniffles] 1370 01:05:56,524 --> 01:05:58,225 that helped because at least I had something 1371 01:05:58,292 --> 01:05:59,727 I could blame the pain on. 1372 01:06:02,329 --> 01:06:03,731 But then that healed... 1373 01:06:06,634 --> 01:06:08,202 and I was still hurting. 1374 01:06:09,970 --> 01:06:11,138 And I guess that's why I didn't realize 1375 01:06:11,205 --> 01:06:13,140 how bad it was because to me... 1376 01:06:13,207 --> 01:06:15,643 [breathes shakily] 1377 01:06:15,710 --> 01:06:17,211 I was still in so much pain. 1378 01:06:17,277 --> 01:06:20,380 -[shuddering] -[rubbing stomach] 1379 01:06:27,287 --> 01:06:30,457 I was, um, prescribed them for physical pain, 1380 01:06:30,525 --> 01:06:32,993 and they really helped with that. They really did. 1381 01:06:37,130 --> 01:06:39,734 But they made me numb. Blissfully numb. 1382 01:06:45,205 --> 01:06:47,107 Without them I want to die. 1383 01:06:48,408 --> 01:06:50,310 [sniffles] Every day. 1384 01:06:53,715 --> 01:06:56,718 I've never said that out loud before. [sobs] 1385 01:06:59,888 --> 01:07:01,021 Um... 1386 01:07:02,624 --> 01:07:05,660 I've never really faced reality without them. 1387 01:07:06,493 --> 01:07:07,962 [sniffling] 1388 01:07:08,028 --> 01:07:10,097 And I don't know if I'll be able to handle what I see, 1389 01:07:10,163 --> 01:07:13,601 but I'm here to try. 1390 01:07:18,238 --> 01:07:19,741 Okay. That's it. [sniffles] 1391 01:07:21,141 --> 01:07:23,578 That's it. [sighing heavily] 1392 01:07:27,180 --> 01:07:28,516 What happens now? 1393 01:07:29,851 --> 01:07:34,254 [breathing heavily] 1394 01:07:36,891 --> 01:07:39,661 [toy train horn tooting] 1395 01:07:44,766 --> 01:07:46,133 You made all of this? 1396 01:07:47,334 --> 01:07:51,039 Uh, I assembled it and designed it. 1397 01:07:51,104 --> 01:07:52,840 Yeah. 1398 01:07:52,907 --> 01:07:56,578 You see, the houses come as a kit. 1399 01:07:56,644 --> 01:07:59,547 You just assemble them and paint them... 1400 01:07:59,614 --> 01:08:02,349 Schoolhouse, I built from scratch. 1401 01:08:06,486 --> 01:08:09,991 Hey, there are two kids making out back here. 1402 01:08:10,058 --> 01:08:11,693 -That's me. -[chuckles] 1403 01:08:12,627 --> 01:08:14,696 -You were handsome. -[laughs] 1404 01:08:15,128 --> 01:08:16,296 And tiny. 1405 01:08:17,497 --> 01:08:21,435 Yeah, my very first kiss behind the schoolhouse. 1406 01:08:22,971 --> 01:08:24,539 Olivia Williams. 1407 01:08:26,239 --> 01:08:28,743 It was fall. Tip of her nose was cold. 1408 01:08:28,810 --> 01:08:29,978 [chuckles] 1409 01:08:30,044 --> 01:08:31,746 Little runny. 1410 01:08:31,813 --> 01:08:35,382 She stood on tiptoe. Tasted like bubble gum. 1411 01:08:36,350 --> 01:08:37,284 [Allison] Is that who you married? 1412 01:08:37,351 --> 01:08:39,286 No! No, no. 1413 01:08:39,353 --> 01:08:43,156 No, she dumped me the next day for Charlie Cook. 1414 01:08:43,223 --> 01:08:46,393 -Oh. -He smoked Camels. 1415 01:08:46,460 --> 01:08:50,098 And drove a Buick Riviera Roadmaster. 1416 01:08:50,163 --> 01:08:52,466 So, is this all inspired by your life? 1417 01:08:53,101 --> 01:08:54,301 Kinda. 1418 01:08:55,268 --> 01:08:57,170 Supposed to be South Orange. 1419 01:08:58,238 --> 01:08:59,473 I grew up here. 1420 01:09:00,842 --> 01:09:02,543 I was a cop in Newark. 1421 01:09:03,377 --> 01:09:04,846 I've always lived here. 1422 01:09:07,015 --> 01:09:08,215 Who's the soldier? 1423 01:09:08,883 --> 01:09:10,150 [Daniel] That's me. 1424 01:09:10,217 --> 01:09:12,654 Day I got home from Vietnam. 1425 01:09:13,855 --> 01:09:16,289 That other little figure there is my father. 1426 01:09:16,356 --> 01:09:19,627 He came down to the station to pick me up. 1427 01:09:19,694 --> 01:09:21,796 -This is incredible. -Mm. 1428 01:09:23,263 --> 01:09:25,033 How long did it take you? 1429 01:09:25,099 --> 01:09:27,035 Years. 1430 01:09:27,101 --> 01:09:29,403 I started with a single figure-eight 1431 01:09:30,071 --> 01:09:31,906 and a two-car train. 1432 01:09:32,774 --> 01:09:34,474 I work on it when I can. 1433 01:09:35,576 --> 01:09:37,545 Got more time now that I've retired. 1434 01:09:38,311 --> 01:09:40,180 My wife passed. 1435 01:09:40,247 --> 01:09:42,650 Ryan used to hang out with me down here. 1436 01:09:43,818 --> 01:09:46,788 She liked the whistle and the microphone. 1437 01:09:46,854 --> 01:09:48,089 There's a microphone? 1438 01:09:48,156 --> 01:09:49,590 Right over there. 1439 01:09:49,657 --> 01:09:51,125 How else you gonna tell your passengers 1440 01:09:51,191 --> 01:09:52,894 -that the train's coming? -[laughs] 1441 01:09:57,397 --> 01:09:59,266 [toy train horn tooting] 1442 01:09:59,332 --> 01:10:01,536 [chuckles] 1443 01:10:07,175 --> 01:10:09,010 [Allison singing "Take The Last Train to Clarksville"] 1444 01:10:09,077 --> 01:10:12,113 ♪ Take the last train to Clarksville ♪ 1445 01:10:12,180 --> 01:10:15,348 ♪ And I'll meet you at the station ♪ 1446 01:10:15,415 --> 01:10:18,052 ♪ You can be there by 4:30 ♪ 1447 01:10:18,119 --> 01:10:20,320 ♪ 'Cause I booked your reservation♪ 1448 01:10:20,387 --> 01:10:22,190 ♪ Don't be slow ♪ 1449 01:10:22,255 --> 01:10:24,291 [both singing] ♪ Oh no no no♪ 1450 01:10:24,357 --> 01:10:26,594 ♪ Oh no no no ♪ 1451 01:10:26,661 --> 01:10:28,863 ♪ And I don't know if I'm ever♪ 1452 01:10:28,930 --> 01:10:30,832 [both sing] ♪ Coming home ♪ 1453 01:10:30,898 --> 01:10:32,365 [Daniel laughs] 1454 01:10:32,432 --> 01:10:34,468 That was just a little serenade for your people 1455 01:10:34,535 --> 01:10:36,170 from the heavens above. 1456 01:10:36,236 --> 01:10:39,306 Think that's one of the reasons I enjoy it so much. 1457 01:10:39,372 --> 01:10:41,843 Why? 'Cause you get to play God? 1458 01:10:41,909 --> 01:10:45,780 Well, so much of my life has been outta control. 1459 01:10:47,915 --> 01:10:49,817 Down here, 1460 01:10:49,884 --> 01:10:52,987 I get to decide if Olivia chooses me. 1461 01:10:54,722 --> 01:10:56,724 I get to decide if my father comes 1462 01:10:56,791 --> 01:10:59,426 to pick me up at the station when I get home. 1463 01:11:00,327 --> 01:11:01,729 Did he? 1464 01:11:01,796 --> 01:11:02,830 No. 1465 01:11:04,832 --> 01:11:07,935 He was passed out drunk in our backyard. 1466 01:11:10,505 --> 01:11:13,406 He'd lain face down so long, 1467 01:11:14,542 --> 01:11:17,344 an inch of snow had gathered on his back. 1468 01:11:21,015 --> 01:11:23,851 Next morning at breakfast, he offered me a beer, 1469 01:11:25,385 --> 01:11:26,621 so... 1470 01:11:27,989 --> 01:11:30,558 I had a beer with him at breakfast, 1471 01:11:32,660 --> 01:11:34,327 and I never stopped. 1472 01:11:39,466 --> 01:11:41,536 When did you last talk to Nathan? 1473 01:11:46,073 --> 01:11:47,809 Daniel, this is God. 1474 01:11:47,875 --> 01:11:51,444 Allison would like you to change the conversation now. 1475 01:11:52,613 --> 01:11:54,549 -I'll bet she would. -[chuckles] 1476 01:11:54,615 --> 01:11:57,317 All right. Let's get outta here. 1477 01:11:58,052 --> 01:11:59,086 [switch clicks] 1478 01:12:02,757 --> 01:12:05,358 [music playing on headphones] 1479 01:12:08,596 --> 01:12:09,964 [Daniel] Ryan? 1480 01:12:10,031 --> 01:12:12,033 It's only one o'clock. Why are you home? 1481 01:12:12,099 --> 01:12:14,635 We had a half-day for the active shooter drill. 1482 01:12:14,702 --> 01:12:16,771 -I told you this morning. -[Daniel sighs] 1483 01:12:16,838 --> 01:12:20,041 Well, this is a friend of mine from the program. 1484 01:12:20,107 --> 01:12:21,042 Hi. 1485 01:12:22,243 --> 01:12:23,744 Hi. 1486 01:12:23,811 --> 01:12:25,813 -You should probably get going. -Yeah. Yeah. 1487 01:12:25,880 --> 01:12:27,515 I'm gonna go. 1488 01:12:27,582 --> 01:12:30,017 Wait, I know you from somewhere. 1489 01:12:30,084 --> 01:12:31,118 No, you don't. 1490 01:12:31,786 --> 01:12:32,520 You do? 1491 01:12:32,587 --> 01:12:34,222 How do I know you? 1492 01:12:34,288 --> 01:12:36,123 Uh... My... I'm... 1493 01:12:36,190 --> 01:12:37,490 I'm Allison. 1494 01:12:37,558 --> 01:12:39,293 Yeah, I've seen you before. 1495 01:12:39,392 --> 01:12:41,262 I thought you said the active shooter drill ended at 2:00. 1496 01:12:41,329 --> 01:12:43,631 Yeah, that's when the pretend shooter fights back. 1497 01:12:43,698 --> 01:12:45,867 Today, he shot himself, so we got out early. 1498 01:12:47,367 --> 01:12:48,703 Why do I know you? 1499 01:12:48,769 --> 01:12:50,271 I'm not sure what I'm supposed to say. 1500 01:12:50,338 --> 01:12:52,372 -You were Nathan's fiancee. -No. 1501 01:12:52,439 --> 01:12:53,875 -You were in the car. -No. 1502 01:12:53,941 --> 01:12:56,310 -I was, yeah. -Weren't you driving? 1503 01:12:56,376 --> 01:12:57,511 Wasn't she driving? 1504 01:12:57,578 --> 01:12:59,213 We're in the program together. 1505 01:12:59,280 --> 01:13:00,915 -But I thought you said it was her fault. -What? 1506 01:13:00,982 --> 01:13:03,217 How could you bring her into our house? 1507 01:13:03,284 --> 01:13:04,652 Get out of our fucking house! 1508 01:13:04,719 --> 01:13:06,587 -Okay. It's okay. -[Daniel] I'm sorry. I... 1509 01:13:06,654 --> 01:13:09,357 I'm so sorry. I thought you were in school. 1510 01:13:09,422 --> 01:13:10,925 You ruined my fucking life! 1511 01:13:10,992 --> 01:13:13,895 I know, I know, I know. I'm... I'm really sorry. 1512 01:13:13,961 --> 01:13:17,365 [crying] You shouldn't be here! This is our house! 1513 01:13:17,430 --> 01:13:18,833 My mom grew up in here! 1514 01:13:18,900 --> 01:13:20,735 I sleep in her bedroom. I use her sheets! 1515 01:13:20,801 --> 01:13:22,770 [Daniel] All right. All right. She's leaving. 1516 01:13:22,837 --> 01:13:24,939 Uh, just in case this is the last time 1517 01:13:25,006 --> 01:13:27,474 I ever get to talk to you, please know, 1518 01:13:29,043 --> 01:13:31,646 I also wish it was me. 1519 01:13:32,313 --> 01:13:33,714 Okay? I do. 1520 01:13:34,916 --> 01:13:36,150 I'm gonna go. 1521 01:13:36,217 --> 01:13:38,052 [voice breaking] I never got to say goodbye. 1522 01:13:39,220 --> 01:13:41,989 [Allison sighs] I know. 1523 01:13:45,226 --> 01:13:48,663 They were going to see a play. 1524 01:13:54,168 --> 01:13:55,503 I know. 1525 01:13:56,804 --> 01:13:58,406 She wanted to see a musical, 1526 01:13:58,471 --> 01:14:00,841 because she loved all the fancy costumes. 1527 01:14:05,713 --> 01:14:07,114 I didn't know that. 1528 01:14:07,181 --> 01:14:10,051 She said you made Nate really happy. 1529 01:14:10,117 --> 01:14:12,485 That you were the best thing that ever happened to him. 1530 01:14:13,554 --> 01:14:15,156 He made me happy, too. 1531 01:14:19,860 --> 01:14:22,096 [softly] Okay, I'm gonna go. 1532 01:14:22,897 --> 01:14:24,231 -[door opens] -Allison. 1533 01:14:27,034 --> 01:14:28,035 Yeah. 1534 01:14:29,203 --> 01:14:30,938 Would you like to stay for dinner? 1535 01:14:31,839 --> 01:14:33,040 What? 1536 01:14:34,842 --> 01:14:35,776 Uh... 1537 01:14:45,553 --> 01:14:48,990 So, you're an alcoholic, too? 1538 01:14:49,056 --> 01:14:50,257 [chidingly] Ryan. 1539 01:14:50,324 --> 01:14:51,592 Uh, no. 1540 01:14:52,760 --> 01:14:55,495 Alcohol's not exactly my problem. 1541 01:14:55,563 --> 01:14:57,398 -What is? Meth? -[Allison snorts] 1542 01:14:57,465 --> 01:14:58,632 Ryan. 1543 01:14:58,699 --> 01:15:02,003 No. Not meth. Um... 1544 01:15:04,872 --> 01:15:07,141 [smacks lips] Prescription painkillers. 1545 01:15:07,942 --> 01:15:08,843 Oxy. 1546 01:15:08,909 --> 01:15:10,578 How do you know about Oxy? 1547 01:15:10,644 --> 01:15:12,346 Kids at my school snort it. 1548 01:15:12,413 --> 01:15:13,447 It's heroin! 1549 01:15:13,514 --> 01:15:14,982 No, it's not. 1550 01:15:15,049 --> 01:15:16,250 I could get it easier than I could get a beer. 1551 01:15:16,317 --> 01:15:17,718 They sell it at Rite Aid. 1552 01:15:18,352 --> 01:15:19,720 [Daniel scoffs] 1553 01:15:19,787 --> 01:15:20,955 -So why'd you dump Uncle Nate? -Ryan. 1554 01:15:21,022 --> 01:15:22,490 [Ryan] He said you ghosted him. 1555 01:15:22,556 --> 01:15:23,724 It's not your business. 1556 01:15:23,791 --> 01:15:26,660 I just don't understand how 1557 01:15:26,727 --> 01:15:28,462 if he was gonna stay with you, 1558 01:15:28,529 --> 01:15:30,531 even after everything that happened, 1559 01:15:30,598 --> 01:15:31,766 why'd you dump him? 1560 01:15:33,034 --> 01:15:34,201 I was upset. 1561 01:15:38,239 --> 01:15:39,807 And so I ran. 1562 01:15:39,874 --> 01:15:41,575 -Like you, quitting soccer. -[curtly] Shut up! 1563 01:15:41,642 --> 01:15:43,444 You don't say "shut up" to me! 1564 01:15:43,512 --> 01:15:44,912 Ever again! 1565 01:15:47,648 --> 01:15:49,483 Why'd you quit soccer? 1566 01:15:49,550 --> 01:15:51,018 -She got into a fight. -'Cause I hate every girl on the team. 1567 01:15:51,085 --> 01:15:52,086 Oh. 1568 01:15:53,454 --> 01:15:55,890 Your parents were telling me how amazing you were. 1569 01:15:57,124 --> 01:15:58,893 -They were? -[Allison] Mm-hmm. 1570 01:15:58,959 --> 01:16:00,895 Your dad actually was saying 1571 01:16:00,961 --> 01:16:03,030 how you were definitely gonna get a scholarship. 1572 01:16:04,732 --> 01:16:06,567 I wanna go to Stanford. 1573 01:16:07,134 --> 01:16:08,636 [Daniel laughing] 1574 01:16:08,702 --> 01:16:10,271 Why are you laughing? 1575 01:16:12,139 --> 01:16:15,876 You quit the team, you're mouthing off in school, 1576 01:16:15,943 --> 01:16:17,378 and you're not doing your homework. 1577 01:16:17,445 --> 01:16:18,979 You're gonna get into Stanford? 1578 01:16:19,046 --> 01:16:20,714 I didn't say I quit the team permanently. 1579 01:16:20,781 --> 01:16:22,683 I said I wanted to take a break. 1580 01:16:22,750 --> 01:16:24,251 And I had a 4.0 down the shore. 1581 01:16:24,318 --> 01:16:26,287 I could get it back in a second if I cared. 1582 01:16:26,353 --> 01:16:27,522 Why don't you care? 1583 01:16:27,588 --> 01:16:28,722 Why, do you think? 1584 01:16:30,091 --> 01:16:31,659 -[Daniel] Shit. -[Allison] Okay. 1585 01:16:31,725 --> 01:16:33,094 Why don't we just call it a night, okay? 1586 01:16:33,160 --> 01:16:34,261 [Allison] Yeah, I'm gonna go home. 1587 01:16:39,100 --> 01:16:40,367 Hey, um... 1588 01:16:40,434 --> 01:16:41,769 [tears off page] 1589 01:16:43,771 --> 01:16:47,007 Um, just in case you, I don't know, 1590 01:16:48,776 --> 01:16:50,311 wanna talk, need to talk... 1591 01:16:51,679 --> 01:16:53,013 This is me. 1592 01:16:53,080 --> 01:16:54,982 And it's up to you, but I'm here. 1593 01:16:56,217 --> 01:16:57,318 Okay. 1594 01:16:58,219 --> 01:16:59,653 [receding footsteps] 1595 01:17:01,655 --> 01:17:03,424 [Daniel] I'm sorry about all that. 1596 01:17:03,491 --> 01:17:04,825 [Allison] Uh, it's fine. 1597 01:17:06,494 --> 01:17:08,329 You see what I'm dealing with. 1598 01:17:08,395 --> 01:17:09,997 Honestly, it's okay. 1599 01:17:10,898 --> 01:17:12,266 Look. [sighs] 1600 01:17:13,367 --> 01:17:15,302 She's a very fragile kid. 1601 01:17:16,605 --> 01:17:20,941 So, I'd appreciate it if you didn't contact her. 1602 01:17:22,676 --> 01:17:23,911 Oh. 1603 01:17:24,411 --> 01:17:25,412 Okay. 1604 01:17:26,847 --> 01:17:29,083 Yeah, I just... 1605 01:17:29,150 --> 01:17:32,286 [stuttering] I just wanted her to know that I was available 1606 01:17:32,353 --> 01:17:34,855 if she wanted to talk or anything. 1607 01:17:34,922 --> 01:17:37,191 I'm just asking if you will 1608 01:17:37,958 --> 01:17:39,760 please just let her be. 1609 01:17:40,427 --> 01:17:41,829 Scout's honor. 1610 01:17:41,896 --> 01:17:44,498 No, that's Spock's "Live long and prosper." 1611 01:17:44,566 --> 01:17:46,200 We Boy Scouts do this. 1612 01:17:46,267 --> 01:17:48,335 Oh. I prefer Spock. 1613 01:17:49,170 --> 01:17:51,038 Live long and prosper, Daniel. 1614 01:17:51,105 --> 01:17:52,339 -[Daniel] Good night. -Thank you. 1615 01:17:59,581 --> 01:18:02,249 [piano keyboard playing] 1616 01:18:08,289 --> 01:18:09,290 Mmm. 1617 01:18:13,327 --> 01:18:16,197 [humming] 1618 01:18:30,110 --> 01:18:32,713 [resumes playing keyboard] 1619 01:18:32,780 --> 01:18:36,317 [plays descending notes] 1620 01:18:36,383 --> 01:18:37,818 [keys clang] 1621 01:18:50,397 --> 01:18:51,498 [cell phone chimes] 1622 01:18:59,240 --> 01:19:01,308 [indistinct background chatter] 1623 01:19:22,463 --> 01:19:23,497 [chuckles] 1624 01:19:32,674 --> 01:19:34,008 [chuckling] 1625 01:19:42,216 --> 01:19:44,118 [crowd cheering and applauding] 1626 01:19:45,687 --> 01:19:47,689 Go, baby! I need you to be clear on one thing. 2260 01:54:04,713 --> 01:54:06,347 I loved you so much. 2261 01:54:09,751 --> 01:54:11,852 [tearfully] And along with everything else, 2262 01:54:13,053 --> 01:54:14,589 I will forever grieve 2263 01:54:14,656 --> 01:54:17,057 for the life that we might have had. King's laughing. 2280 01:55:08,375 --> 01:55:11,078 Your stories are foul. [chuckles] 2355 02:00:28,930 --> 02:00:30,798 When we first met in that diner, 2356 02:00:31,666 --> 02:00:34,334 you asked what my tattoo meant. 2357 02:00:34,401 --> 02:00:37,270 -Amor fati is Latin. -[typewriter clacking] 2358 02:00:37,337 --> 02:00:39,640 It means "to love one's fate." 2359 02:00:40,808 --> 02:00:43,778 Neither of us chose this fate, Allie. 2360 02:00:43,845 --> 02:00:46,514 But perhaps we can find a way to love it. 2361 02:00:47,915 --> 02:00:51,586 Fate has given me one final year with my son. 2362 02:00:51,652 --> 02:00:54,689 He looks at me differently these days. 2363 02:00:54,756 --> 02:00:57,759 Once in a while I even catch him smiling at me 2364 02:00:57,825 --> 02:01:01,495 with a look that might just even be love. 2365 02:01:02,563 --> 02:01:04,799 Amor fati, Allison. 2366 02:01:05,933 --> 02:01:07,434 Until we meet again, 2367 02:01:08,736 --> 02:01:09,737 Daniel. 2368 02:01:13,174 --> 02:01:14,374 [Ryan] Allie? 2369 02:01:14,842 Name: Jesus Revolution
Subtitle Data: ﻿1 00:00:36,670 --> 00:00:38,805 (MELLOW MUSIC PLAYING) 2 00:01:07,435 --> 00:01:08,903 (WAVES SPLASHING) 3 00:01:13,941 --> 00:01:15,977 JOSIAH: Some people say this is the end of an era. 4 00:01:16,010 --> 00:01:19,380 There are others that say this is the beginning of something new. 5 00:01:19,413 --> 00:01:20,847 Maybe you could help explain it. 6 00:01:21,881 --> 00:01:24,185 It's not something to explain. 7 00:01:24,218 --> 00:01:25,920 It's something to be experienced. 8 00:01:25,953 --> 00:01:30,458 What you're seeing is a symbol of new life. 9 00:01:30,490 --> 00:01:35,262 Every regret, every doubt, all washed away forever. 10 00:01:46,407 --> 00:01:47,975 Josiah. Reporter. 11 00:01:48,009 --> 00:01:49,443 Greg. 12 00:01:49,477 --> 00:01:52,079 JOSIAH: You know, people are calling this God's Forever Family. 13 00:01:52,113 --> 00:01:53,880 You a part of it? 14 00:01:53,914 --> 00:01:56,984 Is that what this is to you? Family? 15 00:01:57,817 --> 00:01:58,986 GREG: I don't know. I don't... 16 00:01:59,853 --> 00:02:03,057 really know what a family feels like. 17 00:02:03,090 --> 00:02:04,524 How'd you end up here? 18 00:02:08,728 --> 00:02:11,465 (ROCK 'N' ROLL MUSIC PLAYING) 19 00:02:11,499 --> 00:02:14,201 ♪ One, two, three, four... 20 00:02:14,235 --> 00:02:16,037 REPORTER 1: (ON TV) Anti-war demonstrators protest 21 00:02:16,070 --> 00:02:18,172 US involvement in the Vietnam War 22 00:02:18,205 --> 00:02:21,574 in mass marches, rallies and demonstrations. 23 00:02:21,608 --> 00:02:23,110 REPORTER 2: (ON TV) ...without any bell-bottoms, 24 00:02:23,144 --> 00:02:25,046 reporting live from San Francisco, 25 00:02:25,079 --> 00:02:27,982 the self-proclaimed hippie capital of the world 26 00:02:28,015 --> 00:02:30,051 where hundreds of thousands of youths 27 00:02:30,084 --> 00:02:33,254 have descended to join this growing youth movement. 28 00:02:33,287 --> 00:02:36,790 The words peace and love are used by them often. 29 00:02:36,823 --> 00:02:39,060 These kids call themselves hippies 30 00:02:39,093 --> 00:02:42,629 and represent a new form of rebellion against the status quo 31 00:02:42,662 --> 00:02:45,665 -(CHARLENE COUGHING) -and the so-called materialism of their parents. 32 00:02:45,698 --> 00:02:47,567 -CHARLENE: Gregory. -Their message to the world, 33 00:02:47,600 --> 00:02:49,904 "Turn on, tune in and drop out." 34 00:02:49,937 --> 00:02:52,006 ♪ I just want to celebrate yeah, yeah 35 00:02:52,039 --> 00:02:55,042 ♪ Another day of living, yeah 36 00:02:55,076 --> 00:03:00,647 ♪ I just want to celebrate another day of life 37 00:03:00,680 --> 00:03:02,917 ♪ Had my hand on the dollar bill 38 00:03:02,950 --> 00:03:05,752 ♪ And the dollar bill flew away 39 00:03:05,785 --> 00:03:08,755 ♪ But the sun is shining down on me 40 00:03:09,156 --> 00:03:10,224 (DOOR OPENS) 41 00:03:10,257 --> 00:03:11,559 NEWSCASTER: We can't relate to our families. 42 00:03:11,591 --> 00:03:12,826 Our fathers are always at work. 43 00:03:12,859 --> 00:03:14,528 So you finally turn on. 44 00:03:14,562 --> 00:03:15,728 CHARLENE: Gregory? 45 00:03:15,762 --> 00:03:17,764 -GREG: Be back later, Mom. -(DOOR CLOSES) 46 00:03:17,797 --> 00:03:20,501 REPORTER 2: The hippies present a social dilemma. 47 00:03:20,534 --> 00:03:21,936 The clothes they wear, 48 00:03:21,969 --> 00:03:24,871 the way they preach love as opposed to hate, 49 00:03:24,905 --> 00:03:26,907 peace as opposed to war. 50 00:03:26,941 --> 00:03:29,343 These beliefs set them up as rebels 51 00:03:29,376 --> 00:03:34,982 against a materialistic, square, old-fashioned society. 52 00:03:35,015 --> 00:03:37,351 REPORTER: (ON TV) Everywhere young people were turning on, 53 00:03:37,384 --> 00:03:38,651 dropping out. 54 00:03:38,685 --> 00:03:41,888 The hippies, pot, speed, acid. 55 00:03:41,922 --> 00:03:44,858 Alcohol seemed to take a back seat. 56 00:03:44,891 --> 00:03:47,561 JANETTE: You guys stare at that thing like the world is ending. 57 00:03:47,595 --> 00:03:49,629 I think the world is ending. 58 00:03:49,662 --> 00:03:52,632 JANETTE: Well, I think what they're doing is kinda beautiful. 59 00:03:53,300 --> 00:03:54,301 KAY: Honey? 60 00:03:55,402 --> 00:03:57,004 Are you doing drugs? 61 00:03:57,037 --> 00:03:59,106 No, Mom, I'm not doing drugs. 62 00:03:59,140 --> 00:04:00,374 Please stop asking. 63 00:04:00,407 --> 00:04:03,676 Look, what I'm saying is that they want peace and love. 64 00:04:03,710 --> 00:04:05,346 Isn't that the same thing you want? 65 00:04:05,379 --> 00:04:07,548 I think these kids need help. 66 00:04:07,581 --> 00:04:08,983 What they need is a bath. 67 00:04:09,950 --> 00:04:11,085 I don't know if they can be helped. 68 00:04:11,118 --> 00:04:12,920 JANETTE: See, and there's the problem. 69 00:04:12,953 --> 00:04:15,122 You're passing judgement on people you know nothing about. 70 00:04:15,156 --> 00:04:16,423 You've never even met a hippie. 71 00:04:16,457 --> 00:04:17,790 Thought they didn't talk to squares. 72 00:04:17,824 --> 00:04:19,059 Didn't you say I'm square? 73 00:04:19,093 --> 00:04:20,693 Dad, you are the very definition of a square. 74 00:04:20,727 --> 00:04:23,564 I'll tell you what, when God walks in here, brings me a hippie, 75 00:04:23,597 --> 00:04:26,799 I'll ask him what it's all about, because I do not understand. 76 00:04:26,833 --> 00:04:29,003 Maybe that's why your church is so empty. 77 00:04:29,904 --> 00:04:31,238 KAY: Where are you going? 78 00:04:31,272 --> 00:04:32,373 To do drugs. 79 00:04:32,406 --> 00:04:33,440 (DOOR CLOSES) 80 00:04:33,474 --> 00:04:34,674 (EXHALES) 81 00:04:36,876 --> 00:04:38,379 She is your daughter. 82 00:04:38,412 --> 00:04:43,850 ♪ Oh, I just want to celebrate another day of livin' 83 00:04:43,883 --> 00:04:51,058 ♪ I just want to celebrate another day of life 84 00:04:54,428 --> 00:04:57,531 STURGESS: Russia, Korea, Cambodia. 85 00:04:57,565 --> 00:04:59,866 If we don't stop the spread of communism, 86 00:04:59,899 --> 00:05:01,936 it will infect nations worldwide. 87 00:05:03,003 --> 00:05:05,506 It's called the domino theory. 88 00:05:05,539 --> 00:05:07,441 And it's the reason we're in Vietnam. 89 00:05:08,676 --> 00:05:10,211 (ALARM BLARING IN DISTANCE) 90 00:05:10,244 --> 00:05:13,047 That's a drill. Under your desk, everyone. 91 00:05:15,082 --> 00:05:18,452 Cadet Laurie, under your desk. 92 00:05:18,485 --> 00:05:20,187 Did you know that an atomic bomb 93 00:05:20,221 --> 00:05:23,958 has more power than 50 million tons of TNT? 94 00:05:23,991 --> 00:05:26,360 One blast would wipe out this entire city. 95 00:05:26,393 --> 00:05:27,428 Why do we do this? 96 00:05:28,629 --> 00:05:34,134 ♪ I just want to celebrate another day of livin' 97 00:05:34,168 --> 00:05:41,342 ♪ I just want to celebrate another day of life 98 00:05:43,876 --> 00:05:47,814 ♪ Said I just want to celebrate 99 00:05:47,847 --> 00:05:49,083 ♪ Celebrate 100 00:05:49,116 --> 00:05:52,752 ♪ I just want to celebrate 101 00:05:52,785 --> 00:05:54,588 ♪ I want to celebrate 102 00:05:54,622 --> 00:05:58,525 ♪ I just want to celebrate 103 00:05:58,559 --> 00:06:00,760 ♪ I got to celebrate ♪ 104 00:06:01,695 --> 00:06:02,895 CHERLIE: Hey. 105 00:06:04,365 --> 00:06:06,267 What's your deal, dude? 106 00:06:06,300 --> 00:06:09,036 What, are you a narc? 107 00:06:09,403 --> 00:06:10,437 What? 108 00:06:10,471 --> 00:06:13,407 Are you working for the feds? 109 00:06:15,109 --> 00:06:16,809 (CHUCKLES) 110 00:06:17,611 --> 00:06:18,845 I'm kidding with you, man. 111 00:06:18,878 --> 00:06:20,681 I'm Charlie. Nice to meet you, man. 112 00:06:20,714 --> 00:06:23,250 -I'm Greg. -Look at you, Greg. 113 00:06:23,284 --> 00:06:25,052 Shiny, sir. 114 00:06:25,085 --> 00:06:26,320 -(CHARLIE LAUGHS) -Okay. 115 00:06:29,723 --> 00:06:31,058 What are you looking at? 116 00:06:32,393 --> 00:06:34,827 Let me guess. Yep. 117 00:06:34,861 --> 00:06:36,630 -You want me to call her over here? -No, no, no... 118 00:06:36,664 --> 00:06:38,599 CHERLIE: She's a good friend of mine, man. 6

- Come on, let's do something fab.

Carol, we got to go.

Wait. Who's got the

13
00:03:21,440 --> 00:03:24,159
Baby, I've gone straight.

14

Forget it, he ain't got anything.

15

So you're not the king
of the street anymore?

16
00:03:31,640 --> 00:03:32,834

17

I'm not a Yugo!
I'm Swiss-Albanian.

18

00:03:40,600 --> 00:03:41,749
Awesome.

Kind of a retard
but he's got hot connections.

The mailman there. Do we know him?

Let's wait a bit.

25
00:04:34,840 --> 00:04:37,593
Hey, look: "May and
Analannabelle"...

26
00:04:38,520 --> 00:04:40,750
I get it: "Anal-Annabelle!
New and hot"

27
00:04:40,960 --> 00:04:42,951
in Zurich. "She really is new."

28
00:04:43,160 --> 00:04:47,233
Got to check her out.
By the way: What's up with Vera?

29
00:04:48,880 --> 00:04:51,872
You back together, or is she still
doing it with that other guy?

30
00:04:59,760 --> 00:05:02,433
Nice piece of tin they gave you.

31
00:05:02,640 --> 00:05:04,198
You know who it belongs to?

32
00:05:06,560 --> 00:05:08,551
Us, you know. The taxpayers!

33
00:05:17,960 --> 00:05:19,029
- So where is it?
- Man,

34
00:05:19,240 --> 00:05:21,920
I'm not a dealer. But a guy
I know will be here in a sec.

35
00:05:21,920 --> 00:05:22,750
Give me the money

36
00:05:23,600 --> 00:05:24,589
You think I'm dumb?

37
00:05:24,800 --> 00:05:27,394
Man, I'm doing you a huge favor here
and you're getting all worked up.

38
00:05:27,640 --> 00:05:30,108
Don't you get all worked up. You'll
get your money when the guy comes.

39
00:05:30,320 --> 00:05:31,389
Easy, man.

40
00:05:39,240 --> 00:05:40,434
That guy there!

41
00:05:41,160 --> 00:05:42,593
The one with the hairdo.

42
00:05:43,120 --> 00:05:45,270
Ain't that the Albanian, Berisha?

43
00:05:47,560 --> 00:05:49,915
All Albanians are named Berisha.

44
00:05:54,000 --> 00:05:55,797
But that's really him!

45
00:05:57,880 --> 00:06:01,236
Go in! Come on, go inside...

46
00:06:03,560 --> 00:06:04,549
Oh, forget it,

47
00:06:04,760 --> 00:06:06,478
he never goes in.

48
00:06:06,720 --> 00:06:07,914
Fucking shit!

49
00:06:08,160 --> 00:06:10,310
Well then, let's just grab
another of his boys

50
00:06:10,520 --> 00:06:12,511
and ship him back to Yugoland.

51
00:06:15,280 --> 00:06:17,555
Hey, Beko! Still at the post office?

52
00:06:22,840 --> 00:06:25,195
He's inside.
It's one of Berisha's guys!

53
00:06:25,960 --> 00:06:27,871
Fuck the post office.

54
00:06:28,960 --> 00:06:31,110
Can you do me a favor?

55
00:06:33,360 --> 00:06:35,954
I promised the girl something.

56
00:06:36,240 --> 00:06:40,677
We told you you should
get in with us, but you

57
00:06:40,880 --> 00:06:45,476
listened to your mother. Now don't
you tell me the post office is shit.

58
00:06:50,320 --> 00:06:51,514
Wait here.

59
00:06:53,800 --> 00:06:56,314
There's four of them.
Two junkies, a mailman and a Yugo.

60
00:06:56,520 --> 00:06:57,873
Cover the back and wait for us.

61
00:07:05,760 --> 00:07:08,752
- Good day, City Police!
- Everyone stay calm.

62
00:07:08,960 --> 00:07:10,473
Hands on the table!

63
00:07:12,840 --> 00:07:15,593
- Piss off! Fucking cop! Let go!
- Hey! Let her go!

64
00:07:17,640 --> 00:07:19,631
Damn it, we're not here for you!

65
00:07:19,840 --> 00:07:21,353
Fuck you! I'm not going with you!

66
00:07:29,520 --> 00:07:30,475
The cops!

67
00:07:51,160 --> 00:07:52,195
Damn it!

68
00:07:52,440 --> 00:07:54,431
Have you lost it?
Just standing around?

69
00:07:55,000 --> 00:07:57,673
I said cover the back!
What was that shit?

70
00:07:57,880 --> 00:08:00,110
Fucking bullshit! You bastard!

71
00:08:38,920 --> 00:08:40,194
Damn!

72
00:08:50,280 --> 00:08:51,679
What do we have here?

73
00:08:52,200 --> 00:08:54,031
Him again! What do I know?

74
00:08:59,520 --> 00:09:01,192
What do you know about the other guy?

75
00:09:01,480 --> 00:09:03,596
Berisha? Is he the boss
of the one who just split?

76
00:09:03,800 --> 00:09:06,075
What do you want?
All Albanians are named Berisha.

77
00:09:06,720 --> 00:09:07,709
This guy!

78
00:09:09,800 --> 00:09:11,631
Man, I'm Beko. I know them all.

79
00:09:11,840 --> 00:09:13,239
- But not that one.
- Don't lie to me!

80
00:09:13,440 --> 00:09:15,749
Why are you asking me then?
Ain't you the super cop?

81
00:09:16,800 --> 00:09:20,236
Listen up, Beko:
It's a jungle out there.

82
00:09:20,440 --> 00:09:22,237
The big fish eat up the small ones.

83
00:09:22,440 --> 00:09:24,396
Unless you're a piranha.
And that you're not!

84
00:09:25,960 --> 00:09:27,313
Man, what's this whole fish thing?

85
00:09:27,560 --> 00:09:31,917
Reported for theft, assault... You're
one of Berisha's dealers. Just admit it.

86
00:09:32,120 --> 00:09:34,236
Man, no way!
Everyone fucks up a little

87
00:09:34,440 --> 00:09:35,759
when they're young.

88
00:09:36,000 --> 00:09:37,353
But those times are over.

89
00:09:37,600 --> 00:09:39,240
I went to school in Switzerland!

90
00:09:39,240 --> 00:09:41,515
Am I supposed to lie
and say I'm not working

91
00:09:41,720 --> 00:09:43,711
at the post office?
- You got in my way, man.

92
00:09:44,160 --> 00:09:46,200
That's aiding and abetting. Got it?

93
00:09:46,200 --> 00:09:48,668
That'll get you at
least one night in jail.

94
00:09:48,960 --> 00:09:52,350
If I don't go to work tonight, my boss
won't just see me as the foreigner.

95
00:09:52,560 --> 00:09:53,959
I'll be the lawbreaking foreigner.

96
00:09:54,400 --> 00:09:55,719
Uh, Dani...

97
00:09:55,960 --> 00:09:59,157
Could you give his mom a quick call
and check that out with his employer?

98
00:10:01,840 --> 00:10:04,877
Liens, liens, liens...

99
00:10:05,280 --> 00:10:08,397
How can a junkie like you
be stuck with so many liens?

100
00:10:08,640 --> 00:10:10,995
Hey, it's not my fault.

101
00:10:13,640 --> 00:10:16,393
You know, once I had a
real cool bicycle workshop,

102
00:10:17,680 --> 00:10:21,639
with super exclusive bikes. And then
they just took it all away from me.

103
00:10:25,360 --> 00:10:27,954
Fuck! But you know what?

104
00:10:29,120 --> 00:10:32,078
- I'm going to get it back again.
- You always buy your dope from Beko?

105
00:10:33,440 --> 00:10:34,714
Definitely not.

106
00:10:35,640 --> 00:10:40,236
Carol and I only went in there
because... Galatassaray was playing.

107
00:10:46,680 --> 00:10:48,352
Is she your girlfriend?

108
00:10:52,760 --> 00:10:53,715
Yeah.

109
00:10:56,800 --> 00:10:58,631
Man, I'm not a dealer.

110
00:10:58,960 --> 00:11:00,951
But that junkie chick,
she's totally hot.

111
00:11:01,200 --> 00:11:05,159
Don't you think? She's a bit doped up,
but act a little nice, and then...

112
00:11:07,720 --> 00:11:09,756
Did you know Beko's keen on Carol?

113
00:11:13,520 --> 00:11:14,748
Well... why not?

114
00:11:15,840 --> 00:11:19,116
Beko's a happening guy,
always got a good supply...

115
00:11:19,400 --> 00:11:21,595
But he just took the cash,
and then you guys showed up!

116
00:11:27,800 --> 00:11:29,916
And who'd he get the dope from?

117
00:11:31,480 --> 00:11:33,152
How should I know.

118
00:11:35,080 --> 00:11:37,036
From the Albanian.

119
00:11:41,120 --> 00:11:43,475
Why do you want to lock up Beko?

120
00:11:43,920 --> 00:11:47,435
If he's with them, we need him out
there so we can shadow him.

121
00:11:47,640 --> 00:11:50,313
With him alone, you don't stand
a chance with the prosecutor.

122
00:12:08,320 --> 00:12:10,959
- Going cold turkey?
- You crazy?

123
00:12:11,480 --> 00:12:13,357
Look, not a single one!

124
00:12:13,640 --> 00:12:15,312
And how about the ecstasy tabs?

125
00:12:16,640 --> 00:12:19,552
Him again.
That's personal consumption.

126
00:12:20,480 --> 00:12:21,595
I want out of here!

127
00:12:25,800 --> 00:12:27,472
Fuck you

128
00:12:27,560 --> 00:12:29,312
We've got a problem with you.

129
00:12:29,560 --> 00:12:31,391
Man, can't you read!

130
00:12:32,400 --> 00:12:35,120
We have to send you back
to Oberkirch Reform School.

131
00:12:35,120 --> 00:12:36,599
You've run
away three times.

132
00:12:37,200 --> 00:12:38,474
Shit, man!

133
00:12:39,440 --> 00:12:41,954
I'm getting thrown in the reformatory.
I'll hang myself in there!

134
00:12:42,320 --> 00:12:44,390
But hanging out in dealer joints,
that's okay?

135
00:12:44,600 --> 00:12:46,511
None of your business. Fuck you.

136
00:12:50,000 --> 00:12:51,831
What put you in reform school?

137
00:12:52,080 --> 00:12:55,595
Stole a piece of candy.
Should I scream again?

138
00:12:56,600 --> 00:12:58,272
If it does you good...

139
00:13:18,960 --> 00:13:20,757
From my end, you can go.

140
00:13:21,760 --> 00:13:23,113
You crazy?

141
00:13:23,760 --> 00:13:25,557
Oberkirch is bullshit.

142
00:13:32,480 --> 00:13:34,680
Can't you just totally
delete my record?

143
00:13:34,680 --> 00:13:35,157
Get lost!

144
00:13:49,240 --> 00:13:50,434
Damn it!

145
00:14:06,960 --> 00:14:08,279
And? You guys happy?

146
00:14:10,240 --> 00:14:14,870
10 grams of heroin, no dealer,
a little Albanian in jail

147
00:14:15,480 --> 00:14:17,835
and a bungled job. And you, Marco,

148
00:14:18,040 --> 00:14:19,393
what a screw-up!

149
00:14:19,600 --> 00:14:21,875
You're the one who was so gung-ho!

150
00:14:22,160 --> 00:14:23,513
That kind of thing can happen.

151
00:14:23,720 --> 00:14:27,429
No! It doesn't happen to me! Know why?
'Cause I take this shit seriously!

152
00:14:27,760 --> 00:14:29,830
Calm down. The lake beat guy's coming.

153
00:14:30,040 --> 00:14:33,874
Fuck the lake beat guy!
This place is nothing but crap!

154
00:14:38,040 --> 00:14:40,349
Beat Schuppisser from the lake police.

155
00:14:42,040 --> 00:14:43,951
"Asked to switch to narcotics."

156
00:14:44,440 --> 00:14:46,670
"You can learn a lot from Strähl"

157
00:14:46,880 --> 00:14:49,075
but remember:
I'm in charge here,

158
00:14:49,280 --> 00:14:50,315
not him.

159
00:14:52,480 --> 00:14:53,879
- Hello.
- Good luck!

160
00:14:54,120 --> 00:14:55,394
Ruedi. Break a leg.

161
00:14:56,160 --> 00:14:58,116
And here's our little Strähl!

162
00:15:01,440 --> 00:15:02,668
Is that necessary?

163
00:15:03,680 --> 00:15:05,796
I figured if he can survive you,

164
00:15:06,320 --> 00:15:08,231
then he'll survive the job.

165
00:15:09,120 --> 00:15:10,599
Goodbye then.

166
00:15:12,520 --> 00:15:14,909
A guy's got a private life too,
you know.

167
00:15:18,840 --> 00:15:21,912
And there's no dealing
after six either, right?

168
00:15:53,840 --> 00:15:57,037
- Come on, give me a little too.
- Why don't you ask Fritz?

169
00:15:58,720 --> 00:16:00,995
Please, give me a little bit.

170
00:16:01,280 --> 00:16:02,838
I don't have any more.

171
00:16:19,240 --> 00:16:21,356
Come on, let's go or they'll
lock us up.

172
00:16:21,560 --> 00:16:24,791
Yeah, come on, René.
Fritz has got ecstasy at home.

173
00:16:25,000 --> 00:16:27,309
This constant oppression
is killing me.

174
00:16:27,520 --> 00:16:29,351
Really don't have any more?

175
00:16:31,520 --> 00:16:32,475
Hey Anz...

176
00:16:33,960 --> 00:16:37,509
Shit, Anz is totally out.

177
00:16:46,920 --> 00:16:49,150
- Don't you want to share?
- Hey! You nuts?

178
00:16:49,680 --> 00:16:52,558
We outsiders have got to stick
together.

179
00:16:57,680 --> 00:16:59,113
Fucking wild!

180
00:16:59,520 --> 00:17:00,748
A grenade.

181
00:17:01,160 --> 00:17:02,559
A hand grenade.

182
00:17:05,720 --> 00:17:06,948
Let me see.

183
00:17:07,320 --> 00:17:11,074
Don't worry,
he's done that to me before too.

184
00:17:11,280 --> 00:17:12,998
Let me see the grenade.

185
00:17:13,240 --> 00:17:16,835
- No, leave it alone or it'll go off.
- Come on, let me see!

186
00:17:44,240 --> 00:17:45,593
Hey, Flaky,

187
00:17:47,520 --> 00:17:50,592
did you leave the lake
'cause you don't like fish?

188
00:17:51,320 --> 00:17:53,520
No, I just want to be
where things are happening

189
00:17:53,520 --> 00:17:54,873
and where I can help people.

190
00:17:58,760 --> 00:18:00,751
With us narcs, ain't much happening.

191
00:18:02,080 --> 00:18:04,310
We mainly deal with garbage.

192
00:18:06,800 --> 00:18:09,473
I prefer fish. Piranhas.

193
00:18:10,520 --> 00:18:12,192
They eat the garbage.

194
00:18:15,760 --> 00:18:17,512
Come on, I'll show you.

195
00:18:28,920 --> 00:18:30,751
What're you looking for? I'm all out.

196
00:18:35,960 --> 00:18:37,188
And what's that?

197
00:18:37,760 --> 00:18:40,479
- That's just personal consumption.
- Nope.

198
00:18:41,240 --> 00:18:44,550
To consume that you have to tell me
who's Berisha's new man.

199
00:18:45,440 --> 00:18:47,080
Hey, leave me alone,
I don't know.

200
00:18:47,080 --> 00:18:48,991
It's way dangerous
with these Albanians.

201
00:18:50,200 --> 00:18:53,078
But you locked up René today.

202
00:18:53,360 --> 00:18:55,828
- Didn't you find his hand grenade?
- Grenade?

203
00:18:56,280 --> 00:18:57,156
Don't fuck with me!

204
00:18:57,360 --> 00:18:59,669
Dangerous having a grenade around!

205
00:18:59,880 --> 00:19:02,314
Just imagine what could happen.

206
00:19:03,680 --> 00:19:05,796
The idiot doesn't know anything.
Let's go.

207
00:19:06,120 --> 00:19:07,960
Uh, but... don't we have
to do something

208
00:19:07,960 --> 00:19:09,951
if there's a grenade
going 'round the scene?

209
00:19:11,400 --> 00:19:12,200
Listen, Flaky.

210
00:19:12,200 --> 00:19:15,317
Join the UN peacekeepers
if you want to hunt grenades.

211
00:19:15,520 --> 00:19:17,875
We narcs have more
important stuff to do.

212
00:19:38,040 --> 00:19:40,190
The guy there with the hairdo.

213
00:19:40,880 --> 00:19:42,359
That's Berisha.

214
00:19:43,160 --> 00:19:44,229
The pig...

215
00:19:45,640 --> 00:19:46,789
Lives around here,

216
00:19:47,000 --> 00:19:50,680
two kids, a big fat wife, a big fat
Mercedes and a big fat business.

217
00:19:50,680 --> 00:19:51,590
And we only manage

218
00:19:51,800 --> 00:19:53,756
to nab his errand boys
with a few grams.

219
00:19:55,360 --> 00:19:55,758
Damn it!

220
00:20:00,960 --> 00:20:02,518
So what do we do now?

221
00:20:03,320 --> 00:20:04,070
Nothing!

222
00:20:05,400 --> 00:20:09,678
No mobile, no telephone, no bank
account. He never touches the dope.

223
00:20:09,960 --> 00:20:12,633
And we don't know where he
stashes his big deliveries.

224
00:20:12,920 --> 00:20:16,435
Why don't we just collect the few grams we
get from his boys until it's a few kilos

225
00:20:16,640 --> 00:20:19,074
and then throw it in his car
and arrest him?

226
00:20:26,360 --> 00:20:27,270
Mr. Brunner?

227
00:20:28,040 --> 00:20:29,678
Yes, sir, everything's okay.

228
00:20:52,440 --> 00:20:54,556
Come on, let's do a Smarties oracle.

229
00:20:55,400 --> 00:20:58,073
And then we'll go out
and do some ecstasy.

230
00:21:07,280 --> 00:21:12,434
Okay, I'll shake up the Smarties, then
you take the first five without looking

231
00:21:12,800 --> 00:21:14,279
and that's your future...

232
00:21:14,760 --> 00:21:15,636
Such bullshit...

233
00:21:15,960 --> 00:21:17,393
Take five without looking.

234
00:21:22,080 --> 00:21:23,433
Awesome!

235
00:21:23,880 --> 00:21:27,634
Three green. Green's for professional
success, and you just got three.

236
00:21:28,720 --> 00:21:31,837
Purple is for wild times
and red for love...

237
00:21:33,880 --> 00:21:36,440
Swallow them or it won't work.

238
00:21:41,000 --> 00:21:43,753
- Now what?
- Are you stupid? You know...

239
00:21:45,040 --> 00:21:46,553
Professional success.

240
00:21:47,360 --> 00:21:49,430
Your dream's going to come true.

241
00:21:50,520 --> 00:21:53,876
You'll pay back your debts and
reopen your bike workshop,

242
00:21:54,080 --> 00:21:56,120
but this time much
cooler than before,

243
00:21:56,120 --> 00:21:58,588
and everyone'll want the
<<René special>> bike.

244
00:21:59,280 --> 00:22:03,592
Wild times: That's obvious, 'cause
we're going out to do some ecstasy.

245
00:22:04,960 --> 00:22:06,188
And love.

246
00:22:08,320 --> 00:22:11,835
- Because it's all with me.
- You don't even believe that yourself.

247
00:22:13,000 --> 00:22:16,310
But you swallowed them.
It's already happened!

248
00:22:18,920 --> 00:22:21,195
You're the best thing
that ever happened to me.

249
00:22:30,400 --> 00:22:32,152
What's up? You upset?

250
00:22:32,920 --> 00:22:35,878
Did you have to tell Brunner
about this hand grenade?

251
00:22:37,080 --> 00:22:38,832
You're starting to piss me off!

252
00:23:09,360 --> 00:23:10,315
Heinz!

253
00:23:10,720 --> 00:23:13,792
- Come on in!
- You think this is the right apartment?

254
00:23:14,600 --> 00:23:16,431
I didn't hear you ring.

255
00:23:18,080 --> 00:23:19,195
You got the money?

256
00:23:31,480 --> 00:23:33,357
Let's just cuddle!

257
00:23:35,720 --> 00:23:36,709
Fuck.

258
00:23:38,960 --> 00:23:42,873
You're so boring, you and your heroin.
If we'd only left.

259
00:23:44,640 --> 00:23:46,835
What's the matter? What'd I do wrong?

260
00:23:48,160 --> 00:23:49,639
- Police! Stay calm!
- Man,

261
00:23:49,840 --> 00:23:51,637
you again, fucking cop! Get lost!

262
00:23:51,840 --> 00:23:54,513
- Where's this fucking hand grenade?
- Damn it, we don't have one.

263
00:23:54,720 --> 00:23:55,948
Where is it?

264
00:23:56,240 --> 00:23:59,676
- Come on, this is pissing me off.
- Go fuck your grenade!

265
00:24:01,520 --> 00:24:03,078
Fucking bastard!

266
00:24:03,400 --> 00:24:06,073
Are you crazy?
That's totally dangerous!

267
00:24:11,800 --> 00:24:12,710
You fucking bastard!

268
00:24:27,920 --> 00:24:29,512
Stop or I'll jump!

269
00:24:35,520 --> 00:24:37,112
You fucking bastard!

270
00:24:44,880 --> 00:24:47,838
So what made that junkie
jump out the window?

271
00:24:48,040 --> 00:24:49,439
How should I know?

272
00:24:50,120 --> 00:24:51,792
Because junkies are a bit stupid?

273
00:24:52,400 --> 00:24:56,188
Listen! Wehrli said you threw him
out of the window. And Schuppisser

274
00:24:56,480 --> 00:24:57,480
saw him flying as well.

275
00:24:57,480 --> 00:24:59,357
You can screw
Schuppisser for all I care

276
00:24:59,600 --> 00:25:03,195
Whatever. Another complaint
against you is one too many.

277
00:25:05,440 --> 00:25:06,634
You're suspended.

278
00:25:09,200 --> 00:25:11,240
And if Wehrli sticks
by his statement,

279
00:25:11,240 --> 00:25:13,708
that's the nail in
the coffin for your career.

280
00:25:15,280 --> 00:25:18,192
You don't mean to say you believe
the junkie and not me?

281
00:25:18,680 --> 00:25:22,195
Listen, Strähl... It doesn't
matter who I believe.

282
00:25:22,480 --> 00:25:25,790
You've got to protect people and
not throw them out of the window or

283
00:25:26,000 --> 00:25:27,115

284
00:25:32,080 --> 00:25:34,036
What's the matter with you anyway?

285
00:25:35,120 --> 00:25:37,395
Dr. Arbenz didn't help any?

286
00:25:39,200 --> 00:25:41,873
Dr. Arbenz is a shit for brains
doctor.

287
00:25:44,640 --> 00:25:46,676
You'll never manage without me!

288
00:25:49,120 --> 00:25:51,793
Never heard we help
each other out around here?

289
00:25:52,080 --> 00:25:54,514
Did you just let your colleagues
at the lake drown too?

290
00:25:54,720 --> 00:25:56,517
Leave him alone! It's not his fault.

291
00:27:04,960 --> 00:27:06,473
You know how much

292
00:27:06,680 --> 00:27:09,752
Strähl would have to pay me in damages
if we were in the States?

293
00:27:11,200 --> 00:27:14,351
Then I'd already be
general importer for Cannondale...

294
00:27:14,600 --> 00:27:16,591
- You insane? Damn!
- Hey, what's the problem?

295
00:27:16,800 --> 00:27:18,950
- You stupid fucking junkie!
- Man! Let him go, fucking cop!

296
00:27:19,160 --> 00:27:21,230
Yeah! Thanks to you,
I'm fully disabled!

297
00:27:21,440 --> 00:27:24,000
Go now and retract
your false statement.

298

299
00:27:26,600 --> 00:27:28,431
You insane? You're coming with me!

300
00:27:28,680 --> 00:27:32,753
Here's a totally whacked ex-drug cop
beating up an innocent victim.

301
00:27:34,320 --> 00:27:36,151
And on top of that,
he's a pill addict!

302
00:27:37,040 --> 00:27:38,439
Fucking junkie!

303
00:27:40,160 --> 00:27:42,913
- Fuck you! You're not a real cop anyway!

304
00:27:43,320 --> 00:27:45,390
And I want damages!

305
00:28:57,880 --> 00:28:59,233

306
00:28:59,480 --> 00:29:00,913
Where do you think? To work!

307
