don't be scarified.

176
00:10:34,592 --> 00:10:36,676
The front of me's
not coming out.

177
00:10:36,761 --> 00:10:38,637
And the back of me's
not coming out.

178
00:10:38,721 --> 00:10:41,640
And neither is my middle.

179
00:10:46,854 --> 00:10:48,313
Who turned out the lights?

180
00:10:53,402 --> 00:10:55,820
-It's a Spookable! Help!
-Spookables! Run!

181
00:10:55,905 --> 00:10:57,989
-Help!
-Oh, my!

182
00:11:04,413 --> 00:11:07,540
Ah, well, that's more like it.

183
00:11:08,167 --> 00:11:11,461
I guess I taught him
a lesson or two.

184
00:11:12,129 --> 00:11:13,963
Please come out, Lumpy.

185
00:11:14,048 --> 00:11:16,841
I thought we were gonna
spend Halloween together?

186
00:11:16,926 --> 00:11:19,594
You can come under
here if you want.

187
00:11:23,891 --> 00:11:26,101
You guys go ahead.

188
00:11:27,103 --> 00:11:29,562
I'll stay here with Lumpy.

189
00:11:35,820 --> 00:11:38,279
It's OK, Lumpy.

190
00:11:38,364 --> 00:11:42,492
I was just really looking forward
to trick-or-treating together.

191
00:11:44,328 --> 00:11:46,830
Lumpy! You're not
hiding anymore.

192
00:11:46,914 --> 00:11:49,958
-Aren't you afraid?
-Oh, I still am.

193
00:11:50,042 --> 00:11:51,835
But as long as we're together,

194
00:11:51,919 --> 00:11:53,878
I can be brave.

195
00:11:53,963 --> 00:11:56,506
-Hooray for Lumpy!
-Good for you!

196
00:11:56,590 --> 00:11:58,341
That's what I'm talking about!

197
00:11:58,426 --> 00:12:01,219
Well, this calls
for a celebration.

198
00:12:01,303 --> 00:12:03,346
Piglet, fetch some candy.

199
00:12:03,431 --> 00:12:05,098
Yes, sir. Rabbit, sir.

200
00:12:09,019 --> 00:12:10,687
Yes, I know.

201
00:12:10,771 --> 00:12:12,397
You're all surprised.

202
00:12:12,481 --> 00:12:15,650
"No candy until
tonight," I said.

203
00:12:15,735 --> 00:12:18,903
But special occasions
call for sweets.

204
00:12:18,988 --> 00:12:21,823
So, Piglet, one piece
of candy each.

205
00:12:23,367 --> 00:12:26,494
-Rabbit?
-Yes, Piglet. The candy, if you please.

206
00:12:26,579 --> 00:12:28,663
Oh, dear. That's just it.

207
00:12:28,748 --> 00:12:30,790
Well, what is it, Piglet?
Spit it out!

208
00:12:30,875 --> 00:12:35,211
Well, there's no candy
left, Rabbit, sir.

209
00:12:35,296 --> 00:12:37,464
What do you mean,
"no candy left"?

210
00:12:37,548 --> 00:12:39,883
There's sacks and sacks
of it over there.

211
00:12:40,843 --> 00:12:43,970
Pooh Bear? You ate
all our candy?

212
00:12:44,054 --> 00:12:46,639
Mighty impressive for
one bear, though.

213
00:12:46,724 --> 00:12:48,391
I don't know how it happened.

214
00:12:48,476 --> 00:12:50,769
I only wanted one, but...

215
00:12:50,895 --> 00:12:53,521
...my tummy kept
asking for more.

216
00:12:54,899 --> 00:12:57,984
There's gotta be some
left here somewhere.

217
00:12:58,068 --> 00:13:00,403
We can't have Halloween
without candy.

218
00:13:00,488 --> 00:13:03,364
Well, I'll betcha Rabbit has
a few sweets tucked away.

219
00:13:03,449 --> 00:13:05,492
Don't ya, Long-Ears?

220
00:13:05,618 --> 00:13:07,952
I'm afraid not, Tigger.

221
00:13:14,877 --> 00:13:17,796
You see, I've collected
every bit of candy

222
00:13:17,880 --> 00:13:19,756
from the Hundred Acre Wood.

223
00:13:19,840 --> 00:13:22,133
I'm afraid...

224
00:13:22,259 --> 00:13:26,137
...there will be no trick-or-treating
this year. Oh, dear.

225
00:13:26,180 --> 00:13:28,890
Oh, bother.

226
00:13:28,974 --> 00:13:31,392
My tummy says it's sorry.

227
00:13:34,188 --> 00:13:37,106
I wish there was some way
we can get more candy.

228
00:13:37,191 --> 00:13:40,109
"Wish"? Maybe there is a way.

229
00:13:40,194 --> 00:13:42,320
Remember Tigger's story?

230
00:13:42,404 --> 00:13:44,030
If we catch the Gobloon,

231
00:13:44,114 --> 00:13:46,533
we could wish for enough
candy for everyone.

232
00:13:46,659 --> 00:13:48,952
Yeah! We can save Halloween.

233
00:13:49,036 --> 00:13:53,498
But if the Gobloon caught us,
we'd be jaggedy lanterns.

234
00:13:55,543 --> 00:13:57,585
Don't worry. I'll
be right there.

235
00:13:57,670 --> 00:13:59,212
I won't let him hurt you.

236
00:14:03,008 --> 00:14:04,384
OK, Lumpy,

237
00:14:04,468 --> 00:14:07,345
let's just go find some
costumes for tonight.

238
00:14:07,429 --> 00:14:10,598
Yes, Roo, let us do so.

239
00:14:10,683 --> 00:14:12,767
That's the spirit.

240
00:14:12,852 --> 00:14:15,353
We can still have
fun without candy.

241
00:14:15,980 --> 00:14:19,524
And don't forget, be back
promptly at the stroke of sunset.

242
00:14:19,608 --> 00:14:20,817
We will!

243
00:14:30,703 --> 00:14:33,329
Now, what did Tigger say again?
Oh, yeah.

244
00:14:33,414 --> 00:14:35,540
First we gotta find
the Creepy Cave,

245
00:14:35,624 --> 00:14:39,294
then the Slimy Slide and then.
..

246
00:14:39,420 --> 00:14:43,214
-The Tree of Terror.
-Oh, right. The Tree of Terror.

247
00:14:43,340 --> 00:14:44,674
Thanks, Lumpy. Come on!

248
00:14:44,758 --> 00:14:48,011
We're gonna make this the
best Halloween ever.

249
00:14:48,095 --> 00:14:51,389
Take that! And that! And that!

250
00:14:51,473 --> 00:14:53,766
I proclaim Lumpy and Roo

251
00:14:53,851 --> 00:14:56,603
to be the floundering
members of the...

252
00:14:58,731 --> 00:15:00,857
Bravest of the brave?

253
00:15:00,941 --> 00:15:04,736
The Bravest of the Brave
Gobloon Catchers' Club.

254
00:15:04,820 --> 00:15:07,989
Brave together! Brave forever!

255
00:15:08,073 --> 00:15:10,575
Conquerors of the Gobloon!

256
00:15:11,201 --> 00:15:12,243
Now shake.

257
00:15:15,873 --> 00:15:18,124
No, no! Shake hands.

258
00:15:18,208 --> 00:15:20,627
That means we stick
together, no matter what.

259
00:15:20,711 --> 00:15:23,171
What are we waiting for?
Let's go!

260
00:15:27,217 --> 00:15:31,471
We're friends forever
We'll be brave together

261
00:15:31,555 --> 00:15:35,850
We can weather
whatever comes along

262
00:15:36,477 --> 00:15:38,144
One can do it Two is better

263
00:15:38,228 --> 00:15:40,188
You and me together forever

264
00:15:40,272 --> 00:15:42,398
Braver than brave
Stronger than strong

265
00:15:42,483 --> 00:15:44,192
Brave together Singing our song

266
00:15:44,276 --> 00:15:46,861
-We're friends forever
-One can do it, two is better

267
00:15:46,946 --> 00:15:49,113
-We'll be brave together
-You and me together forever

268
00:15:49,198 --> 00:15:51,324
Braver than brave
Stronger than strong

269
00:15:51,408 --> 00:15:53,409
Brave together Singing our song

270
00:15:53,494 --> 00:15:55,370
Rumple de doodle Rumple dee dee

271
00:15:55,496 --> 00:15:57,789
We'll rumble and tumble
like bumbly bees

272
00:15:57,873 --> 00:15:59,958
Two together Together we're one

273
00:16:00,042 --> 00:16:02,335
Rumple de doodle
De doodle de dum

274
00:16:02,419 --> 00:16:04,253
-You're my buddy
-You're mine too

275
00:16:04,380 --> 00:16:06,673
-If I get scared
-I'm right behind you

276
00:16:06,757 --> 00:16:11,177
lt would be super if we could be
the bravest friends in history

277
00:16:13,180 --> 00:16:17,725
We're friends forever
We'll be brave together

278
00:16:17,810 --> 00:16:26,192
We can weather
whatever comes along

279
00:16:26,276 --> 00:16:30,822
We can weather whatever

280
00:16:30,906 --> 00:16:32,031
Comes

281
00:16:32,116 --> 00:16:33,616
Along

282
00:16:44,128 --> 00:16:47,422
No prizes for guessing
where the Gobloon lives?

283
00:16:47,506 --> 00:16:51,342
Oh, don't worry.
Gobloon catchers, ho!

284
00:16:53,554 --> 00:16:55,054
Lumpy?

285
00:16:58,142 --> 00:16:59,142
Come on!

286
00:17:01,020 --> 00:17:02,103
All right.

287
00:17:03,480 --> 00:17:06,441
Know what I'm gonna wish for
when we catch that Gobloon?

288
00:17:06,525 --> 00:17:09,861
Assuming the Gobloon
doesn't catch us first?

289
00:17:09,945 --> 00:17:12,113
I'm gonna wish for
a million cookies,

290
00:17:12,197 --> 00:17:14,032
and then a million candies,

291
00:17:14,116 --> 00:17:16,492
then three more wishes.

292
00:17:16,618 --> 00:17:18,828
-How 'bout you?
-Gosh.

293
00:17:18,912 --> 00:17:20,997
I've already got my best friend

294
00:17:21,081 --> 00:17:23,916
and a lunch box full
of rumpledoodles.

295
00:17:24,001 --> 00:17:26,002
What else do I need?

296
00:17:35,721 --> 00:17:37,221
What was that?

297
00:17:37,306 --> 00:17:39,515
lt sounded like it
came from over there.

298
00:17:39,600 --> 00:17:40,933
Look!

299
00:17:43,103 --> 00:17:44,896
That's gotta be the Creepy Cave,

300
00:17:44,980 --> 00:17:46,439
just like Tigger said.

301
00:17:46,523 --> 00:17:48,649
The Slimy Slide
can't be far off.

302
00:17:48,734 --> 00:17:50,193
Come on, Lumpy.

303
00:17:57,159 --> 00:17:58,451
Whoa!

304
00:18:00,996 --> 00:18:02,830
Let's go!

305
00:18:06,460 --> 00:18:09,545
It's OK, Lumpy. It's only an echo.
Listen.

306
00:18:09,630 --> 00:18:11,005
Gobloon!

307
00:18:13,675 --> 00:18:17,386
Roo, please don't
do that again.

308
00:18:17,471 --> 00:18:18,846
I'm sorry.

309
00:18:37,491 --> 00:18:40,952
Roo! Something's following us.

310
00:18:42,663 --> 00:18:45,623
-I don't see anything.
-I heard it.

311
00:18:45,707 --> 00:18:47,416
I don't hear anything, either.

312
00:18:47,501 --> 00:18:49,544
My ears are bigger than yours.

313
00:18:49,628 --> 00:18:52,088
Lumpy, it's all in
your imagination.

314
00:19:02,224 --> 00:19:05,017
It's right behind me, Roo.
lt kicked me in the bottom.

315
00:19:05,102 --> 00:19:06,727
Lumpy! Stop!

316
00:19:08,063 --> 00:19:10,481
It's only your lunch box. See?

317
00:19:10,566 --> 00:19:13,651
I don't care. This is too scary.

318
00:19:13,735 --> 00:19:15,153
I don't want to go on.

319
00:19:15,237 --> 00:19:16,654
But we can't stop now.

320
00:19:16,780 --> 00:19:17,822
I'm sorry, Roo.

321
00:19:17,906 --> 00:19:21,826
I'm not taking another
step and that is final!

322
00:19:21,910 --> 00:19:24,579
We're almost through the cave.
All we have to...

323
00:19:24,663 --> 00:19:27,832
... find is the Slimy Slide!

324
00:19:34,506 --> 00:19:37,592
Lumpy? Are you OK?

325
00:19:37,676 --> 00:19:39,844
I think so.

326
00:19:46,351 --> 00:19:48,853
OK, we got through the
cave and down the slide.

327
00:19:48,979 --> 00:19:52,064
But where's that Tree of Terror?

328
00:19:54,067 --> 00:19:56,736
Wonder which way we should go?

329
00:20:04,912 --> 00:20:06,704
Smell anything?

330
00:20:08,540 --> 00:20:09,790
Nope.

331
00:20:09,875 --> 00:20:11,709
See anything?

332
00:20:15,547 --> 00:20:18,507
-Nope.
-Maybe he's not home.

333
00:20:18,592 --> 00:20:21,677
Well, only one way to find out.

334
00:20:22,346 --> 00:20:23,930
What are you going to do?

335
00:20:24,014 --> 00:20:26,974
Don't worry. I have a plan.

336
00:21:02,219 --> 00:21:03,552
Lumpy!

337
00:21:03,637 --> 00:21:06,472
You know what? He must
be out Goblooning.

338
00:21:06,556 --> 00:21:08,224
He could be back any minute.

339
00:21:08,308 --> 00:21:11,769
He could turn us into
jaggedy lanterns.

340
00:21:11,895 --> 00:21:14,605
I don't think I
can do this, Roo.

341
00:21:14,690 --> 00:21:16,607
I want to go home.

342
00:21:16,692 --> 00:21:20,152
If we leave, we won't catch the
Gobloon and we won't get our wishes

343
00:21:20,237 --> 00:21:23,281
and we won't have candy and
I won't get to show you

344
00:21:23,365 --> 00:21:24,824
how great Halloween is.

345
00:21:24,908 --> 00:21:26,784
I'm sorry.

346
00:21:26,868 --> 00:21:29,120
I'm just so scared.

347
00:21:30,622 --> 00:21:32,790
Gosh, I wish Piglet was here.

348
00:21:32,874 --> 00:21:34,375
-Piglet?
-Yeah.

349
00:21:34,459 --> 00:21:38,129
He was so afraid of Halloween once,
it almost was a Hallow-wasn't.

350
00:21:38,213 --> 00:21:41,257
-But then he got un-scared.
-Really?

351
00:21:42,259 --> 00:21:46,137
Say, maybe if I told
you the story, Lumpy,

352
00:21:46,221 --> 00:21:48,097
you might be un-scared too.

353
00:21:48,181 --> 00:21:49,932
All right.

354
00:21:50,058 --> 00:21:53,269
lt happened before Mom and I
moved to the Hundred Acre Wood.

355
00:21:53,353 --> 00:21:54,854
lt was Halloween,

356
00:21:54,938 --> 00:21:58,232
and everyone was really excited
to go trick-or-treating.

357
00:21:58,317 --> 00:22:00,735
They all had funny costumes

358
00:22:00,819 --> 00:22:03,654
and Pooh Bear's was the
bestest of them all.

359
00:22:03,739 --> 00:22:05,281
Look, there he is now.

360
00:22:05,365 --> 00:22:07,158
Hi, Pooh Bear. What
are you up to?

361
00:22:07,242 --> 00:22:09,535
Practicing.

362
00:22:09,619 --> 00:22:11,120
For Halloween.

363
00:22:11,204 --> 00:22:13,706
Which happens to happen soon.

364
00:22:13,790 --> 00:22:16,125
So I must be prepared.

365
00:22:18,170 --> 00:22:21,088
Though I'm not
fond of tricking,

366
00:22:21,173 --> 00:22:23,215
I do enjoy treating,

367
00:22:23,300 --> 00:22:25,468
because treating means...

368
00:22:26,345 --> 00:22:27,595
...eating.

369
00:22:28,347 --> 00:22:32,099
Bother. I've smackled every
smackeral of hon...

370
00:22:33,101 --> 00:22:36,020
Happy Halloweenin'
to ya, Pooh-boy!

371
00:22:37,939 --> 00:22:40,483
Not late, am I? Didn't
miss any anythin', did I?

372
00:22:40,567 --> 00:22:42,985
Halloween's what
Tiggers like the best.

373
00:22:45,947 --> 00:22:48,032
Trick or treat!

374
00:22:48,116 --> 00:22:50,910
Hello, Pooh. Hello, Tigger.

375
00:22:55,415 --> 00:22:57,375
Nice costume.

376
00:22:57,459 --> 00:22:59,251
You make a good yak.

377
00:22:59,378 --> 00:23:03,798
I'm not supposed to be some
yakkety-yakketin'-yak!

378
00:23:05,801 --> 00:23:08,260
Now I gotta get a new outfit!

379
00:23:08,345 --> 00:23:12,139
'Cause I'm gonna win
that Best Costume Prize.

380
00:23:12,224 --> 00:23:14,183
You wait and see!

381
00:23:16,311 --> 00:23:19,897
But, Gopher, I don't think
there is such a prize.

382
00:23:19,981 --> 00:23:22,149
Fine with me!

383
00:23:23,693 --> 00:23:26,404
Cuts down on the competition.

384
00:23:27,155 --> 00:23:29,073
Night'll be fallin'
any minute now,

385
00:23:29,157 --> 00:23:31,992
and I still haven't pulled
any warm-up tricks!

386
00:23:32,744 --> 00:23:35,371
But, Tigger, we can't go yet.

387
00:23:36,832 --> 00:23:38,416
What do you mean?

388
00:23:38,500 --> 00:23:40,668
Halloween night
won't last all day,

389
00:23:40,752 --> 00:23:42,461
and we gotta be ready for it!

390
00:23:42,546 --> 00:23:45,881
But our very dear friend
Piglet is not here.

391
00:23:45,966 --> 00:23:49,385
And I would have thought he
should have been by now.

392
00:23:49,469 --> 00:23:52,263
I hope he is all right.

393
00:23:53,682 --> 00:23:57,059
Yes, Piglet, you're gonna
be quite all right.

394
00:23:57,144 --> 00:24:00,020
Because this year is
going to be the year.

395
00:24:00,105 --> 00:24:03,065
This Halloween, you're
going to enjoy yourself.

396
00:24:03,150 --> 00:24:05,443
Nothing is going
to frighten you.

397
00:24:08,780 --> 00:24:10,948
There! If I'm not scared

398
00:24:11,032 --> 00:24:14,702
of something as frightful as this,
I'll be unafraid of anything!

399
00:24:16,496 --> 00:24:18,372
I hope.

400
00:24:18,457 --> 00:24:21,292
Ghoulish goblin Ghastly ghost

401
00:24:21,376 --> 00:24:24,211
Everything scares me the most

402
00:24:24,296 --> 00:24:26,255
All I really want to do

403
00:24:26,339 --> 00:24:29,467
ls be with Pooh,
Eeyore and Tigger

404
00:24:29,551 --> 00:24:32,052
Kind of creepy, sort of scary

405
00:24:32,179 --> 00:24:34,763
Yes, but maybe not so very

406
00:24:34,848 --> 00:24:37,141
Well, in order to be brave

407
00:24:37,225 --> 00:24:41,645
I tell myself that
I am not afraid

408
00:24:41,730 --> 00:24:43,272
No, not too much

409
00:24:43,356 --> 00:24:46,734
And if I am not afraid

410
00:24:46,860 --> 00:24:48,986
Not more than a touch

411
00:24:49,070 --> 00:24:52,740
I can be around my friends

412
00:24:52,824 --> 00:24:56,202
And being with them
is much better

413
00:24:56,286 --> 00:24:58,996
We might be more brave together

414
00:24:59,080 --> 00:25:01,957
Then I can say that
I am not af...

415
00:25:02,042 --> 00:25:04,460
What if some spook
comes up to me

416
00:25:04,544 --> 00:25:07,004
When it's dark and really gloomy

417
00:25:07,088 --> 00:25:10,049
How very grand to stand up tall

418
00:25:10,133 --> 00:25:13,552
But could I even stand at all?

419
00:25:13,637 --> 00:25:16,514
I don't have one scary feature

420
00:25:16,598 --> 00:25:19,433
A timid, small and
frightened creature

421
00:25:19,518 --> 00:25:21,894
Dear, oh dear, I'm
just not brave

422
00:25:21,978 --> 00:25:23,354
I want to tell them

423
00:25:23,438 --> 00:25:26,524
I am not afraid

424
00:25:26,608 --> 00:25:28,442
No, not too much

425
00:25:28,527 --> 00:25:31,820
And if I am not afraid

426
00:25:31,905 --> 00:25:34,031
Not more than a touch

427
00:25:34,115 --> 00:25:37,868
I can be around my friends

428
00:25:37,953 --> 00:25:40,996
And being with them
is much better

429
00:25:41,081 --> 00:25:43,707
We might be more brave together

430
00:25:43,792 --> 00:25:46,585
It's Halloween I'll face my fear

431
00:25:46,670 --> 00:25:50,589
'Cause it's the spookiest
night of the year

432
00:25:50,674 --> 00:25:55,135
What a very grand
thing to be so brave

433
00:25:55,220 --> 00:26:00,391
To show myself that
I am not afraid

434
00:26:09,067 --> 00:26:12,611
Trick or treat. Or not.

435
00:26:12,696 --> 00:26:16,073
Why, Piglet, where
is your costume?

436
00:26:16,157 --> 00:26:18,242
Oh. I...

437
00:26:20,412 --> 00:26:23,872
Actually I haven't entirely
decided, exactly,

438
00:26:23,957 --> 00:26:26,000
just what I want
to be, precisely.

439
00:26:27,460 --> 00:26:29,503
Gasp! Look at the time.

440
00:26:29,588 --> 00:26:31,297
Half-past a quarter of sunset.

441
00:26:31,381 --> 00:26:34,883
And I still haven't done any
warmin'-uppin'! Come on!

442
00:26:38,054 --> 00:26:41,682
I gotta try some
trick-or-trickin' on old Rabbit.

443
00:26:41,766 --> 00:26:44,101
There is a trick to
pullin' tricks, you know.

444
00:26:47,439 --> 00:26:49,106
Storm brewin'.

445
00:26:50,317 --> 00:26:51,859
Oh, dear.

446
00:26:52,652 --> 00:26:53,777
Piglet.

447
00:26:53,862 --> 00:26:57,573
If you were I and I were you,

448
00:26:57,657 --> 00:27:01,160
would you think my costume will
get me plenty of treats tonight?

449
00:27:01,244 --> 00:27:04,330
Namely, honey.

450
00:27:04,831 --> 00:27:08,834
I should give it a
trying-out to be sure.

451
00:27:08,918 --> 00:27:11,754
Oh, Pooh, I really don't know.

452
00:27:11,838 --> 00:27:15,466
Say, where y'all buzzing
off to, buddy boys?

453
00:27:20,513 --> 00:27:23,807
I shall know I'm all
the bee that I can be,

454
00:27:23,892 --> 00:27:25,726
if the bees see me

455
00:27:25,810 --> 00:27:28,729
and see a bee instead of me.

456
00:27:28,813 --> 00:27:30,064
See?

457
00:27:33,860 --> 00:27:35,736
Oh, Pooh Bear!

458
00:27:37,030 --> 00:27:39,073
Perhaps it would
be best, Piglet,

459
00:27:39,157 --> 00:27:41,450
if you didn't call me by name.

460
00:27:41,576 --> 00:27:44,411
lt might make the bees curious.

461
00:27:44,496 --> 00:27:47,331
I'm sorry, Pooh Who Isn't.

462
00:27:58,009 --> 00:28:00,678
A trick? Or treat?

463
00:28:02,597 --> 00:28:04,139
Oh, bother.

464
00:28:06,559 --> 00:28:10,771
Each precious pumpkin a
picture of perfection!

465
00:28:12,565 --> 00:28:14,983
No, no, no!

466
00:28:15,068 --> 00:28:18,278
Not this way. That
way, to your left.

467
00:28:18,363 --> 00:28:20,197
No, your other left!

468
00:28:22,617 --> 00:28:24,410
Oh, my!

469
00:28:24,536 --> 00:28:27,371
My poor pumpkins.

470
00:28:28,164 --> 00:28:29,873
Are you all right, Pauline?

471
00:28:29,958 --> 00:28:32,543
Oh, speak to me, Pietro.

472
00:28:32,627 --> 00:28:36,296
Oh, don't you know me, Petunia?

473
00:28:36,381 --> 00:28:38,966
Trick or treat!

474
00:28:39,050 --> 00:28:41,301
Not now, Gopher.

475
00:28:41,386 --> 00:28:43,595
And why are you dressed
like a muskrat?

476
00:28:43,680 --> 00:28:45,222
Muskrat?

477
00:28:46,391 --> 00:28:49,935
That guy wouldn't know a rabbit
from a hole in the ground!

478
00:28:57,902 --> 00:29:00,154
Look at all the
pretty pumplekins!

479
00:29:00,238 --> 00:29:03,073
Jackie-lanterns just
waitin' to happen!

480
00:29:19,382 --> 00:29:27,473
Oh, dear!

481
00:29:27,557 --> 00:29:29,558
Tigger, stop that!

482
00:29:29,642 --> 00:29:32,478
I have no time for this
Halloween nonsense.

483
00:29:32,562 --> 00:29:36,064
I have work to do. I have
pumpkins to protect!

484
00:29:36,149 --> 00:29:38,400
How's this one?

485
00:29:38,485 --> 00:29:41,236
Of all my favourite holidays,

486
00:29:41,321 --> 00:29:43,614
Halloween isn't.

487
00:29:54,250 --> 00:29:56,210
A stormin'-good storm.

488
00:29:56,336 --> 00:29:59,213
This is gonna be the
bestest Halloween ever!

489
00:29:59,339 --> 00:30:01,715
With loads of lightnin'!

490
00:30:03,009 --> 00:30:05,344
And thunderous thunderin'!

491
00:30:06,679 --> 00:30:09,973
And windiferous winds
breaking everywhere!

492
00:30:13,937 --> 00:30:16,063
Oh, dear.

493
00:30:16,648 --> 00:30:21,235
Why, we're gonna be creepin'
and crawlin' with Spookables!

494
00:30:21,736 --> 00:30:23,737
Oh, dear.

495
00:30:25,156 --> 00:30:28,408
You don't suppose there
will be any Spookables

496
00:30:28,493 --> 00:30:31,453
of the honey-hungry sort?

497
00:30:31,538 --> 00:30:35,040
-Do you?
-At least half a dump of Spookables.

498
00:30:35,124 --> 00:30:39,002
And bug-eyed Woozles and
saw-toothed Jagulars!

499
00:30:40,296 --> 00:30:42,506
Oh, dear! Deary dear dear!

500
00:30:42,590 --> 00:30:43,799
Piglet.

501
00:30:53,560 --> 00:30:55,602
And then Piglet
ran for his life.

502
00:30:55,770 --> 00:30:58,689
Hey, Lumpy, is the story
making you feel any better?

503
00:31:00,775 --> 00:31:04,278
-I'll take that as a "no".
-What happened next, Roo?

504
00:31:04,362 --> 00:31:06,947
Did the Spookables get Piglet?

505
00:31:07,615 --> 00:31:09,575
Well, let's see.

506
00:31:13,872 --> 00:31:16,748
Piglet was all alone,
lost in the woods,

507
00:31:16,833 --> 00:31:20,294
on the ookiest-spookiest
night of the year,

508
00:31:21,004 --> 00:31:23,130
which really wasn't
the best place to be.

509
00:31:33,975 --> 00:31:36,977
There. Now you're
safe and sound.

510
00:31:39,272 --> 00:31:41,273
Who is it?

511
00:31:41,357 --> 00:31:44,860
It's me, them, and
, of course, us.

512
00:31:44,944 --> 00:31:46,778
Oh. But wait.

513
00:31:46,863 --> 00:31:50,782
Perhaps if you'd say something
only you would say,

514
00:31:50,867 --> 00:31:52,284
I'd know you're you.

515
00:31:52,368 --> 00:31:56,246
A very good idea, Piglet.
But what should I say?

516
00:31:56,331 --> 00:32:00,500
Well, possibly..
. "I am Pooh"?

517
00:32:00,585 --> 00:32:03,462
You are? Well, then who am I?

518
00:32:05,340 --> 00:32:06,924
It's Pooh.

519
00:32:10,136 --> 00:32:12,262
Are you quite all right, Piglet?

520
00:32:14,390 --> 00:32:15,432
Yes.

521
00:32:15,516 --> 00:32:19,061
You will be joining us for
Halloween, won't you?

522
00:32:19,145 --> 00:32:21,521
Well, to be perfectly honest.
..

523
00:32:21,606 --> 00:32:23,273
What I mean to say is...

524
00:32:23,358 --> 00:32:25,317
To put it another way...

525
00:32:25,401 --> 00:32:27,319
The truth of the matter is...

526
00:32:27,403 --> 00:32:29,196
As a small and timid animal,

527
00:32:29,280 --> 00:32:32,115
I'm afraid I'm
really too afraid.

528
00:32:32,200 --> 00:32:33,700
Oh, but Piglet,

529
00:32:33,785 --> 00:32:37,162
Halloween without you
would be like...

530
00:32:37,246 --> 00:32:40,457
Like last year, and the
year before last year.

531
00:32:40,541 --> 00:32:42,960
And the year before that year.

532
00:32:43,044 --> 00:32:45,879
And all the years leadin'
up to and includin'

533
00:32:45,964 --> 00:32:47,881
every last Halloween ever.

534
00:32:47,966 --> 00:32:51,009
I'm very, very sorry indeed.

535
00:32:51,094 --> 00:32:53,845
Oh, that's quite
all right, Piglet.

536
00:32:53,930 --> 00:32:56,890
We shall simply not
have Halloween.

537
00:32:57,016 --> 00:32:59,101
Oh, you mustn't do
that, Pooh Bear,

538
00:32:59,185 --> 00:33:01,853
-only because of me.
-Oh, no.

539
00:33:01,938 --> 00:33:04,815
This Halloween shall
be a Hallo-wasn't

540
00:33:04,899 --> 00:33:07,859
and you shall have no
reason to be frightened.

541
00:33:07,944 --> 00:33:09,945
Thank you, Pooh Bear.

542
00:33:12,573 --> 00:33:15,283
Would you like us to
stay with you, Piglet?

543
00:33:15,368 --> 00:33:19,162
No, I'll be quite all right now.

544
00:33:21,124 --> 00:33:23,500
I had hoped it wouldn't
happen this year.

545
00:33:23,584 --> 00:33:27,254
Everyone was looking
forward to Halloween so.

546
00:33:27,380 --> 00:33:30,841
I've let down Pooh and Tigger

547
00:33:30,925 --> 00:33:32,801
and Gopher and Eeyore

548
00:33:32,885 --> 00:33:36,430
and most of all... me.

549
00:33:40,476 --> 00:33:43,770
I do so hope this blusterous
and rather stormish night

550
00:33:43,855 --> 00:33:46,815
will not be too frightening
for poor Piglet.

551
00:33:46,899 --> 00:33:49,901
I suspect something
should be done.

552
00:33:49,986 --> 00:33:51,737
But what?

553
00:33:51,779 --> 00:33:53,613
I don't know either.

554
00:33:53,698 --> 00:33:55,615
Think, think.

555
00:33:55,700 --> 00:34:00,078
Why, just because Piglet can't
have Halloween with us,

556
00:34:00,163 --> 00:34:03,540
there's no reason we can't
have Hallo-wasn't with him!

557
00:34:03,624 --> 00:34:06,626
I like the way you think.

558
00:34:07,170 --> 00:34:11,631
No way, no how, am I gonna miss
out on another Halloween!

559
00:34:11,716 --> 00:34:15,385
I'll have my own
Hallo-wasn't all by myself.

560
00:34:16,679 --> 00:34:20,682
If only Piglet was more
like me and less like him.

561
00:34:22,143 --> 00:34:26,021
I love surprises and wearin' disguises
A horribly hideous costume'll do

562
00:34:26,105 --> 00:34:29,983
Better be wary, be spooky and scary
I'll bounce from the shadows and "Boo"

563
00:34:30,068 --> 00:34:32,110
I wanna scare myself
and everyone else

564
00:34:32,195 --> 00:34:34,488
Those thrilly and chilly
old willys will rise

565
00:34:34,614 --> 00:34:38,325
Cover your eyes, little buddy beware
I'm twitchin' and itchin' to scare

566
00:34:38,409 --> 00:34:39,701
Myself

567
00:34:39,786 --> 00:34:42,162
Unspeakable Spookables
Awful unlookables

568
00:34:42,246 --> 00:34:44,372
Galloping ghosties
and goblins galore

569
00:34:44,457 --> 00:34:46,208
What if they find you
Oh, look out behind you

570
00:34:46,292 --> 00:34:49,503
A terrible Tigger-type roar
That would be me, hoo-hoo

571
00:34:49,587 --> 00:34:51,713
I wanna scare myself
and everyone else

572
00:34:51,798 --> 00:34:54,091
Those thrilly and chilly
old willys will rise

573
00:34:54,217 --> 00:34:57,969
Cover your eyes, little buddy beware
I'm twitchin' and itchin' to scare

574
00:34:58,096 --> 00:34:59,429
Myself

575
00:35:01,641 --> 00:35:03,975
Now Tiggers I figger
make scares even bigger

576
00:35:04,060 --> 00:35:06,061
They dress up and scream "Who am I?
Can you guess?"

577
00:35:06,145 --> 00:35:08,021
And tricks always happen
when ghosts are a-flappin'

578
00:35:08,106 --> 00:35:12,192
And tricks are what Tiggers like best!
I wanna scare myself and everyone else

579
00:35:12,276 --> 00:35:14,277
Those thrilly and chilly
old willys will rise

580
00:35:14,362 --> 00:35:18,156
Cover your eyes, little buddy beware
I'm twitchin' and itchin' to scare

581
00:35:18,241 --> 00:35:19,741
Myself

582
00:35:21,077 --> 00:35:22,828
And who better?

583
00:35:23,371 --> 00:35:25,497
Oh, by the way. Boo!

584
00:35:29,001 --> 00:35:31,294
Spookables!

585
00:35:34,465 --> 00:35:37,217
Trick-or-treat, again.

586
00:35:37,301 --> 00:35:40,178
We're on our way to Piglet's
to have a Hallo-wasn't,

587
00:35:40,263 --> 00:35:42,973
-if you'd like to join...
-What're ya waitin' for?

588
00:35:43,057 --> 00:35:44,558
Come on!

589
00:35:48,771 --> 00:35:51,022
What was that?

590
00:35:54,193 --> 00:35:55,652
Someone's coming!

591
00:35:56,195 --> 00:36:00,157
It's a three-headed, bug-eyed
, saw-toothed Spookable!

592
00:36:01,617 --> 00:36:03,493
I must find Pooh!

593
00:36:05,079 --> 00:36:08,582
Perhaps we'd better
take off our costumes,

594
00:36:08,666 --> 00:36:10,667
so as not to frighten him.

595
00:36:10,751 --> 00:36:14,588
Piglet? Piglet?

596
00:36:17,300 --> 00:36:19,968
Don't you know what this means?

597
00:36:20,052 --> 00:36:23,180
He's been pignapped
by Spookables!

598
00:36:24,056 --> 00:36:27,225
Hup, two, three, four.

599
00:36:38,404 --> 00:36:40,614
Pooh wasn't at Eeyore's either,

600
00:36:40,740 --> 00:36:42,490
and neither was Eeyore,

601
00:36:42,575 --> 00:36:46,036
and no one was at Tigger's.

602
00:36:46,120 --> 00:36:49,289
Hello, Rabbit?

603
00:36:52,877 --> 00:36:56,338
Oh, no one at all is
where they should be.

604
00:36:59,383 --> 00:37:02,177
Oh, dear.

605
00:37:18,736 --> 00:37:21,029
Was that you, Eeyore?

606
00:37:21,113 --> 00:37:23,740
Wish I could say it was.

607
00:37:23,824 --> 00:37:25,575
But it wasn't.

608
00:37:27,578 --> 00:37:29,579
If I didn't know any better,

609
00:37:29,664 --> 00:37:32,499
I'd think you fellas
was all scaredy.

610
00:37:33,751 --> 00:37:35,877
We are.

611
00:37:42,260 --> 00:37:44,052
Well, I'm not!

612
00:37:44,887 --> 00:37:47,472
Now quit climbin' all
over me, buddy bear!

613
00:37:47,556 --> 00:37:49,349
We got piglets to find!

614
00:37:51,477 --> 00:37:53,687
I think I have had a thought.

615
00:37:53,771 --> 00:37:56,523
If we put our costumes on,

616
00:37:56,607 --> 00:37:58,733
when we find the Spookables,

617
00:37:58,859 --> 00:38:02,612
they shall think we're them and
we shall think they are us,

618
00:38:02,697 --> 00:38:05,240
so we can save Piglet

619
00:38:05,324 --> 00:38:08,201
and no one will be the wiser!

620
00:38:15,960 --> 00:38:18,920
I know I got it this time!

621
00:38:29,974 --> 00:38:34,728
Oh, an infestation of ghosts
and goblins and ghouls!

622
00:38:36,439 --> 00:38:37,856
Piglet!

623
00:38:39,483 --> 00:38:42,402
Excuse me, but could someone,

624
00:38:42,486 --> 00:38:44,988
anyone really, help me?

625
00:38:48,326 --> 00:38:50,410
Oh, dear! Pooh Bear!

626
00:38:50,494 --> 00:38:52,829
Oh, they have Pooh Bear!

627
00:38:52,913 --> 00:38:56,499
Two very fierce and
savage Spookables!

628
00:39:06,510 --> 00:39:09,095
I must save my friend Pooh!

629
00:39:09,180 --> 00:39:11,056
Boo! Boo, I say.

630
00:39:11,140 --> 00:39:12,223
Boo!

631
00:39:16,520 --> 00:39:19,272
Spookable!

632
00:39:27,490 --> 00:39:29,366
What? Who's that?

633
00:39:29,450 --> 00:39:31,409
Oh no, not this way!

634
00:39:40,836 --> 00:39:42,670
Oh, dear!

635
00:39:51,639 --> 00:39:55,934
Why, Piglet, you scared
the Spookable away!

636
00:39:56,018 --> 00:39:57,310
I did?

637
00:39:57,395 --> 00:40:01,398
You did and what you
did saved us all.

638
00:40:01,482 --> 00:40:03,441
I did!

639
00:40:03,526 --> 00:40:07,445
Three cheers for the bravest
little timid guy ever!

640
00:40:07,530 --> 00:40:11,908
Hip-hip! Hooray! Hip-hip!
Hooray!

641
00:40:17,832 --> 00:40:19,290
Dagnabit!

642
00:40:19,375 --> 00:40:23,253
Why, Gopher, what a
wonderful costume.

643
00:40:23,379 --> 00:40:26,131
lt is? lt is!

644
00:40:26,215 --> 00:40:30,260
By dingy, it's the best!
That's what it is.

645
00:40:30,344 --> 00:40:33,430
Of all the Halloweens
I can remember,

646
00:40:33,514 --> 00:40:34,931
and I can't,

647
00:40:35,015 --> 00:40:37,225
this Hallo-wasn't has been

648
00:40:37,309 --> 00:40:39,978
the most unforgettable of all.

649
00:40:40,062 --> 00:40:44,274
And I got a super, grade-A,
lollapaloozin' good scare!

650
00:40:44,358 --> 00:40:46,276
Not that I was frightened by it.

651
00:40:46,360 --> 00:40:50,363
And this year Piglet has made
it all the way through,

652
00:40:50,448 --> 00:40:54,325
so our Hallo-wasn't
truly was a Hallo-was.

653
00:40:54,410 --> 00:40:57,203
Hey, wait a half a segundo.

654
00:40:57,288 --> 00:41:00,331
You never did figure out what
you're gonna be, Piglet!

655
00:41:00,458 --> 00:41:02,333
Actually, Tigger, I did.

656
00:41:02,460 --> 00:41:05,712
I've decided I'd like to
go as Pooh's very best,

657
00:41:05,796 --> 00:41:08,423
and very bravest friend.

658
00:41:08,507 --> 00:41:11,092
That, Piglet,

659
00:41:11,177 --> 00:41:14,596
is the thing I should
most like you to be.

660
00:41:15,639 --> 00:41:19,517
So, with just a little bit of
help from his very good friend...

661
00:41:19,602 --> 00:41:21,478
-Pooh Bear?
-That's right.

662
00:41:21,562 --> 00:41:23,396
Piglet became un-scared.

663
00:41:23,481 --> 00:41:25,482
And he stayed un-scared
for a while.

664
00:41:25,566 --> 00:41:29,194
'Cause he had his friends
to keep him company.

665
00:41:29,278 --> 00:41:32,280
Lumpy, did my story
un-scare you?

666
00:41:32,364 --> 00:41:33,823
I think so.

667
00:41:33,908 --> 00:41:37,076
If someone as small as
Piglet can be brave,

668
00:41:37,161 --> 00:41:40,997
-I can be twice as brave.
-At least.

669
00:41:41,081 --> 00:41:45,084
You would never leave me
alone, would you, Roo?

670
00:41:45,169 --> 00:41:47,795
Never, Lumpy. I promise.

671
00:41:47,880 --> 00:41:51,174
-Brave together.
-Brave forever.

672
00:41:51,300 --> 00:41:53,885
Conquerors of the Gobloon!

673
00:41:53,969 --> 00:41:55,887
Come on, Lumpy.

674
00:42:38,722 --> 00:42:40,139
Come on!

675
00:42:44,645 --> 00:42:47,146
All we have to do now is
wait 'til he comes home.

676
00:42:47,231 --> 00:42:50,441
Then I pull the rope, the trap
door slams down and wham!

677
00:42:50,526 --> 00:42:52,819
-We get our wishes?
-Yep!

678
00:42:52,903 --> 00:42:54,862
Now...

679
00:42:54,947 --> 00:42:58,992
Don't make a sound.

680
00:43:04,164 --> 00:43:05,498
Whoa!

681
00:43:07,126 --> 00:43:08,751
What was that?

682
00:43:08,836 --> 00:43:11,796
Maybe it's the Gobloon.

683
00:43:11,880 --> 00:43:13,840
You stay here. I'll
go check it out.

684
00:43:13,924 --> 00:43:15,717
If it's him, I'll
chase him here.

685
00:43:15,801 --> 00:43:18,928
And when I give the signal
, you spring the trap.

686
00:43:19,013 --> 00:43:20,597
What signal?

687
00:43:22,141 --> 00:43:24,601
I'll hoot like Owl. Only
instead of "hoo hoo",

688
00:43:24,685 --> 00:43:26,394
I'll hoot "Roo hoo".

689
00:43:27,396 --> 00:43:30,356
On second thought, why
don't you come with me?

690
00:43:30,441 --> 00:43:33,610
Good idea. That way I'll know
when you give the signal.

691
00:43:48,751 --> 00:43:50,543
Come on.

692
00:43:56,425 --> 00:43:59,010
It's coming from the bridge.

693
00:44:01,555 --> 00:44:03,431
Follow me.

694
00:44:08,437 --> 00:44:11,022
Lumpy, come on!

695
00:44:23,243 --> 00:44:25,453
Lumpy, quiet!

696
00:44:40,469 --> 00:44:42,220
Run, Lumpy! Run!

697
00:44:48,477 --> 00:44:50,645
The Gobloon's gonna get us.

698
00:45:06,745 --> 00:45:08,329
Help!

699
00:45:12,501 --> 00:45:14,085
Roo!

700
00:45:21,301 --> 00:45:23,136
Roo?

701
00:45:27,725 --> 00:45:30,351
Roo, where are you?

702
00:45:32,813 --> 00:45:36,858
You said you'd never
leave me alone.

703
00:46:00,883 --> 00:46:03,259
Lumpy?

704
00:46:03,343 --> 00:46:05,928
Where are you?

705
00:46:14,730 --> 00:46:18,149
Help! The Gobloon's got me!
The Gobloon's got me!

706
00:46:20,694 --> 00:46:22,695
Hold on, Roo. I'll save you!

707
00:46:22,780 --> 00:46:24,739
Help!

708
00:46:39,046 --> 00:46:40,546
Roo hoo!

709
00:46:40,631 --> 00:46:42,840
Where are you, Roo?

710
00:46:43,342 --> 00:46:44,842
Please answer me.

711
00:46:44,927 --> 00:46:46,886
Roo?

712
00:46:49,807 --> 00:46:51,974
Help! The Gobloon's got Roo!

713
00:46:54,770 --> 00:46:58,523
Brave together, brave forever.

714
00:47:00,484 --> 00:47:02,193
I'll save you, Roo.

715
00:47:02,277 --> 00:47:05,696
If Piglet can be
un-scared, so can I.

716
00:47:07,950 --> 00:47:11,744
Brave together, brave forever.

717
00:47:14,706 --> 00:47:17,500
Conquerors of the Gobloon.

718
00:47:25,884 --> 00:47:27,677
Oh, no, you don't.

719
00:47:56,832 --> 00:47:59,417
-Boo.
-Oh, hello, Eeyore.

720
00:47:59,501 --> 00:48:02,336
How'd you know it was me?

721
00:48:02,921 --> 00:48:05,214
-Hello, Piglet.
-Hello, Pooh.

722
00:48:05,340 --> 00:48:07,675
Look at me, Piglet.

723
00:48:07,759 --> 00:48:09,302
I'm a little honey pot.

724
00:48:09,386 --> 00:48:11,971
Oh, very nice, Pooh Bear.

725
00:48:12,055 --> 00:48:14,015
Oh, hi, Tigger.

726
00:48:15,475 --> 00:48:18,102
Tigger is my
mild-mannered alter-ego.

727
00:48:18,186 --> 00:48:21,355
I am Super-Tigger.

728
00:48:21,440 --> 00:48:26,193
I can leap over a house or something
really big, in a single bounce.

729
00:48:26,278 --> 00:48:29,655
And then... And I...

730
00:48:29,740 --> 00:48:31,157
I'm not kidding anyone.

731
00:48:31,241 --> 00:48:34,368
lt just doesn't feel like
Halloween without any candy.

732
00:48:34,453 --> 00:48:38,998
lt feels more like Hallow-almost
or Hallow-Not-Quite-Right.

733
00:48:39,082 --> 00:48:41,709
-Or something.
-I know what you mean, Tigger.

734
00:48:41,793 --> 00:48:44,170
Even my tummy can't be fooled.

735
00:48:45,631 --> 00:48:47,506
Cheer up, everyone.

736
00:48:47,591 --> 00:48:49,800
Halloween is saved.

737
00:48:50,427 --> 00:48:52,428
I knew you could
do it, Long-Ears.

738
00:48:52,512 --> 00:48:54,555
So, what did ya bring?
Popcorn balls?

739
00:48:54,640 --> 00:48:56,724
Candied apples? Cookies?

740
00:48:56,808 --> 00:48:58,601
-Even better.
-Honey?

741
00:48:58,685 --> 00:49:01,979
-Even better.
-As long as it's candy.

742
00:49:02,064 --> 00:49:03,105
Sure is.

743
00:49:04,441 --> 00:49:07,193
Nature's candy. Vegetables.

744
00:49:08,528 --> 00:49:10,696
Carrots. Radishes. Rutabagas.

745
00:49:10,781 --> 00:49:12,823
Oh, they're tasty, juicy,

746
00:49:12,908 --> 00:49:15,618
and most important,
good for you.

747
00:49:16,662 --> 00:49:21,290
Well, I suppose we could go
trick-or-treating with these.

748
00:49:22,459 --> 00:49:24,502
Well, I'll take
the trick, please.

749
00:49:26,254 --> 00:49:29,048
Oh, nonsense. This is
going to be the best

750
00:49:29,132 --> 00:49:32,176
and healthiest Halloween ever!

751
00:49:32,260 --> 00:49:34,011
Finally, as it should be.

752
00:49:34,096 --> 00:49:36,764
Hey, I just thought
of something.

753
00:49:36,848 --> 00:49:39,600
If we're all here to go
tricking and treating,

754
00:49:39,685 --> 00:49:43,062
then none of us are home
to be treated or tricked.

755
00:49:43,146 --> 00:49:45,272
You're right, Tigger.

756
00:49:45,357 --> 00:49:47,149
That is a bother.

757
00:49:47,234 --> 00:49:49,318
But what should we do?

758
00:49:50,195 --> 00:49:51,737
Think, think, think.

759
00:49:51,822 --> 00:49:55,074
I have an idea!
Let's take turns.

760
00:49:55,158 --> 00:49:57,451
We can practice
here at my house.

761
00:49:57,536 --> 00:49:59,704
I don't know, Piglet.

762
00:49:59,788 --> 00:50:02,164
What if you don't
answer the door?

763
00:50:02,249 --> 00:50:04,583
Oh, I will! I
promise, I will!

764
00:50:04,668 --> 00:50:06,544
Well, it's risky.

765
00:50:06,628 --> 00:50:08,295
Oh, my head hurts.

766
00:50:08,380 --> 00:50:10,464
But it's just crazy
enough to work.

767
00:50:10,549 --> 00:50:13,384
-Let's give it a try.
-Goody-goody!

768
00:50:23,520 --> 00:50:25,646
Who's there?

769
00:50:25,731 --> 00:50:28,649
It's us! Who else could it be?

770
00:50:29,818 --> 00:50:32,945
-"Us" who?
-"Us"!

771
00:50:33,030 --> 00:50:35,281
Rabbit, Tigger and Pooh Bear!

772
00:50:35,365 --> 00:50:36,907
Forgot me again.

773
00:50:36,992 --> 00:50:38,659
Prove it.

774
00:50:38,744 --> 00:50:40,703
Open this door at once!

775
00:50:46,168 --> 00:50:49,920
-Rabbit! lt is you!
-Trick-or-treat!

776
00:50:52,299 --> 00:50:53,549
Hooray!

777
00:50:54,968 --> 00:50:57,845
I can't wait to try my place.

778
00:50:57,929 --> 00:51:00,264
Wonder if I'm gonna be there.

779
00:51:08,690 --> 00:51:12,902
Lumpy?

780
00:51:12,986 --> 00:51:14,987
Where are you?

781
00:51:23,246 --> 00:51:24,789
Lumpy?

782
00:51:29,044 --> 00:51:31,295
Oh, no! The Gobloon got you!

783
00:51:31,379 --> 00:51:34,298
And he's turned you into
a jaggedy lantern.

784
00:51:34,382 --> 00:51:37,384
Say something, Lumpy.

785
00:51:38,220 --> 00:51:40,763
Oh no, Lumpy.

786
00:51:41,306 --> 00:51:42,973
Don't worry, I'll find help.

787
00:51:43,058 --> 00:51:45,559
It'll be OK.

788
00:51:45,644 --> 00:51:48,020
I won't leave you again.

789
00:51:55,028 --> 00:51:58,072
Let's give Rabbit the
old trickety-treatment.

790
00:52:00,075 --> 00:52:02,034
Knockety knock knockety.

791
00:52:02,119 --> 00:52:03,786
Guess who!

792
00:52:06,164 --> 00:52:09,291
"Guess who," he says.
Gee, I don't know.

793
00:52:09,417 --> 00:52:11,210
Pooh Bear? Tigger?

794
00:52:11,294 --> 00:52:14,046
Oh, he's good.

795
00:52:14,131 --> 00:52:16,090
Very good.

796
00:52:16,925 --> 00:52:19,635
Anyway, let's see, where
are those treats?

797
00:52:19,719 --> 00:52:20,719
Oh, here we go.

798
00:52:20,804 --> 00:52:23,764
A nice juicy rutabaga
for Pooh Bear.

799
00:52:23,849 --> 00:52:27,143
Prunes for Piglet,
celery for Eeyore,

800
00:52:27,227 --> 00:52:31,355
and for you, Tigger.
.. spinach.

801
00:52:34,484 --> 00:52:37,194
Roo-boy and Lumpy are
missing all the fun,

802
00:52:37,279 --> 00:52:40,239
and the spinach.

803
00:52:40,323 --> 00:52:43,659
I told 'em to be here at sunset.
I'm sure they'll be by any minute.

804
00:52:43,743 --> 00:52:45,119
-Help!
-Roo-boy.

805
00:52:45,203 --> 00:52:46,954
Help!

806
00:52:47,539 --> 00:52:50,374
We tried to catch the Gobloon
, and we found his tree

807
00:52:50,458 --> 00:52:52,042
but I got scared and ran away.

808
00:52:52,127 --> 00:52:54,879
Then the Gobloon turned him
into a jaggedy lantern.

809
00:52:56,673 --> 00:52:59,592
Could you start again
from that first Gobloon?

810
00:53:01,469 --> 00:53:03,929
-Gobloon!
-Oh, dear.

811
00:53:04,014 --> 00:53:06,432
The story's true. There
really is a Gobloon.

812
00:53:06,516 --> 00:53:08,267
Quick, everyone, panic!

813
00:53:08,351 --> 00:53:10,936
-Poor Lumpy.
-Oh, this will never do.

814
00:53:12,647 --> 00:53:14,481
Wait a second. I got it.

815
00:53:14,566 --> 00:53:16,901
We gotta catch the Gobloon.

816
00:53:16,985 --> 00:53:19,528
-What?
-Well, if you catch the Gobloon,

817
00:53:19,613 --> 00:53:21,989
-you get to make a wish.
-That's it, Tigger.

818
00:53:22,073 --> 00:53:23,574
We can wish Lumpy back.

819
00:53:23,700 --> 00:53:25,910
Tigger's right. Wait a minute.

820
00:53:25,994 --> 00:53:28,787
Tigger's right? That
can't be right.

821
00:53:28,788 --> 00:53:29,038


822
00:53:29,289 --> 00:53:32,833
Hurry! There's not
a moment to lose!

823
00:53:34,294 --> 00:53:36,128
-Hurry!
-Come on.

824
00:53:36,213 --> 00:53:37,755
We're gonna save him.

825
00:53:37,839 --> 00:53:39,924
-We're coming, Lumpy.
-Don't worry!

826
00:53:40,008 --> 00:53:42,426
We'll have you back
to normal in no time.

827
00:53:42,510 --> 00:53:45,679
I'm sorry I left you all alone.

828
00:53:45,764 --> 00:53:48,349
Lumpy, we're coming for you!

829
00:53:48,433 --> 00:53:50,601
We're coming, Lumpy!

830
00:53:58,193 --> 00:54:00,986
Remind me again, Pooh Bear.

831
00:54:01,071 --> 00:54:04,657
How did I ever become un-scared?

832
00:54:08,787 --> 00:54:10,079
Listen, everyone.

833
00:54:10,872 --> 00:54:13,916
The tree is making noises.

834
00:54:17,545 --> 00:54:20,506
Maybe it has a bellyache.

835
00:54:20,590 --> 00:54:23,008
That's the Gobloon!
The trap worked.

836
00:54:23,093 --> 00:54:25,010
We caught him!

837
00:54:25,095 --> 00:54:27,554
-Hooray!
-Hooray for us!

838
00:54:27,639 --> 00:54:30,391
-I knew we could do it.
-Hooray! Yay!

839
00:54:32,269 --> 00:54:34,270
Now what?

840
00:54:34,354 --> 00:54:38,482
-Knock and shout "trick-or-treat".
-I could offer him some honey.

841
00:54:38,566 --> 00:54:40,359
I don't think
Gobloons eat honey.

842
00:54:40,443 --> 00:54:42,736
Well, he could sure
have all of my spinach.

843
00:54:46,950 --> 00:54:50,494
Um, Mr Gobloon?

844
00:54:53,832 --> 00:54:56,542
I don't want candy.

845
00:54:56,626 --> 00:54:59,128
All I care about is Lumpy.

846
00:55:00,380 --> 00:55:03,340
I wish my friend back.

847
00:55:07,470 --> 00:55:10,306
You hear me, you
mean old Gobloon?

848
00:55:10,390 --> 00:55:12,433
I want my friend back!

849
00:55:12,517 --> 00:55:15,352
Roo? Roo! I'm in here!

850
00:55:51,389 --> 00:55:53,057
Lumpy?

851
00:55:53,141 --> 00:55:54,767
-You're OK!
-lt worked.

852
00:55:54,851 --> 00:55:58,937
-Things couldn't get better.
-Roo wished Lumpy back!

853
00:56:00,732 --> 00:56:02,483
-lt worked!
-Oh, yes!

854
00:56:02,567 --> 00:56:05,611
Now, that's what I
call a happy ending.

855
00:56:06,488 --> 00:56:08,530
I'm sorry I ran away, Lumpy.

856
00:56:08,656 --> 00:56:10,908
I was just so scared.

857
00:56:10,992 --> 00:56:12,493
Would you...

858
00:56:12,577 --> 00:56:15,454
Could you... forgive me?

859
00:56:15,580 --> 00:56:19,083
Gosh, Roo, you
came back for me.

860
00:56:19,167 --> 00:56:21,001
That was brave.

861
00:56:21,086 --> 00:56:25,547
I guess thinking about being
with you made me brave.

862
00:56:25,632 --> 00:56:28,926
-Brave together?
-Brave forever.

863
00:56:29,010 --> 00:56:31,720
Conquerors of the Gobloon!

864
00:56:31,805 --> 00:56:33,305
-Hooray!
-Hooray for us!

865
00:56:33,390 --> 00:56:35,766
Who needs candy to have
a great Halloween?

866
00:56:35,850 --> 00:56:37,559
When we've got each other.

867
00:56:38,436 --> 00:56:40,437
You know, it seems to me

868
00:56:40,522 --> 00:56:43,107
there's only one
thing left to say.

869
00:56:43,191 --> 00:56:44,650
I know, I know.

870
00:56:44,734 --> 00:56:46,235
Trick-or-Treat.

871
00:56:47,737 --> 00:56:50,406
-Gasp!
-Happy Halloween, everyone!

872
00:56:50,490 --> 00:56:51,824
Trick-or-Treat.

873
00:56:54,119 --> 00:56:55,994
Mama!

874
00:56:56,079 --> 00:56:57,162
Come in.

875
00:56:57,247 --> 00:57:00,624
I baked cookies and
rumpledoodles for everybody.

876
00:57:00,708 --> 00:57:03,377
And I made a special
jack-o'-lantern

877
00:57:03,420 --> 00:57:05,587
for each and every one of you.

878
00:57:07,298 --> 00:57:09,425
Hello, gorgeous.

879
00:57:10,677 --> 00:57:13,053
Doesn't look like me at all.

880
00:57:13,138 --> 00:57:15,305
Why the long face?

881
00:57:15,390 --> 00:57:19,268
Oh, look, Piglet. It's me
and my very best friend.

882
00:57:19,352 --> 00:57:20,853
Oh, mine too!

883
00:57:20,979 --> 00:57:22,980
Look, Lumpy. There's
even one for me.

884
00:57:23,064 --> 00:57:24,898
-Wow!
-But where's yours?

885
00:57:24,983 --> 00:57:26,608
I'm so sorry, Lumpy.

886
00:57:26,693 --> 00:57:28,485
I did make one for you,

887
00:57:28,570 --> 00:57:31,280
but it must have fallen
off my wheelbarrow.

888
00:57:34,868 --> 00:57:36,452
See? I told you.

889
00:57:36,578 --> 00:57:39,288
Halloween is the most fun ever.

890
00:57:39,372 --> 00:57:42,332
You were right. I
love Hallowoon.

891
00:57:42,417 --> 00:57:45,252
Hallow-woo... Hallow...

892
00:57:45,336 --> 00:57:46,462
Oh, whatever.

893
00:57:46,546 --> 00:57:49,214
As long as we're together.

894
00:57:49,549 --> 00:57:52,718
We are daring to be scaring

895
00:57:52,802 --> 00:57:55,554
Who's behind that
mask you're wearing?

896
00:57:55,638 --> 00:57:59,433
We can "Boo!" a spooky greetin' Then
we'll share the sweets we're eating

897
00:57:59,517 --> 00:58:03,896
When we're home from
trick or treating

898
00:58:03,980 --> 00:58:06,857
With our friends

899
00:58:18,578 --> 00:58:20,579
We're friends forever

900
00:58:20,663 --> 00:58:22,664
We'll be brave together

901
00:58:22,749 --> 00:58:27,127
We can weather
whatever comes along

902
00:58:27,212 --> 00:58:28,921
One can do it Two is better

903
00:58:29,005 --> 00:58:30,797
You and me together forever

904
00:58:30,882 --> 00:58:33,091
Braver than brave
Stronger than strong

905
00:58:33,218 --> 00:58:34,927
Brave together Singing our song

906
00:58:35,011 --> 00:58:36,970
-We're friends forever
-One can do it, two is better

907
00:58:37,055 --> 00:58:39,223
-We'll be brave together
-You and me together forever

908
00:58:39,307 --> 00:58:41,266
-We can weather
-Braver than brave stronger than strong

909
00:58:41,351 --> 00:58:43,477
-Whatever comes along
-We're brave together singing our song

910
00:58:43,561 --> 00:58:45,229
Rumple de doodle Rumple dee dee

911
00:58:45,313 --> 00:58:47,564
We'll rumble and tumble
like bumbly bees

912
00:58:47,649 --> 00:58:49,691
Two together Together we're one

913
00:58:49,817 --> 00:58:51,693
Rumple de doodle
De doodle de dum

914
00:58:51,778 --> 00:58:53,654
-You're my buddy
-You're mine too

915
00:58:53,738 --> 00:58:55,822
-If I get scared
-I'm right behind you

916
00:58:55,907 --> 00:59:00,327
lt would be super if we could be
the bravest friends in history

917
00:59:02,038 --> 00:59:06,250
We're friends forever
We'll be brave together

918
00:59:06,334 --> 00:59:14,341
We can weather
whatever comes along

919
00:59:14,425 --> 00:59:16,426
We can weather

920
00:59:16,511 --> 00:59:21,723
Whatever comes along

Name: Wild Roots
Subtitle Data: ﻿1 00:00:45,499 --> 00:00:48,259 WILD ROOTS 2 00:00:50,420 --> 00:00:53,219 Hey buddy! It's time to leave, we are closing. 3 00:00:53,300 --> 00:00:56,539 - I'll just drink this. - You'll drink it outside. Move! 4 00:00:58,259 --> 00:00:59,499 Hey! 5 00:01:00,980 --> 00:01:03,660 Sleeping beauty! Wake up! 6 00:02:13,780 --> 00:02:15,340 Hey! You can't do that here! 7 00:02:16,340 --> 00:02:17,699 Put the brush back and go! 8 00:02:19,739 --> 00:02:21,539 Are you deaf? Put the brush back! 9 00:02:40,060 --> 00:02:43,660 - Was she expelled? - We were going to leave, anyway. 10 00:02:43,739 --> 00:02:47,340 They don't pay much attention to children there. It's better for Niki here. 11 00:02:47,900 --> 00:02:49,579 Wasn't she going to come too? 12 00:02:50,380 --> 00:02:52,819 She had a bellyache, and went to the bathroom. 13 00:02:52,900 --> 00:02:54,819 - Are you the child's legal guardian? - Yes. 14 00:02:55,139 --> 00:02:57,419 - And her parents? - Her mother died. 15 00:02:57,819 --> 00:03:01,259 - My condolences. And her father? - We don't keep in touch. 16 00:03:01,340 --> 00:03:04,100 She could join the sixth graders even today. 17 00:03:04,180 --> 00:03:06,780 But if she feels sick then she should rest. 18 00:03:09,019 --> 00:03:09,979 Did you hear? 19 00:03:12,660 --> 00:03:15,620 Karola, long time no see. 20 00:03:22,739 --> 00:03:24,620 Hello, how can I help you? 21 00:03:24,699 --> 00:03:28,460 Hello... I have a savings account with a prize car. 22 00:03:28,539 --> 00:03:29,380 You won a car? 23 00:03:30,660 --> 00:03:34,419 - No, I need the money from the account. - Your passbook, please. 24 00:03:34,500 --> 00:03:35,819 And if I don't have it? 25 00:03:36,220 --> 00:03:39,139 I'd suggest that you find it and then come back again. 26 00:03:39,859 --> 00:03:42,259 - Then I'd say I can't get it. - How so? 27 00:03:42,340 --> 00:03:43,579 Like I said. 28 00:03:44,060 --> 00:03:45,460 I don't want to get into this, but... 29 00:03:45,539 --> 00:03:50,340 You're in it now, there must be some record of my money here. 30 00:03:50,419 --> 00:03:52,220 That's what a passbook is for. 31 00:03:52,739 --> 00:03:54,859 It's the official record that you invested at our bank. 32 00:03:55,579 --> 00:03:57,859 Without it, anyone could come in and claim money. 33 00:03:58,419 --> 00:04:01,739 You mean it's not here? Where the fuck is it? 34 00:04:02,299 --> 00:04:04,780 Calm down please, or else I can't help you. 35 00:04:11,660 --> 00:04:12,579 Here you are. 36 00:04:13,299 --> 00:04:15,460 ID. Address card. As if that were an excuse. 638 01:11:34,060 --> 01:11:35,339 You know what? 639 01:11:39,980 --> 01:11:41,419 Here, buy the shoes. 640 01:11:41,900 --> 01:11:45,259 But my daughter was hurt, and this won't undo it. 641 01:11:46,900 --> 01:11:47,900 Do you want it? 642 01:11:50,179 --> 01:11:51,100 Me neither. 643 01:11:51,419 --> 01:11:54,940 It seems the only way to get even is if I shit on your daughter's shoes. 644 01:11:55,020 --> 01:11:57,219 Let's stop, right here. Please, leave. 645 01:11:58,860 --> 01:11:59,940 Gladly. 646 01:12:00,020 --> 01:12:01,219 Niki, are you coming? 647 01:12:37,780 --> 01:12:38,700 You have a car? 648 01:12:39,740 --> 01:12:40,660 Rad. 649 01:12:48,780 --> 01:12:50,060 Where are we going? 650 01:12:54,700 --> 01:12:56,499 Elvira lawyer 651 01:13:02,259 --> 01:13:04,499 Wanna come with me to Barcelona? 652 01:13:06,379 --> 01:13:08,299 I'd have a job there... 653 01:13:10,379 --> 01:13:13,219 What do you say? We'll leave all these assholes behind. 654 01:13:14,499 --> 01:13:15,499 Cool. 655 01:13:17,299 --> 01:13:19,900 - But we can't take your phone with us. - Why? 656 01:13:19,980 --> 01:13:22,419 Don't worry, I'll buy you a better one. 657 01:13:57,179 --> 01:13:59,219 What's the beach like? Pebbles or sand? 658 01:13:59,299 --> 01:14:01,820 - Whichever you want. - I'd prefer pebbles. 659 01:14:01,900 --> 01:14:04,419 The water is much clearer, and I can see my feet. 660 01:15:39,339 --> 01:15:40,259 Pump no. 4. 661 01:15:41,020 --> 01:15:42,620 5710 Forints. 662 01:15:47,660 --> 01:15:48,860 This too? 663 01:15:50,060 --> 01:15:51,139 8Yeah. 664 01:16:03,539 --> 01:16:05,179 8805 Forints. 665 01:16:10,020 --> 01:16:13,219 Fuck, I thought I had more money. Do you have any? 666 01:16:28,020 --> 01:16:29,860 That's enough for the gas. 667 01:16:36,379 --> 01:16:39,820 - Then we won't take these. - Just leave them here. 668 01:16:42,860 --> 01:16:44,100 Thanks. 669 01:16:50,539 --> 01:16:52,900 Yes... that's a good girl. 670 01:16:55,299 --> 01:16:56,860 We're almost done. 671 01:17:00,459 --> 01:17:01,419 All right. 672 01:17:02,459 --> 01:17:03,900 Good girl. 673 01:17:04,299 --> 01:17:05,740 You're a good girl. 674 01:17:09,539 --> 01:17:11,100 We're almost done. 675 01:17:11,499 --> 01:17:12,900 Okay. 676 01:17:13,459 --> 01:17:14,660 There you go. 677 01:17:22,700 --> 01:17:25,259 There. Now we lift this up. 678 01:17:26,299 --> 01:17:27,219 Okay. 679 01:17:36,539 --> 01:17:38,499 It's okay now. 680 01:17:44,100 --> 01:17:45,259 Almost done. 681 01:17:47,820 --> 01:17:49,299 We're just about done. 682 01:18:07,820 --> 01:18:10,740 If all goes well, we'll be on the beach tomorrow. 683 01:18:14,459 --> 01:18:16,940 Cool right? 684 01:18:37,139 --> 01:18:39,820 - What's wrong? - Be quiet for a moment. 685 01:18:39,900 --> 01:18:41,419 What's going on? 686 01:19:38,940 --> 01:19:39,740 Are you hurt? 687 01:20:06,339 --> 01:20:07,459 What's wrong? 688 01:20:09,820 --> 01:20:11,740 I thought we were in trouble. 689 01:20:20,259 --> 01:20:22,139 Everything will be all right. 690 01:20:24,660 --> 01:20:26,660 Everything will be all right. 691 01:22:57,940 --> 01:22:59,219 Niki. 692 01:23:02,419 --> 01:23:03,579 Niki. 693 01:23:14,660 --> 01:23:15,940 Why have we come back? 694 01:23:17,579 --> 01:23:18,980 We're not going away? 695 01:23:20,259 --> 01:23:22,700 - You promised! - You're expected at home. 696 01:23:22,780 --> 01:23:24,060 You promised! 697 01:23:27,379 --> 01:23:29,940 - We can't go to Barcelona right now. - Why? 698 01:23:30,539 --> 01:23:31,780 I was convicted. 699 01:23:34,100 --> 01:23:35,940 Because of that fight you saw. 700 01:23:36,620 --> 01:23:37,980 Will you go away? 701 01:23:39,100 --> 01:23:40,060 Again? 702 01:24:04,740 --> 01:24:05,820 I'll come back. 703 01:24:09,219 --> 01:24:10,660 Now, go. 704 01:24:25,620 --> 01:24:26,780 Niki. 705 01:26:09,259 --> 01:26:10,700 - Good evening. - Good evening. 706 01:26:10,780 --> 01:26:12,179 Evening. 707 01:26:15,620 --> 01:26:17,339 I think you're looking for me. 708 01:26:20,860 --> 01:26:22,259 Tibor Kondor. 709 01:26:24,820 --> 01:26:27,100 - Get to the front of the car. - I'll call dispatch. 710 01:26:27,780 --> 01:26:29,419 Put your hands on the hood. 711 01:26:30,139 --> 01:26:32,780 I'm going to frisk your clothes, understood? 712 01:26:32,860 --> 01:26:33,860 Yes. 713 01:26:33,940 --> 01:26:35,020 -What? -I understand. 714 01:26:35,100 --> 01:26:38,780 ...Tibor Kondor gave himself up. He is currently being taken into custody. 715 01:26:44,660 --> 01:26:45,780 Hey! 716 01:26:46,339 --> 01:26:47,259 Stop!

Name: Baantjer het begin
Subtitle Data:
﻿1
00:00:00,291 --> 00:00:07,041
…Queen Beatrix reached the deck of the
ship with her mother Juliana, and from…

2
00:00:07,125 --> 00:00:11,625
…tonight on Vijzelstraat and Leidsestraat,

3
00:00:11,708 --> 00:00:15,541
with Leidseplein and Koningsplein
on either side.

4
00:00:15,625 --> 00:00:20,666
There has been as much damage
as was paid for the festivities.

5
00:00:20,750 --> 00:00:23,375
…pure vandalism.

6
00:00:23,458 --> 00:00:26,750
"Horrible, awful
and an unbelievable shame,"

7
00:00:26,833 --> 00:00:30,041
were the socialist politician's words.

8
00:00:30,125 --> 00:00:34,791
He felt these actions
were an attempt to cause mayhem.

9
00:00:34,875 --> 00:00:38,958
There have also been reactions
to unrest elsewhere in the country.

10
00:00:39,041 --> 00:00:44,666
NOS management believes the reports
on the event have been responsible.

11
00:00:45,833 --> 00:00:49,541
We will conclude
with the weather until tomorrow evening.

12
00:02:02,291 --> 00:02:04,958
- Yeah?
- Good afternoon.

13
00:02:05,041 --> 00:02:09,333
The owner of this building kindly
requests you to vacate the premises.

14
00:02:09,416 --> 00:02:10,416
Oh yeah?

15
00:02:12,958 --> 00:02:14,750
Where's the owner then?

16
00:02:14,833 --> 00:02:18,375
What he does with his house
is none of our business. So…

17
00:02:18,458 --> 00:02:19,833
Listen, idiot.

18
00:02:19,916 --> 00:02:23,583
If the owner wants us to leave,
he can come here and tell us himself.

19
00:02:49,708 --> 00:02:51,250
No.

20
00:03:53,958 --> 00:03:57,666
The rest of the royal family
boarded the S.S. Beatrix…

21
00:03:57,750 --> 00:03:59,416
7 DAYS UNTIL THE CORONATION

22
00:03:59,500 --> 00:04:01,125
…to watch the fireworks.

23
00:04:01,208 --> 00:04:05,333
At the same time fighting and looting
took place in Amsterdam's city center

24
00:04:05,416 --> 00:04:09,041
as a result of the violent turmoil
earlier this afternoon.

25
00:04:09,125 --> 00:04:12,250
In backroom talks it was decided…

26
00:04:27,250 --> 00:04:31,541
The guy in two is barfing the whole day.
I've had it. Somebody take care of him.

27
00:04:31,625 --> 00:04:36,500
George, put Shayla in five,
and release the Chinaman in four.

28
00:04:36,583 --> 00:04:42,708
This fucking mess is driving me crazy,
people. A tidy house is a tidy mind.

29
00:04:44,250 --> 00:04:47,500
- Talk to me, honey.
- Good day. I have an appointment.

30
00:04:49,875 --> 00:04:51,333
Jurriaan DeKok.

31
00:04:52,416 --> 00:04:54,333
Keep your fucking hands to yourself.

32
00:04:54,416 --> 00:05:01,208
- It's K-O-K.
- Congratulations. With capital letters?

33
00:05:01,291 --> 00:05:03,791
For a tenner you can blow me.

34
00:05:03,875 --> 00:05:05,416
- Freek.
- Virginia.

35
00:05:05,500 --> 00:05:08,458
Virginia, sit down
or I'm going to call your mother.

36
00:05:10,208 --> 00:05:13,416
He'll also do it for a fiver.
Who do you need?

37
00:05:13,500 --> 00:05:15,291
Mr Montijn.

38
00:05:16,125 --> 00:05:20,000
Tonnie Montijn.
The meeting was for half past nine.

39
00:05:23,250 --> 00:05:25,750
- With Tonnie?
- That's right.

40
00:05:25,833 --> 00:05:27,791
Around the corner.

41
00:05:27,875 --> 00:05:30,500
- This way?
- He's at Lowietje.

42
00:05:34,708 --> 00:05:36,000
Nice shoes.

43
00:05:36,083 --> 00:05:39,708
The riots in the capital
lasted until the evening.

44
00:05:39,791 --> 00:05:41,333
We're closed.

45
00:05:42,625 --> 00:05:44,458
Hey idiot, you deaf?

46
00:05:45,666 --> 00:05:49,916
No, I have an appointment
with a Mr Montijn.

47
00:05:50,000 --> 00:05:52,208
Tscheu La Ling.

48
00:05:52,291 --> 00:05:54,708
I just don't get it.

49
00:05:54,791 --> 00:05:56,916
Fucking unbelievable.

50
00:05:57,000 --> 00:06:00,333
Boy oh boy.
Tscheu La fucking Ling.

51
00:06:00,416 --> 00:06:03,958
Why do we need this half ass Chinaman
when we got Vanenburg.

52
00:06:04,041 --> 00:06:07,291
- Have they lost their minds?
- You know what Ajax should do?

53
00:06:07,375 --> 00:06:09,125
- Well?
- Get Cruijff back.

54
00:06:09,208 --> 00:06:10,375
In your dreams.

55
00:06:11,875 --> 00:06:13,041
Soccer?

56
00:06:14,416 --> 00:06:16,916
- You must be with the police.
- Uh, yes.

57
00:06:17,000 --> 00:06:21,958
- Lowie. Get Sherlock some coffee.
- Oh no, thank you, I'm okay.

58
00:06:22,041 --> 00:06:23,750
Did you just come from the gym?

59
00:06:28,750 --> 00:06:33,750
I just wanted to say that I'm glad
to receive this opportunity.

60
00:06:35,541 --> 00:06:40,041
- What opportunity?
- To work together.

61
00:06:40,125 --> 00:06:42,583
- Work together?
- Correct.

62
00:06:42,666 --> 00:06:47,125
I got a letter from the commissioner,
De Woerd.

63
00:06:47,208 --> 00:06:50,708
A response to my application.
He said that I am to work with you.

64
00:06:50,791 --> 00:06:51,875
Urk.

65
00:06:52,708 --> 00:06:55,666
Yes. Born and raised.

66
00:06:57,000 --> 00:06:58,708
Do you have cash on you?

67
00:07:01,625 --> 00:07:02,958
No.

68
00:07:06,875 --> 00:07:12,125
Lesson one:
Always have money on you around here.

69
00:07:16,208 --> 00:07:18,875
- Well, I'll see you later then.
- Sorry?

70
00:07:18,958 --> 00:07:22,166
Half past nine, right?

71
00:07:22,250 --> 00:07:26,125
Half past nine in the evening, mate.
Night shift.

72
00:07:30,791 --> 00:07:32,791
You done, honey?

73
00:07:34,500 --> 00:07:36,625
- You were terrific.
- Bye, darling.

74
00:07:37,916 --> 00:07:42,500
- Well, what can I do for you?
- I'm just waiting.

75
00:07:42,583 --> 00:07:47,541
What for? The tram? The only line
that runs around here is line 69.

76
00:07:48,708 --> 00:07:51,958
- Hey, early bird.
- Tonnie, you owe me a tenner.

77
00:07:52,041 --> 00:07:54,833
Get rid of your crotch crickets yet,
Rebecca?

78
00:07:54,916 --> 00:07:58,458
Screw you, limp dick.
Fuck off, asshole.

79
00:07:58,541 --> 00:08:00,750
Leave that at home.
For your own safety.

80
00:08:00,833 --> 00:08:03,541
This week two cops
have been sent to the hospital.

81
00:08:03,625 --> 00:08:07,458
And if you're with me,
everyone will know who you are.

82
00:08:07,541 --> 00:08:10,958
Hey Richard, take it easy.
I know where to find you.

83
00:08:11,041 --> 00:08:16,041
The lingo is different too. Lesson two:
A fiver is different than the Five-O.

84
00:08:16,125 --> 00:08:20,500
And a buck is different than a fuck.
You'll get the hang of it.

85
00:08:20,583 --> 00:08:22,375
- Hey, doll.
- Hot stuff.

86
00:08:22,458 --> 00:08:25,583
- By the way, do you have a house?
- Yes, I found a place.

87
00:08:25,666 --> 00:08:28,291
Great.
That seems to be a problem nowadays.

88
00:08:28,375 --> 00:08:30,875
- Whereabouts?
- On Zeedijk.

89
00:08:30,958 --> 00:08:34,333
Nice. If you want your mail
to smell like piss.

90
00:08:34,416 --> 00:08:37,333
- Wife? Girlfriend? Kids?
- Uh, no.

91
00:08:37,416 --> 00:08:39,916
- Boyfriend?
- No, nothing.

92
00:08:40,000 --> 00:08:43,083
It doesn't matter to me.
Everything goes in Amsterdam.

93
00:08:43,166 --> 00:08:44,375
I am single.

94
00:08:44,458 --> 00:08:48,958
That'll save you a lot of trouble when
you get shot in the face. Here we are.

95
00:08:49,041 --> 00:08:50,250
Nell?

96
00:08:51,625 --> 00:08:53,708
Nellie?

97
00:08:53,791 --> 00:08:55,625
Nell?

98
00:08:55,708 --> 00:08:57,500
- Nellie?
- Hey, cutie.

99
00:08:57,583 --> 00:08:59,166
Hey, Tonnie.

100
00:08:59,250 --> 00:09:02,250
I'm looking for Ron.
You know where he is?

101
00:09:02,333 --> 00:09:04,875
Who's Ron?

102
00:09:04,958 --> 00:09:06,583
Really?

103
00:09:07,708 --> 00:09:10,958
Are you serious? Have it your way.

104
00:09:11,041 --> 00:09:12,583
Ron?

105
00:09:13,833 --> 00:09:15,708
Ronny?

106
00:09:19,583 --> 00:09:22,750
- Fuck off, man. I'm busy.
- Hi, Tonnie.

107
00:09:22,833 --> 00:09:24,416
- Asshole.
- Sorry.

108
00:09:24,500 --> 00:09:29,291
Ton, quit it. He's upstairs.

109
00:09:29,375 --> 00:09:31,833
Now, was that so difficult?

110
00:09:35,083 --> 00:09:38,833
Urk is new, and he's happily single.

111
00:09:39,666 --> 00:09:43,083
For another one of these
you'll get a half hour with me.

112
00:09:43,166 --> 00:09:46,958
What kind of tourist rates are those?
How long have we known each other?

113
00:09:47,041 --> 00:09:50,250
- Block is my friend.
- It's DeKok.

114
00:09:52,041 --> 00:09:54,083
Often misspelled as C-O-C-K.

115
00:10:01,791 --> 00:10:03,416
Ronny?

116
00:10:10,166 --> 00:10:11,791
Ronny?

117
00:10:13,125 --> 00:10:14,416
Ron?

118
00:10:17,791 --> 00:10:19,458
Ronny?

119
00:10:22,625 --> 00:10:26,166
I've had it with this bullshit.
How am I supposed to get it up?

120
00:10:28,541 --> 00:10:30,541
Urk, give me a hand.

121
00:10:31,541 --> 00:10:32,625
Urk?

122
00:10:37,208 --> 00:10:40,291
- Don't point your gun at me, man.
- Leave me alone, faggot.

123
00:10:40,375 --> 00:10:43,416
Talk to me with some respect,
you filthy junk.

124
00:10:43,500 --> 00:10:48,208
- I've already said, if he calls me…
- Shut up, Ron. I'm busy.

125
00:10:48,291 --> 00:10:50,166
Not like this.

126
00:10:50,250 --> 00:10:53,625
A drug-related crime, Urk.
Fished it right out of his pocket.

127
00:10:53,708 --> 00:10:58,666
- You planted that there.
- Get up. On your knees. Sit down.

128
00:10:58,750 --> 00:11:01,500
Keep an eye on David Bowie here,
will you.

129
00:11:02,875 --> 00:11:05,083
Let's see what he brought along.

130
00:11:09,541 --> 00:11:13,833
Look what I found here.
That's so generous. Thanks, buddy.

131
00:11:14,541 --> 00:11:17,416
Those pills are for my heart.

132
00:11:17,500 --> 00:11:21,541
- Maybe I should…
- Keep an eye on your suspect, detective.

133
00:11:28,583 --> 00:11:30,750
Goddammit.

134
00:11:36,583 --> 00:11:39,041
Hell of a first day, DeKok.

135
00:12:27,208 --> 00:12:30,250
- Sorry. Sorry.
- Go away.

136
00:12:57,583 --> 00:12:59,208
Thanks, asshole.

137
00:13:30,916 --> 00:13:33,125
You got some speed, DeKok.

138
00:13:33,208 --> 00:13:36,083
Lesson three:
Never chase trams, junkies or women.

139
00:13:36,166 --> 00:13:38,250
There'll always be a next one. Hey, Ron.

140
00:13:40,416 --> 00:13:41,958
What?

141
00:13:50,375 --> 00:13:53,250
- Let's go. Give me the keys.
- What?

142
00:13:53,333 --> 00:13:55,500
Come on, Urk, move it.
Go, go, go.

143
00:13:55,583 --> 00:13:58,958
Let's go. Let precinct Rapenburg
pull it out of the canal.

144
00:13:59,041 --> 00:14:02,541
- But I already had it called in.
- What?

145
00:14:04,125 --> 00:14:05,875
Seriously?

146
00:14:18,083 --> 00:14:24,291
- So, Tonnie. You pulled out a drunkard?
- And a squatter to boot.

147
00:14:25,041 --> 00:14:27,250
That's going to be a week of paperwork.

148
00:14:27,333 --> 00:14:32,208
- Why didn't you call precinct Rapenburg?
- That's what we would've done.

149
00:14:38,666 --> 00:14:42,291
- I didn't know you…
- It's best if you stay away from me.

150
00:14:46,125 --> 00:14:48,416
6 DAYS UNTIL THE CORONATION

151
00:14:48,500 --> 00:14:53,125
Can someone tell me why our sweet
Lord and Savior hates my fucking guts?

152
00:14:53,208 --> 00:14:58,583
I see you thinking:
"But, Chief, you're a man who has it all.

153
00:14:58,666 --> 00:15:05,125
You have a pretty face,
you're a natural leader…"

154
00:15:05,208 --> 00:15:07,041
- Humble.
- Yes, humble.

155
00:15:07,125 --> 00:15:12,541
Thanks, Van Kemenade.
So why the long face?

156
00:15:14,208 --> 00:15:18,625
Jesse Schippers. Thierry Lejeune.
Maxine de Waard.

157
00:15:18,708 --> 00:15:20,958
We know who they are.
We know where they live.

158
00:15:21,041 --> 00:15:25,041
And we know they've got something
planned on Coronation Day.

159
00:15:25,125 --> 00:15:29,583
It's our job to make sure
it doesn't turn into a goddamn disaster.

160
00:15:29,666 --> 00:15:35,916
However, I just received a call
from our wonderful mayor himself

161
00:15:36,000 --> 00:15:41,458
saying we should keep our hands off
of them if we don't have any proof.

162
00:15:41,541 --> 00:15:44,083
- Ridiculous.
- Something about the constitution.

163
00:15:44,166 --> 00:15:47,208
- Oh, that old thing.
- So we're going to be busy this week.

164
00:15:47,291 --> 00:15:52,625
- I have 35 full-timers in the hospital.
- Look, the canal cops.

165
00:15:52,708 --> 00:15:57,375
And to make matters worse,
my star detective decided

166
00:15:57,458 --> 00:16:02,208
that it was a good idea
to fish a drunk pisser from the canal.

167
00:16:02,291 --> 00:16:03,791
Montijn, my office.

168
00:16:03,875 --> 00:16:07,416
Glad someone here
is still doing the hard work.

169
00:16:07,500 --> 00:16:11,541
District South called saying there's
a cat in a tree, maybe you can help?

170
00:16:12,625 --> 00:16:15,791
Maybe you should go.
You haven't had pussy in while.

171
00:16:17,208 --> 00:16:19,375
He's allergic.

172
00:16:19,458 --> 00:16:21,958
No, he means pussy.

173
00:16:24,500 --> 00:16:25,958
Good one.

174
00:16:29,083 --> 00:16:35,958
Fingers off of my blinds, Tonnie.
Only I can touch my blinds. Got it?

175
00:16:36,041 --> 00:16:40,166
Half my squad is in the hospital
and you pull a drunkard out of the canal.

176
00:16:40,250 --> 00:16:44,625
- We have uniformed officers for that.
- Sorry, sir, it's my fault.

177
00:16:44,708 --> 00:16:48,958
I thought "Vigilance while they rest"
was our motto. I didn't know…

178
00:16:50,000 --> 00:16:52,333
- Tonnie?
- Chief.

179
00:16:52,416 --> 00:16:54,375
Who is this?

180
00:16:54,458 --> 00:16:55,833
Jurriaan DeKok, sir.

181
00:16:55,916 --> 00:16:58,500
We spoke on the phone.
It's my first day.

182
00:16:58,583 --> 00:17:03,416
Well, you're off to a great start, DeKok.
How long is your trial period?

183
00:17:03,500 --> 00:17:08,500
We'll stop by the morgue, pull down
his fly, take a photo, and we're done.

184
00:17:08,583 --> 00:17:14,541
I want a short report. Don't piss away
time with the coronation coming up.

185
00:17:14,625 --> 00:17:15,750
Yes, Chief.

186
00:17:15,833 --> 00:17:19,583
What were you doing there anyway?
Don't you have anything better to do?

187
00:17:19,666 --> 00:17:23,750
We were making the rounds
when Jurre here saw him floating. Right?

188
00:17:24,708 --> 00:17:27,000
- Uh, yeah.
- You have two days.

189
00:17:27,083 --> 00:17:28,541
Understood, Chief.

190
00:17:34,208 --> 00:17:37,291
- Sorry.
- Sorry for what?

191
00:17:37,375 --> 00:17:40,333
Sorry I didn't know
we weren't supposed to…

192
00:17:40,416 --> 00:17:45,000
If it gets me away from the coronation
for two days, I'm happy.

193
00:17:46,041 --> 00:17:47,875
I almost forgot.

194
00:17:48,791 --> 00:17:55,416
- Your cut from Ron.
- Oh no, that's alright.

195
00:17:55,500 --> 00:18:00,708
- Sure? Have you seen your pay check?
- Yeah, it's fine. Really.

196
00:18:00,791 --> 00:18:04,416
Ron would've used this
to buy smack, heroin.

197
00:18:06,541 --> 00:18:10,041
You'll learn soon enough
that it's not all black and white.

198
00:18:10,125 --> 00:18:12,000
I'm hungry. Let's go.

199
00:18:14,125 --> 00:18:16,083
Or did you have other plans?

200
00:18:16,166 --> 00:18:17,791
- Ma?
- Hey, Tonnie.

201
00:18:17,875 --> 00:18:21,708
We're getting a bite to eat.
This is Jurre, my new partner.

202
00:18:23,333 --> 00:18:27,375
- Hello, ma'am. Jurre DeKok.
- Nice to meet you. Louise Montijn.

203
00:18:27,458 --> 00:18:31,750
Nice you finally brought someone along.
If it's not a good time…

204
00:18:31,833 --> 00:18:34,625
No problem.
I'll peel some extra potatoes.

205
00:18:34,708 --> 00:18:36,916
- Where's fatty?
- At school.

206
00:18:37,000 --> 00:18:39,666
My daughter, Pien, goes to university.

207
00:18:40,416 --> 00:18:43,791
Jurre's from Urk. They only have
an elementary school over there.

208
00:18:43,875 --> 00:18:47,208
Nothing wrong with that.
I also only went to elementary school.

209
00:18:47,291 --> 00:18:50,041
Oh no, I finished college.

210
00:18:50,125 --> 00:18:53,125
He fished a corpse
out of the canal last night.

211
00:18:53,208 --> 00:18:57,000
Christ's sake. I don't want
to hear about that before dinner.

212
00:18:57,083 --> 00:19:01,208
- Hang up his jacket, will you.
- This will be the first and last time.

213
00:19:01,750 --> 00:19:04,250
- Ma?
- That's Pien.

214
00:19:05,375 --> 00:19:08,166
Good to see you, fatty.

215
00:19:09,208 --> 00:19:11,666
- Have you been smoking again?
- No, my friends.

216
00:19:11,750 --> 00:19:15,208
- I have friends, unlike you.
- Very funny. This is Jurre.

217
00:19:17,500 --> 00:19:19,500
- Hi.
- Hi.

218
00:19:20,708 --> 00:19:22,458
Jurre DeKok.

219
00:19:25,291 --> 00:19:29,708
I see this was a mistake, Ma.
We're kicking him out after dinner.

220
00:19:29,791 --> 00:19:32,541
- Here you go.
- Tonnie. Jacket.

221
00:19:35,541 --> 00:19:38,375
- Want me to hang yours up too, fatty?
- Yes.

222
00:19:38,458 --> 00:19:39,833
Cheers.

223
00:19:42,000 --> 00:19:47,666
The tanks were followed by hundreds
of police and gendarmerie officers.

224
00:19:47,750 --> 00:19:48,875
Some youngsters…

225
00:19:48,958 --> 00:19:52,708
Can you please turn that off?
We have a guest.

226
00:19:52,791 --> 00:19:56,791
Tanks. Unbelievable.
It's as if the goddamn krauts are back.

227
00:19:56,875 --> 00:20:00,666
- But they are.
- I think Claus is a really nice man.

228
00:20:00,750 --> 00:20:03,583
And he seems perfect for Beatrix.

229
00:20:04,916 --> 00:20:08,166
At the university
they don't really like the royal family.

230
00:20:08,250 --> 00:20:12,458
We don't like their money, which could
be used to solve the housing shortage.

231
00:20:12,541 --> 00:20:15,041
You have a house. You live here.

232
00:20:15,125 --> 00:20:17,000
- Please.
- Yeah, we do.

233
00:20:17,083 --> 00:20:20,791
If that scum wants to live somewhere,
they should get a job.

234
00:20:20,875 --> 00:20:26,791
- What job? There are no jobs.
- Jurre has a job. And he also has a house.

235
00:20:26,875 --> 00:20:31,500
- This is lovely. Really lovely.
- Yes? Great.

236
00:20:31,583 --> 00:20:34,958
They're a bunch of filthy freeloaders.
They're fucking lazy.

237
00:20:35,041 --> 00:20:38,125
- You sound just like Dad.
- That's enough!

238
00:20:43,125 --> 00:20:45,958
Jurre, would you like some coffee?

239
00:20:46,916 --> 00:20:49,666
Oh no, let me help.

240
00:20:50,250 --> 00:20:54,083
You see. That's what they learn in Urk.
Work.

241
00:20:54,166 --> 00:20:55,958
Work.

242
00:21:00,250 --> 00:21:03,708
Jurre has a very refreshing appearance.

243
00:21:08,625 --> 00:21:11,083
- What?
- Nothing.

244
00:21:18,750 --> 00:21:20,458
I saw you.

245
00:21:21,958 --> 00:21:23,291
Good for you.

246
00:21:24,375 --> 00:21:27,833
- In the squat.
- The squat?

247
00:21:29,666 --> 00:21:32,416
Why would I be in a squat?
I have a home.

248
00:21:33,208 --> 00:21:38,000
And you? Do you have a home
with its own kitchen?

249
00:21:38,083 --> 00:21:41,125
Or do you eat with someone else
every evening?

250
00:21:43,583 --> 00:21:45,875
I'm certain it was you.

251
00:21:46,625 --> 00:21:49,208
Maybe in your dreams.

252
00:21:51,083 --> 00:21:56,458
Listen, I understand you have sympathy
for the squatters and want to help them.

253
00:21:58,583 --> 00:22:01,583
Their hard core isn't playing games.

254
00:22:01,666 --> 00:22:05,958
Thank you for your concern, officer.
I'll take it into consideration.

255
00:22:10,708 --> 00:22:13,708
Now you'll probably tell Tonnie
everything, right?

256
00:22:19,833 --> 00:22:21,416
This one's still dirty.

257
00:22:30,750 --> 00:22:32,916
5 DAYS UNTIL THE CORONATION

258
00:22:33,000 --> 00:22:36,708
This guy drank a little more
than just canal water.

259
00:22:40,958 --> 00:22:45,708
Anyway, forehead wound
inflicted by a blunt object.

260
00:22:45,791 --> 00:22:50,666
Maybe a pole, or something
at the bottom of the canal.

261
00:22:50,750 --> 00:22:54,000
- That was the cause of death?
- No. He drowned.

262
00:22:54,083 --> 00:22:57,208
- Tumbled in while pissing?
- Well…

263
00:22:57,291 --> 00:22:59,416
Don't say "well."
Why did you say "well"?

264
00:22:59,500 --> 00:23:02,250
With the amount of alcohol
and heroin in his system

265
00:23:02,333 --> 00:23:06,166
I doubt he could even stand upright,
let alone open his fly.

266
00:23:07,083 --> 00:23:12,333
- Maybe he had help.
- My first guess, but I'm not sure,

267
00:23:12,416 --> 00:23:15,666
is that his unconscious body
was dumped into the canal.

268
00:23:15,750 --> 00:23:19,416
- So it's murder.
- The rookie is eager.

269
00:23:19,500 --> 00:23:23,375
Listen, he fell asleep on the ledge
and rolled into the canal.

270
00:23:23,458 --> 00:23:26,708
- Happens all the time.
- Yes, but then there's also this.

271
00:23:33,541 --> 00:23:38,208
- You could've just started with this.
- Yeah, but I like to keep it exciting.

272
00:23:38,291 --> 00:23:43,500
- Rat. Maybe he was an informant.
- Not one of mine in any case.

273
00:23:43,583 --> 00:23:48,375
Since I like you guys so much,
there is also some good news.

274
00:23:48,458 --> 00:23:53,583
His pockets were empty, of course,
but they forgot to check his boots.

275
00:23:53,666 --> 00:23:58,500
Take a look at that. Thank you.
Here you go, DeKok.

276
00:23:59,625 --> 00:24:03,166
Let's roll. I can't stand the stench here.
Later, babe.

277
00:24:07,250 --> 00:24:08,666
Bye?

278
00:24:14,375 --> 00:24:19,166
"John Doe drowned in his own
state of mind." How does that sound?

279
00:24:28,916 --> 00:24:31,000
- Tonnie?
- Yeah?

280
00:24:32,208 --> 00:24:33,708
Duivendrecht.

281
00:24:41,375 --> 00:24:43,708
Number three is ours.

282
00:25:04,291 --> 00:25:06,250
Just great.

283
00:25:07,083 --> 00:25:08,583
Christ.

284
00:25:11,625 --> 00:25:13,125
Lesson seven:

285
00:25:13,208 --> 00:25:17,208
A search warrant is only needed
when someone sees you entering.

286
00:25:17,291 --> 00:25:21,458
That's not the case now.
Can you shine the light over here?

287
00:25:26,750 --> 00:25:28,208
Here you go.

288
00:25:43,708 --> 00:25:45,583
- Jurre?
- Yeah?

289
00:25:47,583 --> 00:25:50,250
- Do me a favor.
- Sure.

290
00:25:51,875 --> 00:25:55,166
The next time you see a body
floating in the canal…

291
00:25:55,250 --> 00:25:59,041
- I'll just leave him there.
- That would be great.

292
00:26:11,250 --> 00:26:14,208
4 DAYS UNTIL THE CORONATION

293
00:26:14,291 --> 00:26:19,125
We found a floor plan of the New Church
where the coronation will take place.

294
00:26:19,208 --> 00:26:21,458
- Maybe it's fake.
- It's not.

295
00:26:21,541 --> 00:26:24,375
- I don't mean the floor plan, but…
- Wait.

296
00:26:29,541 --> 00:26:33,750
It's the same floor plan.
Upper House, Lower House,

297
00:26:33,833 --> 00:26:36,500
the president of France,
the crown prince of England.

298
00:26:36,583 --> 00:26:40,750
There are maybe a hundred people
who've been given a floor plan like this.

299
00:26:40,833 --> 00:26:44,875
- A hundred and one, apparently.
- Show me that photo again.

300
00:26:48,416 --> 00:26:50,916
- You sure you don't know him?
- No, Chief.

301
00:26:51,000 --> 00:26:56,166
Goddammit. I told them to do the ceremony
at Soestdijk or in The Hague,

302
00:26:56,250 --> 00:27:00,791
but no, no, no, it has to be here,
in our neck of the woods.

303
00:27:02,000 --> 00:27:05,333
- What are we going to do?
- We have four days.

304
00:27:07,458 --> 00:27:13,333
Take a forensic team with you.
If there's even one fingerprint pointing

305
00:27:13,416 --> 00:27:18,458
towards one of the squatters in charge,
I can finally lock them all up.

306
00:27:18,541 --> 00:27:21,625
Tonnie. Only the two of you.

307
00:27:22,958 --> 00:27:25,500
Gentlemen, knock yourself out.

308
00:27:44,875 --> 00:27:49,000
- You got to explain me one thing, DeKok.
- What?

309
00:27:49,083 --> 00:27:51,875
Why here? Why the Red Light District?

310
00:27:54,041 --> 00:28:00,291
