00:20:14,778 --> 00:20:17,509
When did you start believing in destiny?

306
00:20:18,177 --> 00:20:22,195
It just... came right at me.

307
00:20:22,196 --> 00:20:25,402
- So destiny just came right up to you.
- Hey, I'm serious.

308
00:20:25,403 --> 00:20:28,623
There's something
different about this time.

309
00:20:29,204 --> 00:20:31,690
My heart is in knots.

310
00:20:34,487 --> 00:20:36,147
All right then.

311
00:20:36,800 --> 00:20:39,938
Another line for your crush notebook.

312
00:20:39,939 --> 00:20:41,305
Oh, the notebook?

313
00:20:41,306 --> 00:20:42,804
I lost it.

314
00:20:42,805 --> 00:20:44,832
I dropped it somewhere.

315
00:20:49,917 --> 00:20:53,600
I don't need it anymore!
No more crushes for me.

316
00:20:53,601 --> 00:20:55,323
No more crushes?

317
00:20:56,313 --> 00:20:57,586
I'm going to ask him out.

318
00:20:57,587 --> 00:20:59,274
What?

319
00:21:07,984 --> 00:21:09,699
I'm going to ask him out.

320
00:21:09,700 --> 00:21:13,692
It's finally time for me to be brave.

321
00:21:13,693 --> 00:21:16,791
Or else, it will be one
crush after another.

322
00:21:18,111 --> 00:21:20,110
You don't have to be that brave.

323
00:21:20,111 --> 00:21:23,102
Chanho might like shy girls-
- Anyway!

324
00:21:23,103 --> 00:21:25,783
- I'm counting on you.
- For what?

325
00:21:25,784 --> 00:21:28,074
We've been friends for four years.

326
00:21:28,075 --> 00:21:30,092
So, who else but you?

327
00:21:30,093 --> 00:21:33,489
This is my "phone a friend" chance.

328
00:21:34,885 --> 00:21:37,124
Look... We went to high school with Chanho.

329
00:21:37,125 --> 00:21:39,780
He had no feelings for you
then, so why would he now?

330
00:21:39,781 --> 00:21:41,788
I'm only saying this for your sake.

331
00:21:41,789 --> 00:21:43,599
In case he says no.

332
00:21:43,600 --> 00:21:46,899
Help me out? What are good friends for?

333
00:21:46,900 --> 00:21:50,612
When will I ever ask you for
a favor like this if not now?

334
00:21:51,174 --> 00:21:54,497
Just once. Come on. Just this once!

335
00:22:02,730 --> 00:22:03,939
[28 - Lee JanHo]

336
00:22:03,940 --> 00:22:06,998
My heart just sank to my stomach.

337
00:22:06,999 --> 00:22:09,509
Is it because of you?

338
00:22:10,785 --> 00:22:15,798
Or... is it this brave
face that I'm putting on?

339
00:22:16,397 --> 00:22:18,614
This is an impressive resume.

340
00:22:18,615 --> 00:22:24,309
Woosung Bio, Mega Corp, Bando Group.

341
00:22:24,310 --> 00:22:27,296
Daegun Logistics' ransomware was also his?

342
00:22:27,297 --> 00:22:29,487
This is interesting.

343
00:22:29,488 --> 00:22:34,134
They are all under investigation for
corruption and hiring irregularities.

344
00:22:34,135 --> 00:22:37,306
The fact that he only exposed
their servers and left,

345
00:22:37,307 --> 00:22:40,386
tells me that he wasn't out
to extract personal info.

346
00:22:40,387 --> 00:22:43,653
He's either a psychopath
crying out for attention,

347
00:22:43,654 --> 00:22:46,900
or he's looking for someone in our field.

348
00:22:47,407 --> 00:22:49,219
It's one or the other.

349
00:22:49,220 --> 00:22:52,100
[HEX]

350
00:22:54,397 --> 00:22:56,903
- Hey, Jaemin.
- Yeah?

351
00:22:56,904 --> 00:23:00,723
Do you think... I'm...

352
00:23:01,388 --> 00:23:03,399
a little lame?

353
00:23:03,400 --> 00:23:05,114
Why?

354
00:23:05,874 --> 00:23:08,792
Chanho is a bit

355
00:23:08,793 --> 00:23:10,890
out of my league, right?

356
00:23:13,094 --> 00:23:14,410
Hey!

357
00:23:14,411 --> 00:23:18,384
Why are you talking down to
yourself so seriously like that?

358
00:23:19,722 --> 00:23:22,738
That guy... Chanho...

359
00:23:22,739 --> 00:23:26,386
was a bit popular when
we were in high school.

360
00:23:26,387 --> 00:23:29,192
No, he was super popular!

361
00:23:29,193 --> 00:23:33,412
He could have been a K-pop
idol with a face like that.

362
00:23:35,083 --> 00:23:38,023
He was academically great too.

363
00:23:41,986 --> 00:23:45,304
Wasn't I also cool when we were younger?

364
00:23:45,305 --> 00:23:48,591
You are sobering me up.

365
00:23:48,592 --> 00:23:51,298
Was that a serious question?

366
00:23:51,802 --> 00:23:54,802
Woah, you don't have to burn me like that.

367
00:23:55,260 --> 00:23:59,784
You were different from Chanho.

368
00:24:00,806 --> 00:24:04,012
You were the kind of type
that attracted party girls.

369
00:24:04,013 --> 00:24:06,305
You had this mint chocolate vibe.

370
00:24:06,306 --> 00:24:08,277
Only liked by a certain group.

371
00:24:08,278 --> 00:24:10,201
Definitely controversial.

372
00:24:10,202 --> 00:24:13,154
Tasted like toothpaste or chocolate.
Neither one nor the other.

373
00:24:13,155 --> 00:24:16,901
They were good kids. You only
judge a book by its cover.

374
00:24:16,902 --> 00:24:18,302
Also, toothpaste?

375
00:24:18,303 --> 00:24:21,315
If I was toothpaste, was Chanho mouthwash?

376
00:24:21,316 --> 00:24:23,808
No, no, no.

377
00:24:23,809 --> 00:24:26,406
He was a classic, luxurious chocolate.

378
00:24:26,407 --> 00:24:28,511
From Belgium, like Godiva?

379
00:24:28,512 --> 00:24:30,397
Everyone loved Chanho.

380
00:24:30,398 --> 00:24:32,923
He was smart, kind, honest.

381
00:24:32,924 --> 00:24:36,008
All the teachers really liked him, too.

382
00:24:36,790 --> 00:24:40,575
I got along with some teachers, too.

383
00:24:40,576 --> 00:24:44,902
Oh, yeah! Remember that teacher
that was only good to Chanho?

384
00:24:46,994 --> 00:24:49,087
What's next period?

385
00:24:49,531 --> 00:24:52,143
Hey, hey! This isn't a flea market!

386
00:24:52,144 --> 00:24:54,109
Hey, you are running down the corridor!

387
00:24:54,110 --> 00:24:56,404
Join the track team if you want to run!

388
00:24:56,405 --> 00:24:58,711
Punks.

389
00:25:00,488 --> 00:25:05,007
Chanho, could you get the mock
exam results from my office?

390
00:25:05,008 --> 00:25:07,697
You came first again. Don't study too hard.

391
00:25:07,698 --> 00:25:10,192
Spare some hope for the others.

392
00:25:10,193 --> 00:25:11,898
Yes, sir.

393
00:25:11,899 --> 00:25:13,569
Anyway, that kid.

394
00:25:13,570 --> 00:25:17,806
Always looks like he's goofing off
but his test scores are always good.

395
00:25:17,807 --> 00:25:20,702
He was second again. Just below you.

396
00:25:20,703 --> 00:25:24,282
Your homeroom teacher must
be happy to have both of you.

397
00:25:24,283 --> 00:25:26,600
I'm just lucky.

398
00:25:38,796 --> 00:25:40,997
He's a rare breed.

399
00:25:50,174 --> 00:25:52,100
You didn't have to walk me home.

400
00:25:52,101 --> 00:25:53,399
Chivalry is it?

401
00:25:53,400 --> 00:25:54,906
Hey.

402
00:25:54,907 --> 00:25:57,200
I think you two look alike.

403
00:25:57,201 --> 00:25:58,126
With who?

404
00:25:58,127 --> 00:26:02,094
- Mr. Park.
- You asshole! I look like my mom!

405
00:26:05,591 --> 00:26:08,016
What are you doing?

406
00:26:08,017 --> 00:26:09,620
You don't.

407
00:26:09,621 --> 00:26:11,720
You look exactly like the dean.

408
00:26:11,721 --> 00:26:13,600
The long-faced version.

409
00:26:13,601 --> 00:26:15,173
Ugh, Mr. Park.

410
00:26:15,174 --> 00:26:17,200
- You're asking for it!
- Hey!

411
00:26:17,201 --> 00:26:18,299
Lately?

412
00:26:18,300 --> 00:26:20,228
Nothing.

413
00:26:21,113 --> 00:26:22,388
My dad.

414
00:26:22,389 --> 00:26:25,835
The dean?

415
00:26:27,272 --> 00:26:30,311
You know my situation.

416
00:26:31,520 --> 00:26:35,206
There's no need to send a car.
I'll be fine on my own.

417
00:26:35,804 --> 00:26:40,605
So, there is no real pressure, right?

418
00:26:41,216 --> 00:26:45,420
Okay. I'll see you then.

419
00:26:49,607 --> 00:26:52,814
She better be home soon.

420
00:26:59,001 --> 00:27:01,794
He's still his usual self.

421
00:27:02,547 --> 00:27:04,956
Yeah.

422
00:27:09,199 --> 00:27:11,591
Why is it so stuffy out here?

423
00:27:11,592 --> 00:27:13,384
It's hot out, right?

424
00:27:13,385 --> 00:27:14,514
Yeah.

425
00:27:14,515 --> 00:27:17,921
Then, shall we go?

426
00:27:33,580 --> 00:27:35,050
[hacker BW]

427
00:27:36,570 --> 00:27:38,711
What the hell is this?

428
00:27:42,397 --> 00:27:45,450
I didn't want to go down this road but...

429
00:27:46,511 --> 00:27:49,409
When a citizen is in trouble,

430
00:27:49,410 --> 00:27:52,125
you call on your government to help.

431
00:27:52,896 --> 00:27:55,923
I believe in you, Cyber Bureau.

432
00:28:02,725 --> 00:28:05,199
Damn it.

433
00:28:05,200 --> 00:28:06,600
[New Message Arrived]

434
00:28:25,398 --> 00:28:26,404
What is this?

435
00:28:26,405 --> 00:28:29,671
[To. Hex, We welcome you to Better World.
Press "Yes" to accept.]

436
00:28:31,176 --> 00:28:34,183
I didn't even have to
ask for an invitation.

437
00:28:36,301 --> 00:28:39,169
[Come to Hwarang Hall B1, Room 4]
[Deletes in 3 seconds.]

438
00:28:39,170 --> 00:28:41,327
What's that?

439
00:28:41,328 --> 00:28:44,205
What is it? What's up with you?

440
00:28:44,206 --> 00:28:47,191
You really snuck up on me. Are you a ninja?

441
00:28:47,192 --> 00:28:48,993
Is it a movie?

442
00:28:49,802 --> 00:28:50,987
What movie?

443
00:28:50,988 --> 00:28:54,088
Weren't you watching a spy movie?

444
00:28:56,115 --> 00:28:58,630
Right! The background music.

445
00:28:59,388 --> 00:29:03,800
Chanho, Hwarang Hall is where all
our school clubs are gathered. Right?

446
00:29:03,801 --> 00:29:04,860
I think so.

447
00:29:04,861 --> 00:29:08,161
But most of them moved
into the new hall recently.

448
00:29:08,887 --> 00:29:10,287
I see.

449
00:29:10,288 --> 00:29:14,786
I'm not sure which clubs are still there.

450
00:29:16,698 --> 00:29:21,190
That's where the old medical
school anatomy room used to be.

451
00:29:21,191 --> 00:29:23,597
It's spooky down there.

452
00:29:23,598 --> 00:29:26,732
People said there are ghosts down there.

453
00:29:38,508 --> 00:29:39,772
This is nuts.

454
00:29:39,773 --> 00:29:42,127
Who cares if they fucking come out.

455
00:29:42,128 --> 00:29:44,274
Ghosts aren't real.

456
00:30:59,740 --> 00:31:01,830
There was a moth in my dress!

457
00:31:02,390 --> 00:31:03,422
What?

458
00:31:03,423 --> 00:31:06,500
Spill it. I have class soon.

459
00:31:12,130 --> 00:31:16,069
No ghost is going to touch us like this!

460
00:31:16,070 --> 00:31:18,130
I'm definitely less scared now.

461
00:31:25,712 --> 00:31:26,757
This isn't so bad.

462
00:31:27,709 --> 00:31:28,768
Totally less scared.

463
00:31:34,103 --> 00:31:37,808
Kyungshik, when have I
ever made a bad deal?

464
00:31:37,809 --> 00:31:40,708
Then my name isn't Nam Hyungsoo.
A shrewd investor!

465
00:31:40,709 --> 00:31:44,007
The contrarian strategist!
The emperor of risk!

466
00:31:44,008 --> 00:31:49,001
I know. I'm just slightly worried
about that contrarian investing.

467
00:31:49,002 --> 00:31:52,702
You're the most successful person from
our high school friends. I know that.

468
00:31:52,703 --> 00:31:56,414
Yeah, yeah. Just come and listen, okay?

469
00:31:56,415 --> 00:31:58,585
It will turn your head.

470
00:31:58,586 --> 00:32:01,014
I don't have the money to invest right now.

471
00:32:01,015 --> 00:32:02,208
Are you doubting me?

472
00:32:02,209 --> 00:32:06,999
Don't you remember that I gave you
the most money at your wedding?

473
00:32:07,000 --> 00:32:09,290
That was ages ago.

474
00:32:10,233 --> 00:32:16,295
Come on now. How long are you going
to live like that? Come on, Kyungshik!

475
00:32:16,296 --> 00:32:19,816
You have to try living it up for once.

476
00:32:19,817 --> 00:32:25,187
If you don't want Joohee on your back down
the road, you have to start preparing now.

477
00:32:25,188 --> 00:32:28,221
She's in art school. There
are tuition and living costs.

478
00:32:28,222 --> 00:32:30,549
Soon, she will ask you for a year abroad.

479
00:32:30,550 --> 00:32:33,114
After graduation, when she's job hunting,

480
00:32:33,115 --> 00:32:35,902
you think she's getting married on her own?

481
00:32:35,903 --> 00:32:39,560
Fat chance if you don't
have the money these days.

482
00:32:40,110 --> 00:32:43,006
You even threw your pension
away on that fried chicken shop.

483
00:32:43,007 --> 00:32:46,202
All right! I'll hear what they have to say.

484
00:32:46,203 --> 00:32:52,209
Just stay for one coffee!
It will change your life.

485
00:32:52,210 --> 00:32:54,150
You were a teacher for 30 years,

486
00:32:54,151 --> 00:32:58,105
now is the time to plan for the
rest of your life as your own boss!

487
00:32:58,106 --> 00:33:01,400
This opportunity is a game-changer!

488
00:33:02,120 --> 00:33:03,129
[Check your login history... There is no login
history. Check your internet access history...]

489
00:33:03,130 --> 00:33:05,570
[No internet access history.
Check your download history...]

490
00:33:11,780 --> 00:33:15,020
[Overview and Summary: If you want to
collect events that have occurred since...]

491
00:33:17,594 --> 00:33:19,130
Who are you?

492
00:33:20,483 --> 00:33:22,215
Hello.

493
00:33:22,216 --> 00:33:23,909
You're that fencer.

494
00:33:23,910 --> 00:33:26,070
That's right.

495
00:33:28,800 --> 00:33:30,769
You're the TA, can I ask you something?

496
00:33:30,770 --> 00:33:32,089
Of course.

497
00:33:32,090 --> 00:33:36,010
Is Hwarang Hall down on the basement floor?

498
00:33:36,513 --> 00:33:39,787
Well, there was the anatomy room.

499
00:33:39,788 --> 00:33:45,387
Ah right. Was there a
school club down there?

500
00:33:45,388 --> 00:33:47,689
Was the name of the club, Better...

501
00:33:47,690 --> 00:33:48,670
[To. Hex, We welcome you to Better World.
Press "Yes" to accept.]

502
00:33:48,671 --> 00:33:50,814
What's that?

503
00:33:50,815 --> 00:33:52,620
World? Was that the name?

504
00:33:52,621 --> 00:33:55,795
Better World... Better World!

505
00:33:55,796 --> 00:33:58,301
- Isn't that a retro game club?
- A game club?

506
00:33:58,302 --> 00:34:01,667
Everyone avoids going
there because it's scary.

507
00:34:01,668 --> 00:34:05,080
Anyhow, I'm not too sure.

508
00:34:06,120 --> 00:34:07,463
Anything else you want to...

509
00:34:07,464 --> 00:34:08,579
Do you have any que-

510
00:34:08,580 --> 00:34:10,170
Nope.

511
00:34:15,089 --> 00:34:19,319
What are you doing? Open it.

512
00:34:19,320 --> 00:34:21,795
You sure?

513
00:34:21,796 --> 00:34:24,799
Of course, I am. Just leave it then?

514
00:34:24,800 --> 00:34:27,575
No, it's just... Can't you open it?

515
00:34:27,576 --> 00:34:29,586
Come on! Hurry up and open it!

516
00:34:29,587 --> 00:34:32,869
You don't have to yell.
I was about to open it.

517
00:34:32,870 --> 00:34:37,240
I'm totally ready. I would have
opened it if you didn't yell.

518
00:34:48,940 --> 00:34:50,820
Bond. James Bond.

519
00:34:51,370 --> 00:34:53,727
That was quite the entrance.

520
00:34:53,728 --> 00:34:57,610
What are you going to do
about my protein powder, huh?

521
00:35:03,479 --> 00:35:05,404
Welcome.

522
00:35:05,405 --> 00:35:08,997
Through hacking, we strive
to create a better world.

523
00:35:08,998 --> 00:35:14,392
We are a white hacker group and
that is Better World's mission.

524
00:35:14,393 --> 00:35:19,114
We're not only based in South Korea,
think of us as a global club alliance.

525
00:35:19,115 --> 00:35:23,696
So, under the banner of "Better
World," we help people oppose crackers-

526
00:35:23,697 --> 00:35:28,204
Oppose hackers? So, you two?

527
00:35:28,205 --> 00:35:30,920
But why me?

528
00:35:32,396 --> 00:35:35,514
Oh my goodness! Is someone after me?

529
00:35:35,515 --> 00:35:39,007
Why would they? What are you?

530
00:35:39,008 --> 00:35:41,522
Why you and what are you?

531
00:35:41,523 --> 00:35:42,784
I am-

532
00:35:42,785 --> 00:35:46,597
Stop! No, that's not what he's asking.

533
00:35:46,598 --> 00:35:49,990
We aren't interested in you at all.

534
00:35:49,991 --> 00:35:52,580
It's your friend.

535
00:35:55,789 --> 00:35:59,388
You've got the wrong idea.
He's not that kind of person.

536
00:35:59,389 --> 00:36:00,829
He's nothing, really.

537
00:36:00,830 --> 00:36:02,709
What? What do you mean I'm nothing?

538
00:36:02,710 --> 00:36:06,998
We need you. Your skills to be precise.

539
00:36:06,999 --> 00:36:11,151
The very skill that made you reach
the top ten at Def Con as a junior.

540
00:36:11,152 --> 00:36:13,197
The Korean team won thanks
to your skills, right?

541
00:36:13,198 --> 00:36:18,664
What is this? A detective agency?
You've got the wrong guy.

542
00:36:18,665 --> 00:36:22,280
Join Better World. You're
going to need us too.

543
00:36:22,281 --> 00:36:24,107
It's a win-win.

544
00:36:24,108 --> 00:36:27,688
Do we have to do it like this?
I don't like the way it looks.

545
00:36:27,689 --> 00:36:31,710
Well, I don't either.
Thanks for the fun meeting.

546
00:36:32,256 --> 00:36:37,495
Hey, you think we spent our precious time
on you because we liked your lousy resume?

547

00:54:57,302 --> 00:54:58,999
A phone call.

800
00:55:06,974 --> 00:55:08,152
Hey!

801
00:55:08,153 --> 00:55:10,952
You're going to miss out on her.

802
00:55:10,953 --> 00:55:13,598
Huh? You two aren't dating?

803
00:55:13,599 --> 00:55:15,378
What are you on about?

804
00:55:15,379 --> 00:55:17,240
Don't try to deny it.

805
00:55:17,241 --> 00:55:21,430
Don't wait until it's too late.
Ask her out while you still can.

806
00:55:27,509 --> 00:55:29,554
Oh... Really?

807
00:55:29,555 --> 00:55:31,302
Okay.

808
00:55:32,420 --> 00:55:34,665
But it was super fun!

809
00:55:34,666 --> 00:55:36,593
A bit like "Ocean's Eleven"?

810
00:55:36,594 --> 00:55:38,574
It felt like I was in "The Thieves".

811
00:55:38,575 --> 00:55:41,998
I almost cried out, "I'm in!"

812
00:55:43,434 --> 00:55:47,946
Also, thanks for screwing over those guys.

813
00:55:47,947 --> 00:55:51,130
You were a bit cooler than usual today.

814
00:56:07,621 --> 00:56:09,906
Oh, hey! We're already here.

815
00:56:09,907 --> 00:56:11,287
I'll be going in now.

816
00:56:11,288 --> 00:56:13,918
- Hey, Joohee-
- Anyway, thanks for the help friend!

817
00:56:13,919 --> 00:56:17,724
Hooray to 16 years of friendship!
I'll buy you a fridge when you marry!

818
00:56:17,725 --> 00:56:19,916
Get me a washer for mine, front load!

819
00:56:19,917 --> 00:56:22,936
Yeah, a front-loader. Not top load.

820
00:56:29,695 --> 00:56:31,439
Hooray... 16 years of friendship.

821
00:56:31,440 --> 00:56:34,689
♫ I think about you every moment ♫

822
00:56:34,690 --> 00:56:40,139
♫ I was so happy, I liked it ♫

823
00:56:40,140 --> 00:56:44,259
♫ Your pretty expression
when you look at me ♫

824
00:56:44,260 --> 00:56:46,939
♫ Because it's so precious to me ♫

825
00:56:46,940 --> 00:56:49,559
♫ I smile when I look at you ♫

826
00:56:49,560 --> 00:56:53,789
♫ My heart that I didn't know yet ♫

827
00:56:53,790 --> 00:56:56,689
Park Joohee, you are going crazy.

828
00:56:56,690 --> 00:56:59,202
Snap out it! Snap out!

829
00:56:59,203 --> 00:57:01,732
You're insane. Insane!

830
00:57:01,733 --> 00:57:03,299
Alcohol is the enemy.

831
00:57:03,300 --> 00:57:09,790
♫ The way I love you... 'Cuz
we're not just friends ♫

832
00:57:21,362 --> 00:57:23,786
"An unlisted company posing
as a leading cryptocurrency

833
00:57:23,787 --> 00:57:28,221
was arrested after attempting to
defraud investors. [OZ PC Reserve]

834
00:57:28,222 --> 00:57:32,002
The scammers held investment seminars
nationwide and the group responsible

835
00:57:32,003 --> 00:57:35,711
for their arrest came from an
unlikely source. The police found

836
00:57:35,712 --> 00:57:38,711
that it was a hacker organization.

837
00:57:38,712 --> 00:57:43,605
Seoul's Cyber Bureau is currently
investigating the identity of the group."

838
00:57:45,290 --> 00:57:47,649
They did something even
the government couldn't do.

839
00:57:47,650 --> 00:57:49,598
I guess they did.

840
00:57:49,599 --> 00:57:50,815
Isn't it amazing?

841
00:57:50,816 --> 00:57:55,129
If it wasn't for them, people
would have lost millions.

842
00:57:55,130 --> 00:57:59,299
In a way, we need more vigilantes
than centralized power.

843
00:57:59,300 --> 00:58:02,515
Yeah, in a way.

844
00:58:03,823 --> 00:58:07,093
But isn't it a bit dangerous?

845
00:58:07,094 --> 00:58:10,688
How long until you fall off the tightrope?

846
00:58:10,689 --> 00:58:16,318
Within the rule of law, you ought to
live with your feet on the ground.

847
00:58:17,900 --> 00:58:21,088
Will you dangerously sway on
the tightrope in the dark?

848
00:58:21,089 --> 00:58:23,004
Or will you come out to the sun?

849
00:58:23,005 --> 00:58:25,117
You decide.

850
00:58:25,118 --> 00:58:28,010
- Those hackers.
- Sorry?

851
00:58:28,797 --> 00:58:31,170
Yeah, those hackers.

852
00:58:32,975 --> 00:58:35,403
Our primordial instinct
is to live on the ground.

853
00:58:35,404 --> 00:58:40,600
It might be the only thing stopping
them from walking down a dangerous path.

854
00:58:40,601 --> 00:58:42,793
What do you think?

855
00:58:42,794 --> 00:58:44,918
How will we know?

856
00:58:44,919 --> 00:58:49,592
The same people on our side today,
might be on the other side tomorrow.

857
00:58:49,593 --> 00:58:52,463
The other... side?

858
00:58:52,464 --> 00:58:56,277
You're freaking me out, why are so serious?

859
00:58:56,278 --> 00:58:58,081
I'll be going now.

860
00:58:58,082 --> 00:59:00,004
See you later.

861
00:59:24,076 --> 00:59:27,988
At a building located on
Tehran-ro in Gangnam, Seoul,

862
00:59:27,989 --> 00:59:29,998
- CEO of Alt Coin, Mr. Kim,
- Sons of bitches.

863
00:59:29,999 --> 00:59:31,992
Held a seminar to attract investors.

864
00:59:31,993 --> 00:59:35,359
Why? Did you give them all of your money?

865
00:59:35,360 --> 00:59:38,309
No way.

866
00:59:38,310 --> 00:59:41,910
The only thing I gave was 28
years of my life as a teacher

867
00:59:41,911 --> 00:59:44,362
and my idiotic attempt at
running a fried chicken store,

868
00:59:44,363 --> 00:59:47,722
wasting 80 million won on the
basement floor of a run-down mall.

869
00:59:47,723 --> 00:59:49,917
Don't be so negative.

870
00:59:49,918 --> 00:59:53,221
It's not easy raising a daughter
as a single dad for 10 years.

871
00:59:53,222 --> 00:59:56,388
I told you to remarry
to the laundromat lady!

872
00:59:58,700 --> 01:00:01,124
- Joohee.
- What?

873
01:00:01,125 --> 01:00:04,671
Do you want to study abroad?

874
01:00:04,672 --> 01:00:07,293
That's random, what are you on about?

875
01:00:07,294 --> 01:00:11,699
When you were in eighth grade
you wanted to study in New York.

876
01:00:11,700 --> 01:00:14,605
- At Pass?
- Parsons.

877
01:00:14,606 --> 01:00:17,916
That's a fashion school anyway.
I ended up choosing art, remember?

878
01:00:17,917 --> 01:00:20,340
Be a more attentive father.

879
01:00:22,736 --> 01:00:24,942
For six years during
middle and high school.

880
01:00:24,943 --> 01:00:29,174
You changed your career path 22
times, same with your crushes.

881
01:00:29,175 --> 01:00:31,398
And I'm not an attentive father.

882
01:00:31,399 --> 01:00:35,155
Your crush in 12th grade must
have been an art student.

883
01:00:36,070 --> 01:00:37,083
That's enough.

884
01:00:37,084 --> 01:00:39,142
And you wanted to follow him to New York.

885
01:00:39,143 --> 01:00:40,516
Have you heard of Covid-19?

886
01:00:40,517 --> 01:00:43,019
Korea is doing well. Studying
abroad is a bad idea.

887
01:00:43,020 --> 01:00:44,638
Do you ever worry

888
01:00:44,639 --> 01:00:48,801
that your dad won't be able to
buy you a nice wedding dress?

889
01:00:48,802 --> 01:00:50,975
- Do you?
- I'm only twenty years old!

890
01:00:50,976 --> 01:00:54,598
I told you to be quiet
when we do our masks.

891
01:00:54,599 --> 01:00:56,795
Your dad is still alive!

892
01:00:56,796 --> 01:00:59,677
Don't worry about money
and do what you want.

893
01:00:59,678 --> 01:01:02,131
Have I ever asked you to sell
the house for a start-up?

894
01:01:02,132 --> 01:01:05,692
Or asked to borrow what's
left of your pension?

895
01:01:06,991 --> 01:01:09,077
Is it andropause?

896
01:01:11,753 --> 01:01:15,326
I, Park Kyungshik, am in the
second chapter of my life.

897
01:01:17,217 --> 01:01:20,336
Luck! Fortune!

898
01:01:22,444 --> 01:01:26,904
That's a man finally breaking after
being stuck in traffic for hours.

899
01:01:32,359 --> 01:01:35,516
You know there are many bars around here.

900
01:01:35,517 --> 01:01:38,007
The convenience store isn't so bad.

901
01:01:38,008 --> 01:01:40,686
I really wanted to do this with you.

902
01:01:40,687 --> 01:01:42,308
- What is "this"?
- You know,

903
01:01:42,309 --> 01:01:45,234
cracking open some beers on
a nice night with a friend.

904
01:01:45,235 --> 01:01:47,220
When will we do this again?

905
01:01:47,221 --> 01:01:48,574
We have military duty soon.

906
01:01:48,575 --> 01:01:52,034
Once that's done, we are back on
campus with freshmen crawling around.

907
01:01:52,035 --> 01:01:54,212
Do you think we'll be able to?

908
01:01:54,213 --> 01:01:55,706
The romance of youth!

909
01:01:55,707 --> 01:01:57,421
Romance?

910
01:01:58,381 --> 01:02:00,813
You haven't changed at all, Jaemin.

911
01:02:00,814 --> 01:02:02,025
The same as high school.

912
01:02:02,026 --> 01:02:06,120
Even though we weren't
close in high school,

913
01:02:09,596 --> 01:02:11,226
"I have to drink with this guy,"

914
01:02:11,227 --> 01:02:12,707
is what I thought.

915
01:02:12,708 --> 01:02:13,915
Why me?

916
01:02:13,916 --> 01:02:16,230
Dude, you were so smart in high school.

917
01:02:16,231 --> 01:02:17,601
The thing is...

918
01:02:17,602 --> 01:02:24,011
people want to experience a unique,
tight bond with the best of the best.

919
01:02:24,012 --> 01:02:28,811
That's rich coming from you. You didn't
even study after school and you did great.

920
01:02:28,812 --> 01:02:30,025
Guess I did.

921
01:02:30,026 --> 01:02:32,205
In fact, I thought you were so arrogant.

922
01:02:32,206 --> 01:02:35,144
Whom are you calling arrogant? You
were worse. Following around teachers,

923
01:02:35,145 --> 01:02:36,387
like a teacher's pet.

924
01:02:36,388 --> 01:02:39,173
No way, they were following me.

925
01:02:39,174 --> 01:02:43,496
To them, I was the kid that chose
liberal arts over a science high school.

926
01:02:43,497 --> 01:02:45,097
Their attention was too much.

927
01:02:45,098 --> 01:02:49,098
I knew how the other kids saw me.
I understand.

928
01:02:50,597 --> 01:02:54,014
You are way more arrogant than I thought.

929
01:03:00,057 --> 01:03:03,303
Do you have a girl you like?

930
01:03:03,304 --> 01:03:05,282
A girl?

931
01:03:05,283 --> 01:03:06,587
Why?

932
01:03:06,588 --> 01:03:08,591
You have someone in mind?

933
01:03:09,495 --> 01:03:12,105
Well, I could introduce you.

934
01:03:13,315 --> 01:03:14,540
You want me to?

935
01:03:14,541 --> 01:03:18,167
Actually, I already have someone I like.

936
01:03:18,168 --> 01:03:19,661
You do?

937
01:03:19,662 --> 01:03:21,132
Who?

938
01:03:21,133 --> 01:03:23,292
She must be a catch if you are into her.

939
01:03:23,293 --> 01:03:26,093
- Do I know her?
- It's Joohee.

940
01:03:27,386 --> 01:03:29,812
Joohee? What's her surname?

941
01:03:29,813 --> 01:03:31,623
Park Joohee.

942
01:03:32,504 --> 01:03:34,718
Well, it is a common name.

943
01:03:34,719 --> 01:03:38,874
Is there another Park Joohee we know?

944
01:03:38,875 --> 01:03:43,120
Our friend Park Joohee?
You seriously like her?

945
01:03:43,121 --> 01:03:46,823
The same Park Joohee that
we went to high school with?

946
01:03:46,824 --> 01:03:49,268
The very same Joohee that
studies art at Hankuk University?

947
01:03:49,269 --> 01:03:50,776
Yeah.

948
01:03:50,777 --> 01:03:53,434
That's one hell of a reaction.

949
01:03:56,769 --> 01:03:58,967
Can I go out with Joohee?

950
01:04:00,579 --> 01:04:02,291
Why are you asking me for?

951
01:04:02,292 --> 01:04:04,948
Because you and Joohee are best friends.

952
01:04:04,949 --> 01:04:06,159
Best friends?

953
01:04:06,160 --> 01:04:08,106
Are we?

954
01:04:10,396 --> 01:04:12,899
She's not some object needing approval,

955
01:04:12,900 --> 01:04:15,417
whether you two should date,

956
01:04:17,519 --> 01:04:19,334
that decision,

957
01:04:19,808 --> 01:04:21,818
is between you two.

958
01:04:22,666 --> 01:04:25,944
I thought you were interested in her.

959
01:04:25,945 --> 01:04:27,510
Guess not, huh?

960
01:04:27,511 --> 01:04:29,510
That's a relief.

961
01:04:29,511 --> 01:04:31,025
Yeah.

962
01:04:31,496 --> 01:04:33,411
I'm...

963
01:04:48,292 --> 01:04:50,078
Can I go out with Joohee?

964
01:04:50,079 --> 01:04:51,822
Why are you asking me for?

965
01:04:51,823 --> 01:04:55,136
Because you and Joohee are best friends.

966
01:05:12,002 --> 01:05:15,042
[YOUKNOWWHAT uploaded a new post.
Next Target: Songdo International Exchange]

967
01:05:25,987 --> 01:05:28,297
Songdo International Exchange.

968
01:05:28,807 --> 01:05:31,651
Recognized by FINMA from Switzerland as

969
01:05:31,652 --> 01:05:34,004
Asia's first cryptocurrency.

970
01:05:34,005 --> 01:05:36,346
Saw a meteoric rise on the back
of the crypto sector's interest

971
01:05:36,347 --> 01:05:38,102
with record trading volumes.

972
01:05:38,103 --> 01:05:40,127
Azilowon.
(Korean cryptocurrency/token: AWN)

973
01:05:41,813 --> 01:05:44,289
[A Few Days Ago]
Park Jaemin, how are you?

974
01:05:44,290 --> 01:05:48,491
- You're looking after Joohee, right?
- Of course, sir.

975
01:05:48,492 --> 01:05:51,784
This is a pleasant surprise,
how can I help you?

976
01:05:51,785 --> 01:05:53,796
You know, this and that.

977
01:05:53,797 --> 01:05:55,384
Thought I'd ask how you're doing.

978
01:05:55,385 --> 01:05:58,532
The last time you called, you asked
me how I was doing for 20 minutes.

979
01:05:58,533 --> 01:06:00,216
And we had 20 minutes of small talk.

980
01:06:00,217 --> 01:06:03,127
Let's skip to the bottom line, for both us?

981
01:06:03,128 --> 01:06:09,699
We can definitely skip that part where we
engage in small talk to build a rapport.

982
01:06:09,700 --> 01:06:11,821
You're an honest man.

983
01:06:11,822 --> 01:06:13,681
You said you were

984
01:06:13,682 --> 01:06:15,900
- a computer science major?
- Yes.

985
01:06:15,901 --> 01:06:19,313
It's a little weird calling
you out of the blue like this,

986
01:06:19,314 --> 01:06:22,812
but you really know your stuff
when it comes to things like this.

987
01:06:22,813 --> 01:06:24,225
Do you happen to know

988
01:06:24,226 --> 01:06:28,390
- anything about blockchain?
- Ah, you want to talk about crypto.

989
01:06:28,391 --> 01:06:32,448
- Wow, exactly!
- I do know a thing or two about that.

990
01:06:32,449 --> 01:06:35,798
What about cryptocurrencies are you...

991
01:06:36,904 --> 01:06:39,400
Azilowon?

992
01:06:40,416 --> 01:06:43,286
What? How much?

993
01:06:44,391 --> 01:06:45,422
3,000?

994
01:06:45,423 --> 01:06:47,006
Damn it, Mr. Park!

995
01:06:47,007 --> 01:06:48,831
Just, why?

996
01:06:52,993 --> 01:06:54,109
Don't you get it?

997
01:06:54,110 --> 01:06:56,007
We are totally known now.

998
01:06:56,008 --> 01:07:00,798
We're finally on the radar of
those attention-seeking hackers.

999
01:07:01,539 --> 01:07:05,500
- We're not saying you're wrong.
- Then why stop?

1000
01:07:06,484 --> 01:07:08,493
After all this way.

1001
01:07:08,494 --> 01:07:11,117
- What did you recruit me for?
- We're a team.

1002
01:07:11,118 --> 01:07:13,618
A group. You're the only one mad about it.

1003
01:07:13,619 --> 01:07:16,509
We're not talking about
closing down Better World.

1004
01:07:16,510 --> 01:07:19,001
There isn't a shadow of
a doubt about your skills

1005
01:07:19,002 --> 01:07:20,399
For our last job,

1006
01:07:20,400 --> 01:07:23,002
you definitely pulled
more than half the weight.

1007
01:07:23,003 --> 01:07:27,355
But, Jaemin, why do we hack?

1008
01:07:27,356 --> 01:07:30,720
Look at all of our achievements,
aren't they amazing?

1009
01:07:30,721 --> 01:07:33,775
With our inconceivably
superior hacking skills,

1010
01:07:33,776 --> 01:07:37,268
we'll solve any cybersecurity problems,
including those the government can't.

1011
01:07:37,269 --> 01:07:39,835
We are Better World!

1012
01:07:39,836 --> 01:07:42,297
Do you want to go and
tell everyone in town?

1013
01:07:42,298 --> 01:07:45,423
- Is that why we exist?
- We have to be more famous and be known!

1014
01:07:45,424 --> 01:07:47,964
That's how we get them to the surface.

1015
01:07:47,965 --> 01:07:50,287
If we want to strike,

1016
01:07:50,288 --> 01:07:54,804
- we have to be more famous than them.
- Is one of those people,

1017
01:07:54,805 --> 01:07:56,645
YOUKNOWWHAT?

1018
01:07:57,385 --> 01:07:59,312
Let's all calm down, okay?

1019
01:07:59,313 --> 01:08:02,351
Jaemin, we promised to
help you avenge your dad.

1020
01:08:02,352 --> 01:08:06,493
So, let's take a short break and recharge.

1021
01:08:06,494 --> 01:08:09,033
This kind of exposure is not
ideal for us in the long run.

1022
01:08:09,034 --> 01:08:10,984
All right, fine.

1023
01:08:11,704 --> 01:08:15,428
Let's assume we managed to draw
out YOUKNOWWHAT to the surface.

1024
01:08:15,429 --> 01:08:17,150
They laid low for one year
after your dad's company.

1025
01:08:17,151 --> 01:08:19,245
It was a year and a half
after Taegun Finance.

1026
01:08:19,246 --> 01:08:22,829
That asshole ran circles around all those
security experts, evading their efforts.

1027
01:08:22,830 --> 01:08:26,985
Yeah, he's really going to fall
right into our unprepared hands.

1028
01:08:26,986 --> 01:08:29,100
No, no.

1029
01:08:29,101 --> 01:08:30,992
Let's say he did.

1030
01:08:30,993 --> 01:08:33,330
We got lucky and got into his backdoor,

1031
01:08:33,331 --> 01:08:37,236
and tore up all of his
timestamps and checksum values.

1032
01:08:37,237 --> 01:08:41,211
There is no way the three of us
are getting out of there alive but

1033
01:08:41,212 --> 01:08:42,383
let's say we did!

1034
01:08:42,384 --> 01:08:45,407
Anyway, despite all these hurdles,

1035
01:08:45,408 --> 01:08:47,304
your revenge plan succeeds.

1036
01:08:47,305 --> 01:08:51,055
You think we are going to
"live happily ever after?"

1037
01:08:51,056 --> 01:08:53,594
Our real names will be
all over the internet.

1038
01:08:53,595 --> 01:08:57,821
And the Cyber Bureau isn't going to
sit idly like they are doing now.

1039
01:09:01,767 --> 01:09:04,033
I chased him for three years

1040
01:09:04,034 --> 01:09:07,228
but I couldn't find anything about him.

1041
01:09:08,291 --> 01:09:13,319
That fucker has finally started moving
after being dormant for three years.

1042
01:09:13,320 --> 01:09:15,728
I was crying and begging for
them to catch that fucker

1043
01:09:15,729 --> 01:09:19,666
and they just stood there with
their hands in their pockets.

1044
01:09:19,667 --> 01:09:23,372
They are worse than that fucker and I
have to be scared of what they'll do?

1045
01:09:28,877 --> 01:09:31,682
We're saying we need a better plan.

1046
01:09:37,321 --> 01:09:39,299
Disrespectful punk.

1047
01:09:44,276 --> 01:09:45,675
It's not a gym!

1048
01:09:45,676 --> 01:09:48,615
Grow your muscles somewhere else!

1049
01:09:48,616 --> 01:09:50,291
Dumbass.

1050
01:10:14,538 --> 01:10:17,223
- Are you with Jaemin?
- What? No.

1051
01:10:17,224 --> 01:10:20,102
- What's up?
- Call me if you two get in touch.

1052
01:10:20,103 --> 01:10:21,860
Why? Is there a problem?

1053
01:10:21,861 --> 01:10:24,695
- It's not my problem if he goes crazy
- Would you shut up?

1054
01:10:24,696 --> 01:10:27,034
Hyesoo? Hyesoo?

1055
01:10:42,204 --> 01:10:43,804
Are you okay?

1056
01:10:44,349 --> 01:10:47,389
Jaemin is not answering...

1057
01:10:47,390 --> 01:10:50,496
What? Why him all of a sudden?

1058
01:10:50,497 --> 01:10:53,701
He's not a kid and he'll call you
once he knows you are looking for him.

1059
01:10:53,702 --> 01:10:55,640
Don't worry too much.

1060
01:10:55,641 --> 01:10:57,803
I guess you are right...

1061
01:10:59,144 --> 01:11:02,884
You are right. He's not a kid.

1062
01:11:04,538 --> 01:11:07,938
I'm a little disappointed that you
mentioned Jaemin as soon as met.

1063
01:11:07,939 --> 01:11:12,706
No, I'm really sorry.
I just had a strange call.

1064
01:11:12,707 --> 01:11:15,594
I knew this would happen.
He's going to explode.

1065
01:11:15,595 --> 01:11:17,124
Explode?

1066
01:11:17,125 --> 01:11:21,277
- Is Jaemin angry?
- No, I must sound crazy.

1067
01:11:21,278 --> 01:11:24,504
- What do you want to drink?
- No, it's on me. I'm Sorry.

1068
01:11:31,188 --> 01:11:34,187
We've known each other for a long time.

1069
01:11:34,188 --> 01:11:36,368
That's true. A long time.

1070
01:11:36,369 --> 01:11:39,535
You, me, and Jaemin...

1071
01:11:39,536 --> 01:11:41,896
Ever since 9th grade.

1072
01:11:41,897 --> 01:11:44,339
So it's been four years already.

1073
01:11:44,340 --> 01:11:47,011
- Time flies.
- Yes.

1074
01:11:47,012 --> 01:11:49,651
It's been already 4 years.
Time really flies.

1075
01:11:49,652 --> 01:11:52,018
We were all in the same class in 9th grade.

1076
01:11:52,019 --> 01:11:53,946
We went our separate ways after that.

1077
01:11:53,947 --> 01:11:57,335
Yeah, right. We were in the same class.

1078
01:11:57,336 --> 01:12:00,732
- You and Jaemin were really close.
- Yes, right.

1079
01:12:00,733 --> 01:12:02,832
We were best friends...

1080
01:12:02,833 --> 01:12:05,279
No! Me and him?

1081
01:12:05,280 --> 01:12:08,574
No way, we weren't that close.

1082
01:12:08,575 --> 01:12:12,799
We weren't that close, we even
lived far apart. Barely friends.

1083
01:12:14,717 --> 01:12:16,458
Really?
[Found Jaemin! He's in Songdo.]

1084
01:12:16,459 --> 01:12:19,638
I thought you two were best friends.

1085
01:12:19,639 --> 01:12:21,909
I'm really sorry, Chanho.
Let's do this another time.

1086
01:12:21,910 --> 01:12:23,330
Jaemin is going to be in trouble.

1087
01:12:23,331 --> 01:12:25,906
What's going on? Jaemin is
going to explode and all that?

1088
01:12:25,907 --> 01:12:30,238
I'm really sorry. I'm so worried.
I'm sorry.

1089
01:12:36,757 --> 01:12:38,584
Where is a cab?

1090
01:12:38,597 --> 01:12:40,540
I need to hurry...

1091
01:12:40,541 --> 01:12:43,176
♪ The door is opening! ♪

1092
01:12:43,177 --> 01:12:45,101
♪ Love at first sight ♪

1093
01:12:45,102 --> 01:12:47,746
- Are you crazy?
- I didn't recognize you.

1094
01:12:47,747 --> 01:12:50,875
What's with the suit?
Were you at a funeral?

1095
01:12:52,873 --> 01:12:55,803
He went to his ex-girlfriend's wedding.

1096
01:13:03,090 --> 01:13:05,726
- We ruined your date, huh?
- Yes.

1097
01:13:05,727 --> 01:13:08,485
Threw away a once in a
lifetime opportunity.

1098
01:13:08,486 --> 01:13:10,600
Total fail.

1099
01:13:10,601 --> 01:13:13,971
I guess I'm destined to
have crushes forever.

1100
01:13:13,972 --> 01:13:16,963
You're slower than I thought.

1101
01:13:16,964 --> 01:13:18,545
What?

1102
01:13:28,039 --> 01:13:30,218
Play the C51 camera.

1103
01:13:30,219 --> 01:13:32,963
He passed through the
Geumcheon toll gate at 3:45.

1104
01:13:32,964 --> 01:13:35,928
Seeing as he's headed to Dangjin...

1105
01:13:35,929 --> 01:13:37,858
It's Songdo.

1106
01:13:37,859 --> 01:13:40,119
That's too easy.

1107
01:13:41,909 --> 01:13:46,221
So, I'm just curious.

1108
01:13:46,222 --> 01:13:49,938
How do you change your voice?

1109
01:13:52,539 --> 01:13:56,072
I don't see a mic around your mouth.

1110
01:13:57,798 --> 01:14:00,597
I'm just asking because it looks cool.

1111
01:14:01,834 --> 01:14:03,981
Too personal, maybe?

1112
01:14:03,982 --> 01:14:07,096
Let's respect each other's privacy, right?

1113
01:14:07,097 --> 01:14:08,924
All right then.

1114
01:14:08,925 --> 01:14:12,339
Let's keep it professional.

1115
01:14:18,256 --> 01:14:22,528
[Withdrawal completed: 30,000 AWN]

1116
01:14:23,849 --> 01:14:25,525
[Withdrawal completed: 250,000 AWN]

1117
01:14:26,386 --> 01:14:28,653
[Withdrawal completed: 280,000 AWN]

1118
01:14:29,614 --> 01:14:31,440
[Withdrawal completed: 120,000 AWN]

1119
01:14:32,214 --> 01:14:34,481
[Withdrawal completed: 2,000,000 AWN]

1120
01:14:49,030 --> 01:14:51,670
[Loading...]

1121
01:15:00,840 --> 01:15:02,756
While an internal investigation team is

1122
01:15:02,757 --> 01:15:06,734
identifying the scope of the
attack and retracing the source.

1123
01:15:06,735 --> 01:15:10,308
Meanwhile, dozens of large electronic
displays in Seoul and the capital area

1124
01:15:10,309 --> 01:15:15,753
are simultaneously playing a video
file allegedly planted by hackers.

1125
01:15:15,754 --> 01:15:17,230
According to an official,

1126
01:15:17,231 --> 01:15:20,475
the alleged hackers wanted
to demonstrate their skills

1127
01:15:20,476 --> 01:15:24,949
by performing a defacement attack.

1128
01:15:24,950 --> 01:15:28,219
Further away in Yongsan...

1129
01:15:28,220 --> 01:15:30,130
[LOADING...]

1130
01:15:30,159 --> 01:15:33,800
Hello, everyone! We are Crackers!
Not the eating kind!

1131
01:15:33,801 --> 01:15:37,201
Do you remember the crypto craze
that blew up in Korea recently?

1132
01:15:37,202 --> 01:15:40,421
New Year's cash, part-time work, tuition!
Everything in crypto!

1133
01:15:40,422 --> 01:15:42,609
Did you go all-in with
your precious savings?

1134
01:15:42,610 --> 01:15:45,578
The money kept piling on!

1135
01:15:45,579 --> 01:15:48,252
While you went through hell!

1136
01:15:48,253 --> 01:15:51,739
Keep working like dogs. We'll
keep spending it like water.

1137
01:15:51,740 --> 01:15:53,879
[You Know What?]

1138
01:15:53,880 --> 01:15:55,749
[What can you do?]

1139
01:15:55,750 --> 01:15:59,530
[Rainbow Glide Moonshine]

1140
01:16:00,332 --> 01:16:02,651
[17 Hours Ago]
First, go and see where the CCTVs are.

1141
01:16:02,652 --> 01:16:04,408
I'll ask Senior Oh about hash functions.

1142
01:16:04,409 --> 01:16:07,533
Senior Oh? Is he getting involved?

1143
01:16:07,534 --> 01:16:10,220
Senior Oh was the one
who told us he was here.

1144
01:16:11,144 --> 01:16:13,743
Why does he care about him so much?

1145
01:16:13,744 --> 01:16:16,832
He's one of the greatest hackers,

1146
01:16:16,833 --> 01:16:20,419
He can go head-to-toe
with the Honker Union,

1147
01:16:21,632 --> 01:16:24,668
Damn, your slaps sting. It hurts!

1148
01:16:24,669 --> 01:16:26,851
You made me so worried.

1149
01:16:26,852 --> 01:16:29,711
I had a good reason, okay?
You don't know anything!

1150
01:16:29,712 --> 01:16:32,613
How dare you raise your voice at me!

1151
01:16:35,454 --> 01:16:37,992
Did you see the post on the site?

1152
01:16:37,993 --> 01:16:41,198
YOUKNOWWHAT reveals his next
target to other hackers in advance.

1153
01:16:41,199 --> 01:16:42,895
He's not short on confidence.

1154
01:16:42,896 --> 01:16:44,303
Those bitches.

1155
01:16:44,304 --> 01:16:48,748
We can't say no after such a
considerate declaration of war.

1156
01:16:48,749 --> 01:16:51,692
I'm going to hack the
exchange before YOUKNOWWHAT.

1157
01:16:51,693 --> 01:16:54,451
The security guards start
their patrol at 11:00 p.m.

1158
01:16:54,452 --> 01:16:56,452
I'll enter the server
room after 40 minutes.

1159
01:16:56,453 --> 01:16:58,047
The parent company is called Smart Cop,

1160
01:16:58,048 --> 01:17:01,014
they're an IT security firm so
it's hard to hack them remotely.

1161
01:17:01,015 --> 01:17:06,643
We have to directly go to the server room,
and plant malware in the main server.

1162
01:17:07,897 --> 01:17:10,670
You are going inside the building?

1163
01:17:40,689 --> 01:17:43,930
Well, I have the day off tomorrow.

1164
01:17:45,371 --> 01:17:47,371
Come on now.

1165
01:17:47,986 --> 01:17:49,231
I'm tired, too!

1166
01:17:49,232 --> 01:17:52,965
I want to do nothing
but rest on my day off.

1167
01:17:54,542 --> 01:17:56,681
It's nothing.

1168
01:17:56,682 --> 01:17:58,872
Wait, I'll call you back.

1169
01:18:06,899 --> 01:18:08,738
What is this?

1170
01:18:08,739 --> 01:18:10,785
These damn kids.

1171
01:18:10,786 --> 01:18:13,134
Leaving things behind.

1172
01:18:26,893 --> 01:18:29,425
Listen here, young man.

1173
01:18:29,426 --> 01:18:34,329
I wonder why you were
hiding out in the dark

1174
01:18:34,330 --> 01:18:37,669
- doing something you shouldn't be?
- Do something.

1175
01:18:37,670 --> 01:18:40,010
My goodness, the light went out...

1176
01:18:44,800 --> 01:18:45,819
[10]

1177
01:18:45,820 --> 01:18:47,549
[4F Down - 5F Up] - [7F] - [2/1]

1178
01:18:47,550 --> 01:18:50,920
[Staircase Entrance]

1179
01:18:57,200 --> 01:18:59,459
Calling all guards.

1180
01:18:59,460 --> 01:19:03,159
We have a man wearing a mask
with a backpack and a black hat.

1181
01:19:03,160 --> 01:19:06,034
He's making his way to the parking lot.

1182
01:19:06,035 --> 01:19:07,975
Overtime sucks, right?

1183
01:19:07,976 --> 01:19:10,441
Ever heard of server
management with flexible hours?

1184
01:19:10,442 --> 01:19:13,941
A dream job that guarantees
a work-life balance.

1185
01:19:13,942 --> 01:19:15,876
Probably only at Google.

1186
01:19:15,877 --> 01:19:18,897
Just wait! This is a misunderstanding.

1187
01:19:18,898 --> 01:19:20,501
Backpack. Black clothes.

1188
01:19:20,502 --> 01:19:22,435
Even I think I look like a corporate spy.

1189
01:19:22,436 --> 01:19:25,631
We have a man wearing a mask
with a backpack and a black hat.

1190
01:19:25,632 --> 01:19:29,418
And he's making a run towards the
back entrance of the parking lot.

1191
01:19:29,419 --> 01:19:32,105
Wait! This is a misunderstanding.

1192
01:19:32,893 --> 01:19:35,832
Sounds like Jaemin is having
his spinal cords readjusted.

1193
01:19:35,833 --> 01:19:39,880
What? Oh no. I'm going in.

1194
01:19:42,196 --> 01:19:45,733
I can't move...

1195
01:19:50,066 --> 01:19:52,025
You bitch...

1196
01:19:56,851 --> 01:19:58,770
What should we do?

1197
01:19:59,577 --> 01:20:03,663
It'll be fine. Manguk
is a good punching bag.

1198
01:20:03,664 --> 01:20:05,624
- He can take all the hits.
- No,

1199
01:20:05,625 --> 01:20:07,785
I'm not talking about Jaemin.

1200
01:20:08,313 --> 01:20:09,713
What?

1201
01:20:19,620 --> 01:20:21,119
Come on.

1202
01:20:21,120 --> 01:20:23,364
Do you know what his
nickname was in high school?

1203
01:20:23,365 --> 01:20:24,910
The wiper.

1204
01:20:24,911 --> 01:20:26,883
The wiper?

1205
01:20:26,884 --> 01:20:29,965
- He wiped his nose a lot?
- It's because he can wipe out anyone.

1206
01:20:29,966 --> 01:20:33,968
Oh yeah. He said he was on varsity.

1207
01:20:33,969 --> 01:20:36,040
Bring it.

1208
01:20:36,041 --> 01:20:37,961
Bring it!

1209
01:20:44,901 --> 01:20:47,007
That felt good.

1210
01:20:49,876 --> 01:20:52,357
You know those kids

1211
01:20:52,358 --> 01:20:55,823
that are super athletic and super smart.

1212
01:20:55,824 --> 01:20:58,120
That's right. Just the
type you can't stand.

1213
01:20:58,121 --> 01:21:01,814
All he did was fight and try MMA
moves during middle and high school.

1214
01:21:01,815 --> 01:21:05,858
Until he wised up and started studying
really hard, then boom! Great SAT scores.

1215
01:21:05,859 --> 01:21:07,389
Of course, he did.

1216
01:21:07,390 --> 01:21:10,382
He's the typical comeback kid?

1217
01:21:10,383 --> 01:21:13,108
It's such a cliche.
[B4 > Entrance]

1218
01:21:13,109 --> 01:21:15,530
[Career counseling report]

1219
01:21:19,674 --> 01:21:21,645
Listen.

1220
01:21:21,646 --> 01:21:24,753
It's great that you're
finally studying hard,

1221
01:21:24,754 --> 01:21:27,439
but why suddenly choose computer science?

1222
01:21:27,440 --> 01:21:31,202
You were on the podium at the nationals.

1223
01:21:33,465 --> 01:21:35,378
Athletics...

1224
01:21:36,401 --> 01:21:39,201
won't help me catch those
assholes that got my dad.

1225
01:21:49,280 --> 01:21:51,389
[ETH Wallet: 28,000,000,000;
AWN: 420,000,000,000]

1226
01:21:51,390 --> 01:21:53,246
Hey!

1227
01:21:53,247 --> 01:21:54,775
Stay focused!

1228
01:21:54,776 --> 01:21:57,135
- Why do you look worse than he does?
- He's an animal.

1229
01:21:57,136 --> 01:21:59,185
Did they get you in the head?

1230
01:21:59,186 --> 01:22:01,167
Hey, snap out of it!

1231
01:22:01,168 --> 01:22:03,231
And why are you drooling?

1232
01:22:03,232 --> 01:22:04,831
Did you kill them?

1233
01:22:04,832 --> 01:22:07,791
- Did you bury them?
- What is this, a crime movie?

1234
01:22:07,792 --> 01:22:10,332
You should stop watching Netflix.

1235
01:22:12,582 --> 01:22:15,394
So, what's next?

1236
01:22:15,395 --> 01:22:19,867
We have to let YOUKNOWWHAT and other
people know we attacked the exchange.

1237
01:22:19,868 --> 01:22:22,824
As you are our leader, could
you write up our statement?

1238
01:22:22,825 --> 01:22:24,208
Wait.

1239
01:22:24,209 --> 01:22:26,083
Wasn't I the leader?

1240
01:22:37,829 --> 01:22:40,449
Were you flower watching
in the middle of summer?

1241
01:22:41,341 --> 01:22:44,025
- Looks like you were on a date.
- Who cares.

1242
01:22:44,026 --> 01:22:46,855
I'm in a good mood so don't ruin it.

1243
01:22:46,856 --> 01:22:51,177
I haven't been to the beach in a
long time so I was just taking it in.

1244
01:22:52,610 --> 01:22:54,962
The alcohol is making me feel cold.

1245
01:22:54,963 --> 01:22:56,662
I should go inside.

1246
01:23:03,071 --> 01:23:04,883
What's this?

1247
01:23:04,884 --> 01:23:07,237
I've never seen you
show any manners at all.

1248
01:23:07,238 --> 01:23:09,951
Not at all, I'm full of manners.

1249
01:23:09,952 --> 01:23:12,230
I have so much that it's spilling out.

1250
01:23:12,231 --> 01:23:13,841
Whatever.

1251
01:23:15,850 --> 01:23:17,049
Wait.

1252
01:23:17,050 --> 01:23:21,455
Why don't we stay a little longer?

1253
01:23:23,860 --> 01:23:25,404
Why?

1254
01:23:25,405 --> 01:23:28,708
There's a historical moment
happening inside right now.

1255
01:23:28,709 --> 01:23:30,796
You mean, those two?

1256
01:23:30,797 --> 01:23:32,789
That's why you're outside?

1257
01:23:33,746 --> 01:23:37,558
Of course, I can take a hint.

1258
01:23:37,559 --> 01:23:39,354
Oh my god!

1259
01:24:07,200 --> 01:24:08,970
It's cold.

1260
01:24:17,381 --> 01:24:19,795
It's because I'm cold.

1261
01:24:20,332 --> 01:24:22,820
It's my jacket anyway.

1262
01:24:23,753 --> 01:24:25,401
Don't misunderstand.

1263
01:24:25,402 --> 01:24:27,823
I'll have my hands clenched.

1264
01:24:31,449 --> 01:24:33,008
Okay.

1265
01:24:35,622 --> 01:24:36,655
Hey.

1266
01:24:36,656 --> 01:24:37,745
What?

1267
01:24:37,746 --> 01:24:39,718
It's the middle of summer.

1268
01:24:39,719 --> 01:24:44,535
We're in "Major Heat," it's the hottest
time of the year in the solar term.

1269
01:24:44,536 --> 01:24:48,611
Okay, that was a good one.

1270
01:24:55,771 --> 01:24:58,159
The number you have dialed
is currently busy right now.

1271
01:24:58,160 --> 01:25:01,253
Please call again another time.

1272
01:25:03,869 --> 01:25:07,068
The number you have dialed...

1273
01:25:10,450 --> 01:25:12,170
The number you have...

1274
01:25:12,171 --> 01:25:13,965
He's not answering. What should we do?

1275
01:25:13,966 --> 01:25:17,206
We only have 20 minutes left
before the announcement.

1276
01:25:21,473 --> 01:25:22,712
What is it?

1277
01:25:22,713 --> 01:25:24,513
What's going on?

1278
01:25:27,630 --> 01:25:31,370
[Back To Present]

1279
01:25:36,986 --> 01:25:39,566
Do you really want to know who I am?

1280
01:25:40,816 --> 01:25:43,200
Then bring the USB.

1281
01:25:44,850 --> 01:25:47,790
I'll give you the answer
you're looking for.

1282
01:26:14,355 --> 01:26:17,775
[Angry Joo]

1283
01:26:42,488 --> 01:26:44,586
You are one impressive kid.

1284
01:26:44,587 --> 01:26:47,279
Coming alone like this.

1285
01:26:47,280 --> 01:26:49,712
I know that's your character, but

1286
01:26:49,713 --> 01:26:52,612
don't you think you're too confident?

1287
01:26:52,613 --> 01:26:54,572
No, wait.

1288
01:26:54,573 --> 01:26:58,704
This isn't confidence.

1289
01:27:12,244 --> 01:27:13,984
Is it you?

1290
01:27:14,706 --> 01:27:16,312
You're YOUKNOWWHAT?

1291
01:27:47,837 --> 01:27:50,836
So, 28 billion AWN is inside this thing?

1292
01:27:50,837 --> 01:27:53,673
Everything is so convenient these days.

1293
01:28:01,577 --> 01:28:03,576
Hey, Jaemin.

1294
01:28:03,577 --> 01:28:05,837
Let's see those famous moves of yours.

1295
01:28:07,447 --> 01:28:09,190
Give it a try.

1296
01:28:31,324 --> 01:28:33,422
The best fighter in high school.

1297
01:28:34,614 --> 01:28:36,461
You can do better.

1298
01:28:38,490 --> 01:28:40,237
Jaemin.

1299
01:28:41,324 --> 01:28:43,024
Jaemin!

1300
01:28:44,113 --> 01:28:45,974
Jaemin!

1301
01:28:46,763 --> 01:28:48,929
What should I do with you.

1302
01:28:51,627 --> 01:28:53,001
All right.

1303
01:28:53,002 --> 01:28:55,121
I admit you're good.

1304
01:28:55,122 --> 01:28:56,994
Compliment accepted.

1305
01:28:56,995 --> 01:28:59,215
I know I'm good.

1306
01:29:03,659 --> 01:29:05,504
Hey, Jaemin.

1307
01:29:05,505 --> 01:29:07,381
Look at you.

1308
01:29:07,382 --> 01:29:09,721
Still trying to be so cool.

1309
01:29:09,722 --> 01:29:12,232
Stop trying so hard!
You're making it worse.

1310
01:29:12,233 --> 01:29:15,861
I predicted you'd be reckless
because it was for Joohee.

1311
01:29:15,862 --> 01:29:18,803
But don't you think this
was too much of a risk?

1312
01:29:19,298 --> 01:29:22,478
Is it because you like Joohee

1313
01:29:22,479 --> 01:29:25,046
or is it because of your dad?

1314
01:29:33,184 --> 01:29:35,170
Hey, Chanho.

1315
01:29:35,763 --> 01:29:38,122
It was really you?

1316
01:29:38,123 --> 01:29:40,035
You killed my dad?

1317
01:29:41,891 --> 01:29:43,555
Yeah.

1318
01:29:45,533 --> 01:29:46,972
Right.

1319
01:29:46,973 --> 01:29:50,053
I also told Joohee's dad about Azilowon.

1320
01:29:50,054 --> 01:29:51,746
I knew that already.

1321
01:29:51,747 --> 01:29:54,059
You bastard.

1322
01:29:54,060 --> 01:29:58,096
Stop acting like you know everything.
It's disgusting.

1323
01:29:58,097 --> 01:29:59,685
Did you also imagine this?

1324
01:29:59,686 --> 01:30:03,585
Being betrayed by a
friend from high school?

1325
01:30:06,821 --> 01:30:08,874
Hey, Chanho.

1326
01:30:12,080 --> 01:30:13,892
I didn't realize...

1327
01:30:15,155 --> 01:30:17,656
you wanted to be my friend that badly.

1328
01:30:17,657 --> 01:30:19,111
You should have just told me.

1329
01:30:19,112 --> 01:30:21,279
You asshole!

1330
01:30:23,614 --> 01:30:25,879
You think you are all that?

1331
01:30:25,880 --> 01:30:27,914
You think you're so fucking great?

1332
01:30:27,915 --> 01:30:30,420
You confused meatheaded jock.

1333
01:30:30,421 --> 01:30:32,755
You're parading around town

1334
01:30:33,337 --> 01:30:35,377
thinking that you are a real hacker?

1335
01:30:50,535 --> 01:30:53,435
[1st: Lee Chanho, 2nd: Park Jaemin]

1336
01:31:00,159 --> 01:31:01,996
Being second place is a skill, too.

1337
01:31:01,997 --> 01:31:04,908
You play futsal with us until 11:00 p.m.
and you still get good scores.

1338
01:31:04,909 --> 01:31:06,980
- You should buy us snacks to celebrate!
- You're like a cheat code.

1339
01:31:06,981 --> 01:31:08,698
Let's go.

1340
01:31:23,219 --> 01:31:25,001
He has a sad face for being
the smartest kid at school.

1341
01:31:25,002 --> 01:31:26,880
Jaemin is the best fighter here,

1342
01:31:26,881 --> 01:31:30,873
imagine if he got better test
scores, Chanho would kill himself.

1343
01:31:30,874 --> 01:31:33,637
I think Jaemin is going easy on Chanho.

1344
01:31:33,638 --> 01:31:37,497
Chanho is studying day and
night trying to stay at the top.

1345
01:31:37,498 --> 01:31:40,973
Jaemin eats, sleeps, and does whatever
he wants, and he's still second place.

1346
01:31:40,974 --> 01:31:43,726
There's not a big difference
between their average scores either.

1347
01:31:43,727 --> 01:31:44,908
Poor Chanho.

1348
01:31:44,909 --> 01:31:48,298
I should have just done nothing.

1349
01:31:48,299 --> 01:31:51,032
Then it would have been less painful.

1350
01:31:51,889 --> 01:31:54,057
Everything was easy for you.

1351
01:31:54,058 --> 01:31:55,044
Beg.

1352
01:31:55,045 --> 01:31:57,140
It wasn't for me.

1353
01:31:57,141 --> 01:31:58,802
Beg for your life.

1354
01:31:58,803 --> 01:32:01,074
All you have to do is beg, just once.

1355
01:32:01,908 --> 01:32:04,008
If you beg me,

1356
01:32:04,009 --> 01:32:07,430
I might let you go.

1357
01:32:11,317 --> 01:32:13,217
You disgust me.

1358
01:32:13,713 --> 01:32:15,840
You lost.

1359
01:32:19,346 --> 01:32:21,739
You lost, asshole!

1360
01:32:33,376 --> 01:32:34,893
Think again.

1361
01:32:34,894 --> 01:32:36,525
Think what again?

1362
01:32:38,338 --> 01:32:40,414
You really think I lost?

1363
01:32:40,415 --> 01:32:42,272
You're delusional.

1364
01:32:53,749 --> 01:32:56,196
Chanho, you bastard!

1365
01:32:57,992 --> 01:33:01,331
Do you think I ransacked
the administrator's account?

1366
01:33:01,332 --> 01:33:04,417
Do you really think I
spear-phished Azilowon?

1367
01:33:04,418 --> 01:33:05,545
Stop your bullshit.

1368
01:33:05,546 --> 01:33:08,042
I did hack the administrator's page.

1369
01:33:08,043 --> 01:33:12,790
I sent a bunch of emails
with their member's data.

1370
01:33:17,349 --> 01:33:20,730
Hot wallets, it lets you
withdraw tokens directly online.

1371
01:33:21,255 --> 01:33:25,480
Well, I sent one each to all of
Azilowon's 1.2 million members.

1372
01:33:25,481 --> 01:33:29,186
I just planted a Trojan
horse in your mobile.

1373
01:33:32,631 --> 01:33:35,877
- You lose.
- You son of a bitch!

1374
01:34:09,269 --> 01:34:11,095
YOUKNOWWHAT called me.

1375
01:34:11,096 --> 01:34:14,213
He said he'll give me the answer I'm
looking for if I bring this to him.

1376
01:34:14,214 --> 01:34:15,570
Really?

1377
01:34:15,571 --> 01:34:17,200
- Then take it.
- What?

1378
01:34:17,201 --> 01:34:20,320
He's got your answer.

1379
01:34:20,321 --> 01:34:23,189
Plus, I'm really curious about who he is.

1380
01:34:26,084 --> 01:34:27,883
- What's this?
- A fake USB.

1381
01:34:27,884 --> 01:34:29,782
It has a tracking device.

1382
01:34:29,783 --> 01:34:33,598
But it needs electricity to work.

1383
01:34:33,599 --> 01:34:35,449
So it needs to be plugged in like this,

1384
01:34:35,450 --> 01:34:38,165
- for us to identify the location.
- Can this

1385
01:34:38,166 --> 01:34:40,265
record too?

1386
01:34:40,266 --> 01:34:41,346
Of course.

1387
01:34:41,347 --> 01:34:43,798
Of course, it records
everything in real-time

1388
01:34:43,799 --> 01:34:47,423
and will be broadcast across the
nation, just like in the movies.

1389
01:34:47,424 --> 01:34:48,923
Psych.

1390
01:34:48,924 --> 01:34:52,542
If you want to mount a
camera, we would need MI6...

1391
01:34:52,543 --> 01:34:55,089
I have another plan.

1392
01:35:08,512 --> 01:35:11,306
Do you know what YOUKNOWWHAT is?

1393
01:35:12,985 --> 01:35:14,485
What is it?

1394
01:35:15,984 --> 01:35:18,083
It's...

1395
01:35:18,084 --> 01:35:19,666
no one.

1396
01:35:32,732 --> 01:35:35,597
With Chanho's profound parting words,

1397
01:35:35,598 --> 01:35:40,888
an unusual summer for a
twenty-year-old came and went.

1398
01:35:40,889 --> 01:35:43,480
The Seoul Cyber Bureau was at
Songdo International Exchange...

1399
01:35:43,481 --> 01:35:47,592
The hack of the century, which could
have erased millions of cryptocurrencies,

1400
01:35:47,593 --> 01:35:50,416
did attract the public's
attentions for a while

1401
01:35:50,417 --> 01:35:54,853
but the news died down and was remembered
as the act of an attention-craving hacker.

1402
01:35:54,854 --> 01:35:57,693
YOUKNOWWHAT, the man I
hunted for three years,

1403
01:35:57,694 --> 01:36:01,438
was forgotten by the
public in just three days.

1404
01:36:04,120 --> 01:36:08,149
[NOTICE: As of August 10, 2020, "Better World" club
will be converted into a "Fine Dust" research room.]

1405
01:36:08,150 --> 01:36:10,579
"Better World"?

1406
01:36:11,071 --> 01:36:13,282
Is it a name of a club?

1407
01:36:13,283 --> 01:36:14,552
Never heard of it.

1408
01:36:14,553 --> 01:36:17,031
It's a weird name. "Better World," huh?

1409
01:36:17,032 --> 01:36:19,631
Maybe it's a volunteering group?

1410
01:36:27,834 --> 01:36:30,679
So, if we're out,

1411
01:36:30,680 --> 01:36:32,473
who's replacing us?

1412
01:36:32,474 --> 01:36:35,007
What's so great about them?

1413
01:36:35,008 --> 01:36:36,625
They're sponsored by Samsung,

1414
01:36:36,626 --> 01:36:39,634
collaborating with MIT students on
atmospheric engineering research.

1415
01:36:39,635 --> 01:36:42,550
Kids that can save the
world from fine dust?

1416
01:36:42,551 --> 01:36:45,431
I heard KBS is going to interview them too.

1417
01:36:45,432 --> 01:36:47,555
Massachusetts...

1418
01:36:48,592 --> 01:36:50,904
Then, what about us?

1419
01:36:50,905 --> 01:36:54,548
- Where can we do our club activities?
- You guys...

1420
01:36:54,549 --> 01:36:56,325
should meet in the virtual world.

1421
01:36:56,326 --> 01:36:59,947
Your club failed to meet the
member's requirements anyways.

1422
01:36:59,948 --> 01:37:03,119
You're making me look like a
bad landlord expelling tenants.

1423
01:37:03,120 --> 01:37:04,780
I have no power.

1424
01:37:04,781 --> 01:37:06,687
I have no power to help you.

1425
01:37:06,688 --> 01:37:09,436
Do you want me to make an
appointment with the president?

1426
01:37:11,725 --> 01:37:13,473
My honorable TA,

1427
01:37:13,474 --> 01:37:15,650
you can't do this to us!

1428
01:37:15,651 --> 01:37:19,375
It's not like I'm a pearl lacquerware
master trying to pass down the torch

1429
01:37:19,376 --> 01:37:21,332
or noodle pulling master from China.

1430
01:37:21,333 --> 01:37:24,632
I have no plans to accept any disciples.

1431
01:37:24,633 --> 01:37:28,317
I just want to be the owner of an
internet cafe for the rest of my life.

1432
01:37:28,318 --> 01:37:30,827
I heard you were a reverse engineer,

1433
01:37:30,828 --> 01:37:32,877
one of the top three engineers at the
Ministry of Science and Technology.

1434
01:37:32,878 --> 01:37:36,464
If you accept me as a
disciple, I will do my best.

1435
01:37:36,465 --> 01:37:37,506
Who would have thought?

1436
01:37:37,507 --> 01:37:40,254
That the boss at my part-time
job was a genius hacker?

1437
01:37:40,255 --> 01:37:45,000
That he's one of the very few
Wizard Experts in the world.

1438
01:37:45,001 --> 01:37:47,065
This is not Hogwarts, okay?

1439
01:37:47,066 --> 01:37:49,493
Wizards? Are you a wizard?

1440
01:37:49,494 --> 01:37:51,233
Gryffindor or Slytherin?

1441
01:37:51,234 --> 01:37:53,826
Why do people always say,
"Gryffindor or Slytherin?"

1442
01:37:53,827 --> 01:37:56,116
Ravenclaw, known for their
cleverness and creativity,

1443
01:37:56,117 --> 01:37:58,956
and the protectors of morals
and character, Hufflepuff.

1444
01:37:58,957 --> 01:38:01,266
But I am... a Gryffindor.

1445
01:38:01,267 --> 01:38:03,661
- Such a nerd.
- Could you not bring her here anymore?

1446
01:38:03,662 --> 01:38:06,186
Hey, she didn't even pay for that.

1447
01:38:06,187 --> 01:38:07,265
He will pay for it.

1448
01:38:07,266 --> 01:38:10,558
That will be deducted from your wages.

1449
01:38:11,857 --> 01:38:15,359
Stop eating the expensive
snacks, take the bagged ones.

1450
01:38:15,360 --> 01:38:18,258
- May you travel safely, my master.
- Get lost!

1451
01:38:22,234 --> 01:38:24,674
All my favorites are in this!

1452
01:38:24,675 --> 01:38:26,474
Nothing but the best.

1453
01:38:26,475 --> 01:38:29,135
I'm a better cook than your number 28.

1454
01:38:29,136 --> 01:38:30,878
28?

1455
01:38:32,888 --> 01:38:35,028
I totally forgot about him.

1456
01:38:35,029 --> 01:38:38,053
It's okay, I'll just
have to find number 29.

1457
01:38:38,054 --> 01:38:40,005
Right.

1458
01:38:40,006 --> 01:38:41,617
Eat.

1459
01:38:42,700 --> 01:38:44,452
Wait.

1460
01:38:47,031 --> 01:38:49,464
My dumb dad.

1461
01:38:50,094 --> 01:38:53,213
Thanks for saving him twice.

1462
01:38:53,214 --> 01:38:55,408
It's not a big deal.

1463
01:38:55,409 --> 01:39:00,289
Your dad was kind to
me in high school, too.

1464
01:39:00,290 --> 01:39:04,414
Just tell him to stop going to
those weird investment seminars.

1465
01:39:04,415 --> 01:39:06,423
You make sure he doesn't, okay?

1466
01:39:24,631 --> 01:39:26,331
So pretty.

1467
01:39:27,268 --> 01:39:29,128
- Do you want water?
- Yes.

1468
01:39:50,512 --> 01:39:52,141
Finally finished eating.

1469
01:39:52,142 --> 01:39:54,255
You're looking good, Joohee.

1470
01:39:54,256 --> 01:39:55,906
[Better World invites you]

1471
01:39:57,808 --> 01:40:01,063
[If you accept, please
come to Bugak Hall B2-4.]

1472
01:40:02,866 --> 01:40:07,019
[The location link below]

1473
01:40:07,020 --> 01:40:09,269
[The password is]

1474
01:40:09,270 --> 01:40:12,651
[Romantic Hacker]

1475
01:40:12,652 --> 01:40:18,999
Channel Manager: maga_coco
Chief Editor: kakashiandme.

1476
01:40:19,000 --> 01:40:24,979
Chief Segmenter: miss_rochester.
Segmenters: plc_958 & porkypine90_261.

1477
01:40:24,980 --> 01:40:31,349
Thanks to all our moderators
and subtitle teams.

1478
01:40:31,350 --> 01:40:34,340
[Twenty Hacker: Black&White]

1479
01:40:38,268 --> 01:40:39,218
Wait!

1480
01:40:39,219 --> 01:40:40,404
[I have to take a dump!]

1481
01:40:40,405 --> 01:40:43,173
[Hyesoo: You're so gross.]

1482
01:40:43,174 --> 01:40:45,926
[It'll be 15 minutes.]

1483
01:40:45,927 --> 01:40:49,402
[Hyesoo: Everyone is are here.
You better hurry.]

1484
01:41:01,029 --> 01:41:04,220
Right. I'm on my way.

1485
01:41:07,746 --> 01:41:09,680
That's what happened.

1486
01:41:12,099 --> 01:41:14,385
What are you going to do?

1487
01:41:14,386 --> 01:41:17,678
You shouldn't try to save
the bait when you're fishing.

1488
01:41:17,679 --> 01:41:20,541
Everything has a role to play.

1489
01:41:22,580 --> 01:41:24,747
Lee Chanho...

1490
01:41:26,308 --> 01:41:28,008
has been expelled.

1491
01:41:29,442 --> 01:41:32,397
What do you think YOUKNOWWHAT is?

1492
01:41:35,846 --> 01:41:38,051
It's...

1493
01:41:38,052 --> 01:41:40,131
no one.

1494
01:41:40,132 --> 01:41:42,406
It's no one but...

1495
01:41:43,191 --> 01:41:45,030
it is everywhere.

1496
01:41:46,930 --> 01:41:50,199
[Twenty Hacker: Black&White]

1497
01:41:50,200 --> 01:41:56,439
Timing and Subtitles brought to you
by 🎇The Blessed Team🎇 @ Viki.com

1498
01:41:56,440 --> 01:42:00,869
♫ I think about you every moment ♫

1499
01:42:00,870 --> 01:42:06,149
♫ I was so happy, I liked it ♫

1500
01:42:06,150 --> 01:42:10,139
♫ Your pretty expression
when you look at me ♫

1501
01:42:10,140 --> 01:42:12,949
♫ Because it's so precious to me ♫

1502
01:42:12,950 --> 01:42:15,559
♫ I smile when I look at you ♫

1503
01:42:15,560 --> 01:42:20,489
♫ My heart that I didn't know yet ♫

1504
01:42:20,490 --> 01:42:25,489
♫ With little conviction,
I feel the change ♫

1505
01:42:25,490 --> 01:42:29,699
♫ I'm not going to hide it anymore ♫

1506
01:42:29,700 --> 01:42:37,700
♫ The way I love you... 'Cuz
we're not just friends to me ♫

1507
01:42:38,500 --> 01:42:42,700
♫ I'm afraid I can't stand it any longer ♫

1508
01:42:42,770 --> 01:42:47,789
♫ 'Cuz we are not just friends to me ♫

1509
01:42:47,790 --> 01:42:51,869
♫ It's a little more to me ♫

1510
01:42:51,870 --> 01:42:54,489
♫ I'm coming, hold my hand ♫

1511
01:42:54,490 --> 01:42:59,009
♫ Take, take my hand ♫

1512
01:42:59,010 --> 01:43:03,959
♫ 'Cuz it took a long time, oh baby ♫

1513
01:43:03,960 --> 01:43:08,749
♫ Take, take my hand ♫

1514
01:43:08,750 --> 01:43:14,400
♫ 'Cuz it took a long time, oh baby ♫

1515
01:43:15,370 --> 01:43:19,300
Thanks for watching!

How's miss Leka? 21 00:03:17,208 --> 00:03:19,541 - She's getting old now. - Really? 22 00:03:19,625 --> 00:03:21,791 - Can she walk? - She manages. 23 00:03:22,833 --> 00:03:24,250 You live with her, right? 24 00:03:25,291 --> 00:03:27,166 Do you still live with miss Leka? 25 00:03:29,750 --> 00:03:30,958 She changed a lot. 26 00:03:31,041 --> 00:03:32,166 Completely different. 27 00:03:32,250 --> 00:03:35,083 I remember her as a little girl with glasses. 28 00:03:35,166 --> 00:03:37,416 Her face changed after she's grown. 29 00:04:18,500 --> 00:04:21,208 I think every cinema bans cats. 30 00:04:22,166 --> 00:04:25,333 But the multiplex cinemas in the shopping malls might not have such problems. 31 00:04:26,375 --> 00:04:28,333 In the Siam cinema projection box, 32 00:04:28,416 --> 00:04:33,000 there's a sign on the door to the rooftop that says, "keep cats out." 33 00:04:33,916 --> 00:04:37,500 One day, I found a cat staring at me at my bedroom door, 34 00:04:37,583 --> 00:04:41,166 which means it would have had to walk through the entire projection box. 35 00:04:41,833 --> 00:04:43,500 We stared into each other's eyes for a while 36 00:04:43,583 --> 00:04:46,208 before I kicked it out so no one would notice. 37 00:04:47,541 --> 00:04:50,500 Even with a label saying, "do not feed the cats," 38 00:04:50,583 --> 00:04:53,291 Auntie Cha-Um, the office janitor, 39 00:04:53,375 --> 00:04:56,000 would just keep feeding them on the rooftops anyways. 40 00:05:00,250 --> 00:05:03,208 It's stuck. I can't take it off. 41 00:05:10,250 --> 00:05:12,250 Do we still have to drive the cats out? 42 00:05:13,458 --> 00:05:14,833 No, not anymore 43 00:05:28,583 --> 00:05:31,000 Does your dad know that they're tearing down Scala? 44 00:05:31,083 --> 00:05:32,458 Have you talked to him? 45 00:05:32,541 --> 00:05:33,875 No calls? 46 00:05:33,958 --> 00:05:36,291 I meant to call him too, but I got too busy. 47 00:05:37,375 --> 00:05:40,250 I think it was in late 1973. 48 00:05:46,291 --> 00:05:51,375 It was 40, 45 years ago. 49 00:05:52,583 --> 00:05:53,791 Around 1974. 50 00:05:56,666 --> 00:05:59,666 In the beginning, the Scala had 1,200 seats. 51 00:05:59,750 --> 00:06:02,791 It was the biggest one. 52 00:06:04,958 --> 00:06:07,791 Siam Cinema had 900 seats. 53 00:06:08,416 --> 00:06:09,958 The Lido Theater had 1,000 seats. 54 00:06:11,208 --> 00:06:12,750 This cinema had the most. 55 00:06:16,500 --> 00:06:23,125 I think it's the end of that October protest. 56 00:06:23,208 --> 00:06:25,458 So I started working here at the end of 1973. 57 00:06:26,291 --> 00:06:28,250 It was December, I remember. 58 00:06:29,416 --> 00:06:31,916 But I actually was working at Samyan cinema first. 59 00:06:32,458 --> 00:06:34,000 - Samyan? - Samyan. 60 00:06:34,083 --> 00:06:37,583 It's the place where... 61 00:06:38,541 --> 00:06:41,291 There were Samyan cinemas next to Hua Lamphong temple. 62 00:06:41,375 --> 00:06:43,208 You didn't know? 63 00:06:44,708 --> 00:06:46,500 It's a cinema screening Chinese movies. 64 00:06:46,583 --> 00:06:49,000 There are the Samyan and Rama cinemas. 65 00:06:49,750 --> 00:06:56,250 I worked there for over a year before moving to Lido in 1975. 66 00:06:59,625 --> 00:07:02,708 I remember seeing you and your father always arguing 67 00:07:02,791 --> 00:07:04,708 when I was working at the Siam Cinema. 68 00:07:05,291 --> 00:07:09,291 At first, you guys were able to talk normally, and soon started arguing. 69 00:07:09,375 --> 00:07:11,208 That's why Ms. Leka always said, 70 00:07:12,375 --> 00:07:15,375 "If you can't take care of her, give her to me. I will do it myself!" 71 00:07:15,458 --> 00:07:16,875 That's what she said. 72 00:07:23,125 --> 00:07:25,833 He was an ill-tempered man. 73 00:07:26,708 --> 00:07:28,833 He did not want your mother to see or meet you. 74 00:07:28,916 --> 00:07:31,500 It's like he doesn't want you to contact each other. 75 00:07:33,875 --> 00:07:35,250 So he had to... 76 00:07:35,333 --> 00:07:36,833 That's why you never saw her. 77 00:07:37,625 --> 00:07:40,500 I don't have a picture of her either. 78 00:07:41,375 --> 00:07:43,375 Back then, what should I say? 79 00:07:43,458 --> 00:07:49,041 Taking pictures wasn't easy. 80 00:07:52,000 --> 00:07:54,875 Uncle Nao was a projectionist at Siam cinema. 81 00:07:55,541 --> 00:07:57,958 It was at the Siam cinema projection box where I first met him. 82 00:07:59,916 --> 00:08:03,708 I don't remember when I started living in the Siam cinema. 83 00:08:03,791 --> 00:08:06,333 Before I knew it, I was already running around the place. 84 00:08:07,791 --> 00:08:10,583 But the Lido and the Scala, I didn't really visit so much back then 85 00:08:10,666 --> 00:08:14,041 unless there was a film I wanted to see that was not shown at our cinema. 86 00:08:15,583 --> 00:08:19,375 Although the Scala may look prettier than her sisters, 87 00:08:19,458 --> 00:08:23,375 I didn't feel that they were so different on the inside. 88 00:09:35,416 --> 00:09:37,291 Go, go. 89 00:09:40,083 --> 00:09:43,125 Stop. 90 00:09:46,833 --> 00:09:51,541 They've been here since 8:30 a.m. 91 00:09:53,583 --> 00:09:57,208 They didn't have the scaffoldings. They just started taking them off. 92 00:09:59,000 --> 00:10:00,583 Yes, but... 93 00:10:02,875 --> 00:10:05,583 Yes, someone's assisting him. 94 00:10:08,958 --> 00:10:11,333 Yes, it seems all right now. 95 00:10:17,458 --> 00:10:19,375 At this corner of the Siam cinema projection room, 96 00:10:19,458 --> 00:10:21,791 there was a door to our bedroom. 97 00:10:22,625 --> 00:10:24,750 Our bed lied underneath the huge air tubes. 98 00:10:25,583 --> 00:10:28,916 My sheets were the same fabric as the curtains at the cinema's entrance. 99 00:10:29,666 --> 00:10:32,958 I remember because I liked to run and brush these curtains with my hands 100 00:10:33,041 --> 00:10:36,083 while waiting for The Royal Anthem to end so I could enjoy the film right away. 101 00:10:41,708 --> 00:10:44,541 They can't start pulling the curtains down because it might rip something. 102 00:10:44,625 --> 00:10:46,583 - They're expensive curtains. - There's a procedure! 103 00:10:46,666 --> 00:10:48,958 - They're fireproof. - No, it's... 104 00:10:49,041 --> 00:10:51,791 - No, just remove the hoops! - Right. 105 00:10:52,291 --> 00:10:53,625 - Ready? - Okay! 106 00:10:54,458 --> 00:10:57,166 - I will do it in slow-motion, okay? - Okay! 107 00:10:57,708 --> 00:11:00,458 One, two, three. 108 00:11:13,208 --> 00:11:17,416 Maybe it can be recycled into a prosthetic leg. 109 00:11:18,291 --> 00:11:20,958 - No, it's metal. - It can't be. 110 00:11:21,041 --> 00:11:23,166 - It's metal? - Metal! 111 00:11:24,291 --> 00:11:25,333 It will rust. 112 00:11:25,416 --> 00:11:27,666 - I thought it was aluminum. - You sure? 113 00:11:28,416 --> 00:11:29,708 Damn, it's metal. 114 00:11:29,791 --> 00:11:32,250 - You want to get tetanus? - Right. 115 00:12:03,833 --> 00:12:06,125 - Where's Yod? - Come here. 116 00:12:06,208 --> 00:12:08,875 - Why don't you turn the light on? - Pull it. 117 00:12:20,000 --> 00:12:21,333 Can we rest a bit? 118 00:12:26,333 --> 00:12:28,000 Let's take a break. 119 00:12:30,500 --> 00:12:31,833 Let's take a break. 120 00:12:33,583 --> 00:12:35,625 How about pulling this way? 121 00:12:35,708 --> 00:12:37,708 No, you have to go in an angle that way. 122 00:12:49,500 --> 00:12:50,750 The rope broke. 123 00:12:50,833 --> 00:12:52,541 Even the rope broke. 124 00:13:14,416 --> 00:13:15,666 That's the last of it. 125 00:13:17,833 --> 00:13:19,625 Just move the rest of the curtains. 126 00:14:00,500 --> 00:14:02,041 Are you making a review video? 127 00:14:03,916 --> 00:14:06,583 No, more like a documentary film. 128 00:14:07,958 --> 00:14:09,583 It's sad, isn't it? 129 00:14:10,583 --> 00:14:14,208 Some say they used to come here when they were a child. 130 00:14:14,958 --> 00:14:19,291 People in their 30s saying they used to come to the Scala. 131 00:14:20,708 --> 00:14:24,250 Some older folks came here, just realizing that it's being demolished, 132 00:14:24,916 --> 00:14:28,125 and would say they came here since they were in their teens. 133 00:14:32,625 --> 00:14:36,666 Well, times changed. Things have to change too. 134 00:14:37,708 --> 00:14:39,625 What was new became something newer. 135 00:15:00,208 --> 00:15:02,708 Your side down, that side lifts. 136 00:15:09,583 --> 00:15:11,583 - That side first. - Lift. 137 00:15:13,750 --> 00:15:16,916 Don't lift yet! Don't lift yet! 138 00:15:17,000 --> 00:15:19,000 If you're not ready, just don't do it. 139 00:15:21,875 --> 00:15:23,125 Wait, wait. 140 00:15:39,291 --> 00:15:41,166 No one below to catch? 141 00:16:14,583 --> 00:16:16,208 - No. - No. 142 00:16:17,041 --> 00:16:19,708 Did you see that court order? 143 00:16:19,791 --> 00:16:24,083 The opposition party won the vote but did not get a seat. 144 00:16:26,958 --> 00:16:30,750 Just because he makes small merits with the monks. 145 00:16:32,500 --> 00:16:37,083 Now the election committee just revoked his seat in the parliament. 146 00:16:53,291 --> 00:16:57,291 How much did Yod win in the lotto? 147 00:16:57,375 --> 00:16:58,625 Three hundred? 148 00:17:15,833 --> 00:17:17,833 - This? - This one first. 149 00:17:18,416 --> 00:17:19,375 Take it here. 150 00:17:20,416 --> 00:17:21,916 Where to go? 151 00:17:23,833 --> 00:17:25,833 - Where? - Right here. 152 00:17:49,000 --> 00:17:50,208 It's just a frame. 153 00:17:54,166 --> 00:17:59,000 So, I went to work with uncle Saiyud at the Siam theater. 154 00:18:03,333 --> 00:18:07,625 Back then, all the Siam staff had quit. 155 00:18:08,500 --> 00:18:10,416 I think it was Sompoj, right? 156 00:18:12,625 --> 00:18:13,666 Sompoj. 157 00:18:14,875 --> 00:18:17,958 I was sent to help Sompoj, 158 00:18:19,500 --> 00:18:22,125 and then I came back here. 159 00:18:24,500 --> 00:18:28,000 I remember seeing you walk to school back then. 160 00:18:30,958 --> 00:18:36,541 THIS SITE, THEREFORE, HOLDS A HISTORICAL IMPORTANCE IN THAI FILM HISTORY. 161 00:18:36,625 --> 00:18:42,583 THIS PLAQUE WAS INSTALLED HERE ON WORLD AUDIOVISUAL HERITAGE DAY. 162 00:18:42,666 --> 00:18:46,750 OCTOBER 27TH, 2019 163 00:19:18,208 --> 00:19:21,791 It was only after the cinema closed that I know how to change the lights. 164 00:19:21,875 --> 00:19:26,583 - Let me see. - And now I'm an electrician. 165 00:19:26,666 --> 00:19:28,541 You still got it. 166 00:19:28,625 --> 00:19:30,041 Yes, but getting soft now. 167 00:19:31,000 --> 00:19:33,000 Just learning to be an electrician now. 168 00:19:33,083 --> 00:19:36,666 How disappointed my parents would be. 169 00:19:38,041 --> 00:19:42,375 They said that to Gen. 170 00:19:42,458 --> 00:19:45,333 That's all you get from working in Bangkok? 171 00:19:45,416 --> 00:19:47,666 Hold this, then. Yes, climb up. 172 00:19:47,750 --> 00:19:50,666 - Pull? - No, you hold it from the right. Yes. 173 00:19:52,041 --> 00:19:54,333 Hang on, give me a second. Big hammer go up. 174 00:19:55,208 --> 00:19:56,625 Hold it like this 175 00:19:57,750 --> 00:19:59,166 - Hey. - Hey. 176 00:19:59,250 --> 00:20:01,958 - Blackout again? - Blackout again. 177 00:20:02,041 --> 00:20:03,916 - Just let it go. I can't see. - Okay. 178 00:20:04,958 --> 00:20:07,750 I can't see.
