and that's where he stayed.

128
00:07:19,981 --> 00:07:21,775
I was living
with her father

129
00:07:21,816 --> 00:07:24,611
until Amber was about seven.

130
00:07:24,652 --> 00:07:28,114
Ricky was about two, three.

131
00:07:28,156 --> 00:07:31,117
That's when he really
started drinking a lot.

132
00:07:33,495 --> 00:07:37,123
Her father was
physically abusive to me.

133
00:07:37,165 --> 00:07:39,459
He never abused my children.

134
00:07:39,501 --> 00:07:41,836
He was just really mean
when he was drinking.

135
00:07:43,213 --> 00:07:44,631
He used to go out
and hang out

136
00:07:44,673 --> 00:07:46,383
with his friend,
Mike Thompson,

137
00:07:46,424 --> 00:07:49,427
and they would party
and drink together.

138
00:07:49,469 --> 00:07:51,680
And then he'll
come home or--

139
00:07:51,721 --> 00:07:54,724
And then he'll drink more,
and get drunk more.

140
00:07:54,766 --> 00:07:56,685
So the neighbors
would always call the police

141
00:07:56,726 --> 00:07:58,019
because of the noise.

142
00:07:58,061 --> 00:08:00,647
And the police
would always come.

143
00:08:00,689 --> 00:08:03,608
And the police--
the last time the police said,

144
00:08:03,650 --> 00:08:05,485
if we come back here again,

145
00:08:05,527 --> 00:08:07,737
we will take
your children from you.

146
00:08:07,779 --> 00:08:10,490
And that's all
I had to hear.

147
00:08:10,532 --> 00:08:12,409
- You want some fruit,
Richard?

148
00:08:12,450 --> 00:08:13,618
You want some fruit?

149
00:08:13,660 --> 00:08:17,497
- I knew my kids
need to be safe.

150
00:08:17,539 --> 00:08:20,208
I just took personal things
and just left

151
00:08:20,250 --> 00:08:21,835
and never went back.

152
00:08:21,876 --> 00:08:24,629
And we stayed in my car
for like two days

153
00:08:24,671 --> 00:08:26,381
in the parking lot.

154
00:08:26,423 --> 00:08:29,968
I couldn't go to my parents
because he would find us there,

155
00:08:30,010 --> 00:08:33,972
and so we just kind of hid out
in my car for two days.

156
00:08:34,014 --> 00:08:35,974
And then we went to
the women's shelter

157
00:08:36,016 --> 00:08:38,643
and stayed there for
about six weeks.

158
00:08:38,685 --> 00:08:40,353
And they helped me
get an a-apartment

159
00:08:40,395 --> 00:08:42,355
and get on welfare

160
00:08:42,397 --> 00:08:45,108
and help me get back
on my feet.

161
00:08:49,237 --> 00:08:50,572
We were still scared.

162
00:08:50,613 --> 00:08:53,491
And every little sound
or every little door knock

163
00:08:53,533 --> 00:08:54,868
we would jump to the ceiling

164
00:08:54,909 --> 00:08:56,828
because we didn't know
if he found out

165
00:08:56,870 --> 00:08:59,122
where we stayed at
or whatever.

166
00:08:59,164 --> 00:09:02,000
And it took almost
a good year before

167
00:09:02,042 --> 00:09:04,586
we could actually
live life again

168
00:09:04,627 --> 00:09:07,047
and be happy again.

169
00:09:12,052 --> 00:09:14,387
- They're having
a skating party for school

170
00:09:14,429 --> 00:09:16,306
and that's gonna
be $3 apiece.

171
00:09:16,348 --> 00:09:17,724
I can't do that.

172
00:09:17,766 --> 00:09:20,727
{\an8}So they're a little upset
about that, you know,

173
00:09:20,769 --> 00:09:23,229
{\an8}but I tell them
we'll save money

174
00:09:23,271 --> 00:09:24,773
{\an8}and next time you can go.

175
00:09:25,774 --> 00:09:27,734
- You always have
such a positive attitude

176
00:09:27,776 --> 00:09:29,903
no matter how much money
you've got in your pocket.

177
00:09:29,944 --> 00:09:31,738
You always tell me
you're not worried,

178
00:09:31,780 --> 00:09:33,239
- it'll be okay.
- Yeah.

179
00:09:33,281 --> 00:09:34,657
How do you do that?

180
00:09:34,699 --> 00:09:36,493
- It's depressing sometimes
but I try not to show it,

181
00:09:36,534 --> 00:09:37,911
especially in front
of my kids.

182
00:09:37,952 --> 00:09:39,954
I don't want them
to worry.

183
00:09:43,708 --> 00:09:46,920
I was going to school.

184
00:09:46,961 --> 00:09:50,006
I was volunteering at
the food stamp office,

185
00:09:50,048 --> 00:09:52,175
and-and my kids
were going to school

186
00:09:52,217 --> 00:09:53,968
and they were happy.

187
00:09:55,804 --> 00:09:57,722
- That's actually
asking a lot for somebody

188
00:09:57,764 --> 00:09:59,265
to be that open with us

189
00:09:59,307 --> 00:10:01,476
and to share all the hurdles,

190
00:10:01,518 --> 00:10:03,937
the ups and downs
and frustrations

191
00:10:03,978 --> 00:10:06,898
and the trials and tribulations
that they go to

192
00:10:06,940 --> 00:10:09,776
for people to have
a better understanding

193
00:10:09,818 --> 00:10:13,071
of what being
in that situation is like.

194
00:10:13,113 --> 00:10:16,199
And so it was a journey
that I couldn't have predicted.

195
00:10:16,241 --> 00:10:19,619
I couldn't have known
what would happen.

196
00:10:19,661 --> 00:10:21,121
- My daughter
worries a lot.

197
00:10:21,162 --> 00:10:22,747
She thinks we are going
to run out of money,

198
00:10:22,789 --> 00:10:24,207
don't have no money
for this or that.

199
00:10:24,249 --> 00:10:26,459
But I told her
everything will be okay.

200
00:10:26,501 --> 00:10:28,128
We'll never starve.

201
00:10:28,169 --> 00:10:31,214
We'll always eat.

202
00:10:31,256 --> 00:10:33,174
- Richard tried
so many times for me

203
00:10:33,216 --> 00:10:35,969
to come back
and move back in with him.

204
00:10:36,011 --> 00:10:38,179
And I said, no, I cannot.

205
00:10:38,221 --> 00:10:40,140
Because I know
what's going to happen.

206
00:10:40,181 --> 00:10:42,308
If I do that,
you'll just go right back

207
00:10:42,350 --> 00:10:44,477
to the way you were.

208
00:10:44,519 --> 00:10:47,147
Slowly I let Richard
come back into the kids' lives.

209
00:10:47,188 --> 00:10:48,648
Because that-that
is their father

210
00:10:48,690 --> 00:10:51,735
and like it or not,
that's--

211
00:10:51,776 --> 00:10:54,070
I had to for my kids.

212
00:10:54,112 --> 00:10:57,824
Amber was still
a little leery of him.

213
00:10:57,866 --> 00:10:59,743
She was still
a little scared that maybe

214
00:10:59,784 --> 00:11:01,870
he will get drunk again.

215
00:11:01,911 --> 00:11:04,956
But eventually that
kind of faded away as well.

216
00:11:04,998 --> 00:11:07,167
And they were okay together.

217
00:11:15,008 --> 00:11:18,720
* Happy birthday to you *

218
00:11:18,762 --> 00:11:22,515
* Happy birthday to you *

219
00:11:22,557 --> 00:11:24,351
* Happy birthday *

220
00:11:24,392 --> 00:11:27,270
- On her ninth birthday,
she had all her friends,

221
00:11:27,312 --> 00:11:30,023
and had birthday cake
and ice cream.

222
00:11:30,065 --> 00:11:32,609
Make a wish
and blow it out, baby.

223
00:11:32,650 --> 00:11:35,570
All right, whoo!

224
00:11:35,612 --> 00:11:37,030
Oh, boy!

225
00:11:37,072 --> 00:11:40,283
- She was just
bright-eyed and wide-eyed,

226
00:11:40,325 --> 00:11:42,202
and mouth open like, yay.

227
00:11:42,243 --> 00:11:45,622
- Oh!
- Look, sheets for your bed.

228
00:11:45,663 --> 00:11:48,541
- Donna's motivation
was that she wanted

229
00:11:48,583 --> 00:11:51,044
to make things better
for her kids.

230
00:11:51,086 --> 00:11:54,214
She was very open with us,

231
00:11:54,255 --> 00:11:58,551
and we were part
of their family for months.

232
00:11:58,593 --> 00:12:02,847
And you felt like they were
just part of mine, too.

233
00:12:02,889 --> 00:12:05,642
- The party's over!
- The party's over?

234
00:12:05,684 --> 00:12:07,560
[chuckling]

235
00:12:07,602 --> 00:12:09,062
She's a funny little girl.

236
00:12:09,104 --> 00:12:11,898
She's takes after
her grandpa with that.

237
00:12:11,940 --> 00:12:14,651
Um, she always
wants to be silly.

238
00:12:14,693 --> 00:12:17,946
Very smart,
fun-loving little girl.

239
00:12:53,565 --> 00:12:55,150
- Saturday is
our family day,

240
00:12:55,191 --> 00:12:58,069
so we decided we wanted
to go to Castle Park

241
00:12:58,111 --> 00:13:01,156
and we played there
for a couple hours

242
00:13:01,197 --> 00:13:02,991
and then they wanted
to come back here

243
00:13:03,033 --> 00:13:06,244
to granny and pawpaw's house.

244
00:13:06,286 --> 00:13:08,705
It was really nice,
warm winter days

245
00:13:08,747 --> 00:13:10,123
that were gorgeous days.

246
00:13:10,165 --> 00:13:13,793
Sun shining and everybody
was out and about.

247
00:13:13,835 --> 00:13:16,296
They decided they wanted
to ride their bicycles

248
00:13:16,338 --> 00:13:18,131
and I told them
it'd be fine

249
00:13:18,173 --> 00:13:21,843
and so once we got here,
they run up to the driveway

250
00:13:21,885 --> 00:13:24,012
and said hi to their pawpaw.

251
00:13:26,973 --> 00:13:28,308
And they got
on their bicycles

252
00:13:28,350 --> 00:13:30,435
and went towards
Claudia Street.

253
00:13:32,520 --> 00:13:35,398
- Me being the little brother,
I'm gonna follow her

254
00:13:35,440 --> 00:13:37,942
wherever she goes.

255
00:13:37,984 --> 00:13:40,820
{\an8}We would always ride our bikes
around the neighborhood,

256
00:13:40,862 --> 00:13:41,988
{\an8}and we did it very often,

257
00:13:42,030 --> 00:13:45,241
so I memorized
the neighborhood.

258
00:13:45,283 --> 00:13:46,618
- And I hollered
at them and said,

259
00:13:46,659 --> 00:13:49,454
well, y'all stay together
and y'all come right back.

260
00:13:49,496 --> 00:13:51,873
And Amber turns around
and she looks at me,

261
00:13:51,915 --> 00:13:54,834
okay Mommy, we will.

262
00:13:54,876 --> 00:13:56,920
And that was
my last time seeing her

263
00:14:06,638 --> 00:14:07,514
{\an8}**

264
00:14:12,435 --> 00:14:16,189
{\an8}- That day we went
to visit our grandparents

265
00:14:16,231 --> 00:14:17,982
{\an8}and, uh, every time
we go over there

266
00:14:18,024 --> 00:14:20,068
{\an8}we-we ride our bikes.

267
00:14:22,195 --> 00:14:24,030
{\an8}We would always
ride around the block

268
00:14:24,072 --> 00:14:26,574
{\an8}and come back around
to Highland,

269
00:14:26,616 --> 00:14:28,410
{\an8}but that day
we took a left

270
00:14:28,451 --> 00:14:30,954
{\an8}where we weren't
supposed to go.

271
00:14:30,995 --> 00:14:34,582
We went to a, uh,
abandoned parking lot

272
00:14:34,624 --> 00:14:37,502
that had a little, uh, ramp
that we can ride down.

273
00:14:38,962 --> 00:14:41,172
We were not allowed to go
to that parking lot

274
00:14:41,214 --> 00:14:43,633
without someone with us.

275
00:14:43,675 --> 00:14:47,095
But you know, kids,
we don't always listen, so...

276
00:14:51,683 --> 00:14:52,892
Something came over me.

277
00:14:52,934 --> 00:14:54,936
I got afraid
to get in trouble.

278
00:14:54,978 --> 00:14:57,605
So, uh, I was
telling my sister, Amber,

279
00:14:57,647 --> 00:14:59,983
let's-let's go back home.
Let's go back home.

280
00:15:00,025 --> 00:15:00,942
She was like,
"I'll be right behind you,

281
00:15:00,984 --> 00:15:02,736
"just go ahead."

282
00:15:02,777 --> 00:15:05,155
So, I took off.

283
00:15:05,196 --> 00:15:07,073
And by the time I got home,

284
00:15:07,115 --> 00:15:09,159
I noticed
she wasn't behind me.

285
00:15:09,200 --> 00:15:14,247
And my grandfather was outside
in the garage working.

286
00:15:14,289 --> 00:15:17,334
He asked me
where my sister was

287
00:15:17,375 --> 00:15:20,920
and so I told him, "Oh,
she's over there at the ramps."

288
00:15:20,962 --> 00:15:23,173
He, uh, grabbed me
and put me in the truck

289
00:15:23,214 --> 00:15:25,008
and we went to go look
for her.

290
00:15:28,386 --> 00:15:31,890
We just found her bike
laying there.

291
00:15:31,931 --> 00:15:36,144
And, uh...

292
00:15:36,186 --> 00:15:38,021
that's where it kinda
gets a little hazy.

293
00:16:09,427 --> 00:16:10,679
{\an8}- There was a witness
to this,

294
00:16:10,720 --> 00:16:13,848
{\an8}his name was Jimmie Kevil.
He was 78 years old.

295
00:16:13,890 --> 00:16:16,351
{\an8}He lived there
on Ruth Street.

296
00:16:16,393 --> 00:16:22,232
{\an8}He described the suspect as
a non-African American male,

297
00:16:22,273 --> 00:16:24,109
{\an8}less than six feet tall

298
00:16:24,150 --> 00:16:25,527
{\an8}with medium build

299
00:16:25,568 --> 00:16:28,697
{\an8}and clearly
of sufficient strength

300
00:16:28,738 --> 00:16:31,449
{\an8}that he was able to pick Amber
up off of the bicycle.

301
00:16:31,491 --> 00:16:34,244
Amber's feet never
hit the ground.

302
00:16:34,285 --> 00:16:37,288
Kevil also said
that he just drove

303
00:16:37,330 --> 00:16:38,915
at what appeared to be

304
00:16:38,957 --> 00:16:43,044
a normal speed
across the parking lot.

305
00:16:43,086 --> 00:16:45,213
The patrol officer
pulled into the parking lot

306
00:16:45,255 --> 00:16:47,173
because that's
where Jimmie Kevil said

307
00:16:47,215 --> 00:16:49,217
that the offense
took place.

308
00:16:49,259 --> 00:16:52,220
But as it turns out
Jimmy Whitson was there.

309
00:16:52,262 --> 00:16:54,723
He's come up there
to get his granddaughter, Amber.

310
00:16:54,764 --> 00:16:57,058
And there's nothing there
but Amber's bicycle.

311
00:16:57,100 --> 00:17:01,021
So, you've got
what Jimmie Kevil told 911

312
00:17:01,062 --> 00:17:02,856
and you've got
what Jimmy Whitson

313
00:17:02,897 --> 00:17:04,399
told the patrol officer.

314
00:17:04,441 --> 00:17:08,403
The patrol officer realizes
that we've got a problem here.

315
00:17:15,160 --> 00:17:18,329
- I'll never forget it,
telling my mom.

316
00:17:22,083 --> 00:17:24,210
Mom...

317
00:17:30,842 --> 00:17:34,262
My mom coming out the door

318
00:17:34,304 --> 00:17:36,931
expecting all of us
to-to be together

319
00:17:36,973 --> 00:17:41,811
and my grandpa
telling my mom that...

320
00:17:41,853 --> 00:17:45,940
that her baby girl is gone,

321
00:17:45,982 --> 00:17:49,319
and...

322
00:17:49,361 --> 00:17:52,197
and then she lost it.

323
00:17:52,238 --> 00:17:54,366
- So I immediately
started running

324
00:17:54,407 --> 00:17:55,700
and screaming her name,

325
00:17:55,742 --> 00:17:59,871
going towards
where she was last seen at.

326
00:17:59,913 --> 00:18:01,331
{\an8}I was just
screaming and crying

327
00:18:01,373 --> 00:18:04,292
{\an8}and screaming and crying
her name, "Amber! Amber!

328
00:18:04,334 --> 00:18:05,960
{\an8}"Where are you?"
You know?

329
00:18:06,002 --> 00:18:08,004
{\an8}And a few minutes later,

330
00:18:08,046 --> 00:18:10,715
{\an8}the neighbors
were coming outside,

331
00:18:10,757 --> 00:18:12,676
{\an8}wanting to know
what was going on.

332
00:18:19,391 --> 00:18:21,685
{\an8}I immediately called
Amber's father

333
00:18:21,726 --> 00:18:23,853
{\an8}at his best friend,
Mike Thompson's home.

334
00:18:39,869 --> 00:18:41,454
I'm at home on a Saturday.

335
00:18:41,496 --> 00:18:44,749
It was my day off
and the telephone rang

336
00:18:44,791 --> 00:18:46,334
and it was dispatch.

337
00:18:46,376 --> 00:18:50,255
{\an8}There was a possible
child abduction

338
00:18:50,296 --> 00:18:54,175
{\an8}on East Abram Street
in Arlington.

339
00:18:54,217 --> 00:18:57,012
My mind just goes
into overdrive.

340
00:18:57,053 --> 00:18:58,221
Is there a family member

341
00:18:58,263 --> 00:18:59,764
that's come and picked up
the child?

342
00:18:59,806 --> 00:19:01,683
Is there a custody issue?

343
00:19:01,725 --> 00:19:05,270
Is it someone that's known
to the child,

344
00:19:05,311 --> 00:19:10,275
that has
come and-and taken them?

345
00:19:10,316 --> 00:19:12,360
That used to be
a grocery store,

346
00:19:12,402 --> 00:19:15,697
and the trucks would pull in
and back in.

347
00:19:15,739 --> 00:19:17,866
They'd deliver
into the grocery store,

348
00:19:17,907 --> 00:19:20,326
and then of course
the ramp was for the workers

349
00:19:20,368 --> 00:19:22,829
to go up and down.

350
00:19:22,871 --> 00:19:25,582
Mr. Kevil lived
in this residence right here.

351
00:19:25,623 --> 00:19:28,251
He was in the backyard
doing some yard work

352
00:19:28,293 --> 00:19:33,131
and then he heard
a young girl scream.

353
00:19:33,173 --> 00:19:36,051
He noticed
the pickup truck stopped

354
00:19:36,092 --> 00:19:37,969
right there in that area,

355
00:19:38,011 --> 00:19:39,721
the driver
get out of the truck

356
00:19:39,763 --> 00:19:43,224
and grab the girl
off her bicycle.

357
00:19:43,266 --> 00:19:45,602
He exited out the north side
of the parking lot

358
00:19:45,643 --> 00:19:48,730
and then turned
to the west.

359
00:19:48,772 --> 00:19:51,524
The interesting thing about
going back to the west

360
00:19:51,566 --> 00:19:55,445
is it's back toward town
and it's more congested.

361
00:19:55,487 --> 00:19:59,074
The speculation was that
there was a specific place

362
00:19:59,115 --> 00:20:01,076
back to the west.

363
00:20:01,117 --> 00:20:02,786
If he was from out of town,

364
00:20:02,827 --> 00:20:04,412
I think he would have
gone to the east

365
00:20:04,454 --> 00:20:08,625
and accessed off of 360
to I-30 or I-20.

366
00:20:12,671 --> 00:20:14,422
{\an8}- I got a call
from my husband,

367
00:20:14,464 --> 00:20:16,508
{\an8}and he said,
"Donna's looking for you.

368
00:20:16,549 --> 00:20:18,426
{\an8}"She says
she needs your help."

369
00:20:18,468 --> 00:20:20,595
{\an8}So I called her
at Jimmy and Glenda's house,

370
00:20:20,637 --> 00:20:22,639
{\an8}the grandparents' house.

371
00:20:22,681 --> 00:20:24,516
And I said,
Donna, what's going on?

372
00:20:24,557 --> 00:20:27,519
She goes,
Amber's been taken.

373
00:20:27,560 --> 00:20:29,729
And my heart just sunk.

374
00:20:29,771 --> 00:20:32,607
I said, Okay,
I will be right there.

375
00:20:32,649 --> 00:20:35,318
- My main focus
was to find my baby.

376
00:20:35,360 --> 00:20:38,446
I wanted to go look for her.
I wanted to go.

377
00:20:38,488 --> 00:20:41,199
But my parents are saying,
"No, you have to stay here.

378
00:20:41,241 --> 00:20:43,868
"You need to be here
if she comes home."

379
00:20:43,910 --> 00:20:45,412
Not too long after that,

380
00:20:45,453 --> 00:20:48,373
Richard showed up
at my mother's house.

381
00:20:50,208 --> 00:20:51,710
{\an8}- There's a lot
of things moving

382
00:20:51,751 --> 00:20:53,378
{\an8}in the first 15 minutes
of the investigation.

383
00:20:54,421 --> 00:20:56,256
At the abduction site,
one of the things you do

384
00:20:56,297 --> 00:20:58,258
is you take stock
and look around

385
00:20:58,299 --> 00:20:59,718
to see what all is there,

386
00:20:59,759 --> 00:21:01,636
and also specifically
what isn't there.

387
00:21:01,678 --> 00:21:03,138
Where that truck
was sitting,

388
00:21:03,179 --> 00:21:06,516
if there was any dirt that
would hold a tire impression,

389
00:21:06,558 --> 00:21:08,351
if the guy
had smoked a cigarette,

390
00:21:08,393 --> 00:21:11,604
or anything.
There was none of that.

391
00:21:11,646 --> 00:21:13,481
- We looked around
the area,

392
00:21:13,523 --> 00:21:16,317
and we noticed that
there was a laundromat there

393
00:21:16,359 --> 00:21:18,028
and that there were
people coming and going

394
00:21:18,069 --> 00:21:19,904
from the laundromat.

395
00:21:19,946 --> 00:21:21,531
- On the west side
of the laundromat,

396
00:21:21,573 --> 00:21:23,408
which is
where she was abducted from,

397
00:21:23,450 --> 00:21:24,701
there are no windows,

398
00:21:24,743 --> 00:21:27,412
so no one in the laundromat
could see anything

399
00:21:27,454 --> 00:21:29,664
that was going on.

400
00:21:29,706 --> 00:21:32,500
Jimmie Kevil by far,
where he was standing,

401
00:21:32,542 --> 00:21:34,627
had the best vantage point.

402
00:21:34,669 --> 00:21:36,463
There's no sense
in everybody sitting around

403
00:21:36,504 --> 00:21:38,048
that parking lot
because she's not there.

404
00:21:43,219 --> 00:21:44,804
{\an8}- Once the call went out
over the radio

405
00:21:44,846 --> 00:21:47,223
{\an8}that we had a child
that had been abducted,

406
00:21:47,265 --> 00:21:49,351
{\an8}I started
going all over the area,

407
00:21:49,392 --> 00:21:52,228
{\an8}looking for
the suspect vehicle,

408
00:21:52,270 --> 00:21:56,524
which was a black
single cab pickup truck.

409
00:21:56,566 --> 00:21:59,861
I did pull over
a few black pickup trucks

410
00:21:59,903 --> 00:22:02,572
in hopes that I would be able
to find the suspect

411
00:22:02,614 --> 00:22:05,408
and find Amber.

412
00:22:05,450 --> 00:22:08,161
- In Texas,
pickup trucks are everywhere.

413
00:22:08,203 --> 00:22:09,537
Black pickup trucks,

414
00:22:09,579 --> 00:22:11,915
you don't really realize
how many of them there are

415
00:22:11,956 --> 00:22:14,042
until you
start looking for them.

416
00:22:14,084 --> 00:22:15,543
They're everywhere.

417
00:22:15,585 --> 00:22:20,215
It helps narrow things down
but not much.

418
00:22:20,256 --> 00:22:22,550
When you look at
that area of town,

419
00:22:22,592 --> 00:22:24,386
as he goes west
on Abram Street,

420
00:22:24,427 --> 00:22:26,096
there's a number of places
where he can

421
00:22:26,137 --> 00:22:29,265
get off either into
a residential neighborhood

422
00:22:29,307 --> 00:22:30,558
on the south side,

423
00:22:30,600 --> 00:22:32,185
or one of these
light industrial areas

424
00:22:32,227 --> 00:22:33,853
on the north side.

425
00:22:33,895 --> 00:22:37,315
- The Browning-Abram area
of Arlington, Texas,

426
00:22:37,357 --> 00:22:41,236
it's an area of town where
people have owned their homes

427
00:22:41,277 --> 00:22:44,155
sometimes
for 30, 40, 50 years,

428
00:22:44,197 --> 00:22:46,574
and so you have a very
established group of people

429
00:22:46,616 --> 00:22:47,867
that are living there.

430
00:22:47,909 --> 00:22:50,537
I would not describe it
as a high crime area

431
00:22:50,578 --> 00:22:55,583
or a high-risk area
necessarily.

432
00:22:55,625 --> 00:22:57,460
- This type of abduction
in Arlington

433
00:22:57,502 --> 00:23:00,672
is almost unheard of.

434
00:23:00,714 --> 00:23:02,173
The problem it creates
for law enforcement

435
00:23:02,215 --> 00:23:04,592
is you've got to be able
to get it off the ground

436
00:23:04,634 --> 00:23:06,594
in a rapid
but deliberate manner.

437
00:23:06,636 --> 00:23:08,555
There's not much room
for error here.

438
00:23:11,099 --> 00:23:12,142
So I got there,

439
00:23:12,183 --> 00:23:14,686
and I started going
under the tape,

440
00:23:14,728 --> 00:23:15,979
and of course
the police were like,

441
00:23:16,021 --> 00:23:18,982
"What are you doing?"
They had to go ask Donna.

442
00:23:19,024 --> 00:23:21,901
She goes, "No,
I want her to come in."

443
00:23:21,943 --> 00:23:24,195
And they were
all looking at each other,

444
00:23:24,237 --> 00:23:27,615
"Why is this reporter
just walking into the house

445
00:23:27,657 --> 00:23:30,118
"like she knows
these people?"

446
00:23:30,160 --> 00:23:31,995
But I did.
Uh, I knew them.

447
00:23:32,037 --> 00:23:34,039
I'd been living
their lives with them.

448
00:23:34,080 --> 00:23:36,666
We just kept documenting
what was happening

449
00:23:36,708 --> 00:23:38,585
and being with the family

450
00:23:38,626 --> 00:23:43,089
and really showing
their side of the story.

451
00:23:43,131 --> 00:23:45,967
- On that day, once
all the police were involved,

452
00:23:46,009 --> 00:23:48,136
everyone asking me,
"Did you see anything?

453
00:23:48,178 --> 00:23:49,637
"Did you see anybody?

454
00:23:49,679 --> 00:23:51,181
"It's very important
that, you know,

455
00:23:51,222 --> 00:23:55,935
"if you did see anybody,
anything just tell me,

456
00:23:55,977 --> 00:23:58,313
"so we can
do something about it."

457
00:23:58,355 --> 00:24:00,523
And I didn't have
an answer.

458
00:24:00,565 --> 00:24:03,276
I didn't see anybody.

459
00:24:03,318 --> 00:24:06,613
- If we had only been able to
get that word out immediately

460
00:24:06,654 --> 00:24:08,990
then maybe somebody
on that street

461
00:24:09,032 --> 00:24:11,910
where he turned would have
seen him immediately.

462
00:24:24,172 --> 00:24:25,465
- Amber was abducted
at about 3:20 in the afternoon.

463
00:24:30,011 --> 00:24:33,139
Somewhere around 4:30,
the police department

464
00:24:33,181 --> 00:24:35,684
contacted the various
media outlets

465
00:24:35,725 --> 00:24:37,435
and was trying
to get them there.

466
00:24:37,477 --> 00:24:39,437
{\an8}But what I truly wish

467
00:24:39,479 --> 00:24:42,190
{\an8}is that there would have
been a method

468
00:24:42,232 --> 00:24:44,943
{\an8}that we could have got
more information out faster.

469
00:24:49,280 --> 00:24:51,825
{\an8}- I remember I was in shorts
and a T-shirt.

470
00:24:51,866 --> 00:24:54,869
{\an8}On January 13, even for Texas,
that's not common.

471
00:24:54,911 --> 00:24:56,788
{\an8}It was unseasonably warm.

472
00:24:56,830 --> 00:24:59,708
{\an8}And I remember being at home
and got a call.

473
00:24:59,749 --> 00:25:03,294
{\an8}They said we had a witness
saw a girl get abducted.

474
00:25:03,336 --> 00:25:07,007
{\an8}I said, "I'm on my way."

475
00:25:07,048 --> 00:25:08,967
{\an8}I drove down the streets

476
00:25:09,009 --> 00:25:10,927
{\an8}of this little
residential neighborhood

477
00:25:10,969 --> 00:25:13,638
{\an8}and I could already see
all these TV vans

478
00:25:13,680 --> 00:25:15,974
{\an8}just lined up
and I remember thinking,

479
00:25:16,016 --> 00:25:18,351
{\an8}"Oh, my God,
this is what they mean

480
00:25:18,393 --> 00:25:20,270
{\an8}"when they say
'media circus.'"

481
00:25:23,857 --> 00:25:27,986
{\an8}- Statistics show
that in 74% of the cases

482
00:25:28,028 --> 00:25:31,114
{\an8}where an abducted child
is murdered,

483
00:25:31,156 --> 00:25:33,491
{\an8}they're killed within
the first three hours.

484
00:25:33,533 --> 00:25:35,535
{\an8}So time is of the essence

485
00:25:35,577 --> 00:25:37,662
{\an8}and getting
that information out

486
00:25:37,704 --> 00:25:41,416
{\an8}to the public
is just critical.

487
00:25:41,458 --> 00:25:43,335
{\an8}This was the '90s.

488
00:25:43,376 --> 00:25:46,504
The fastest way that you were
going to get out information

489
00:25:46,546 --> 00:25:48,173
would be
the 6 o'clock news.

490
00:25:48,214 --> 00:25:51,259
And so, of course,
there was a lag time.

491
00:25:51,301 --> 00:25:52,302
It doesn't sound like

492
00:25:52,344 --> 00:25:53,636
someone that
the little girl knew,

493
00:25:53,678 --> 00:25:55,847
or someone that she was
going with voluntarily.

494
00:25:55,889 --> 00:25:58,767
- We set up a command post
out by the residence

495
00:25:58,808 --> 00:26:01,853
at her grandparents' house.

496
00:26:01,895 --> 00:26:04,731
The media was responding,
huge response.

497
00:26:04,773 --> 00:26:07,650
I mean, every station
as far as they could get

498
00:26:07,692 --> 00:26:11,863
had Live trucks there.

499
00:26:11,905 --> 00:26:12,989
One of the things
we were doing

500
00:26:13,031 --> 00:26:14,449
is we're trying
to keep track

501
00:26:14,491 --> 00:26:15,909
of who was coming
to the house,

502
00:26:15,950 --> 00:26:17,243
who was coming to the door,

503
00:26:17,285 --> 00:26:20,455
who knew Donna, Richard
and their family,

504
00:26:20,497 --> 00:26:22,624
and what their
relationship was.

505
00:26:22,665 --> 00:26:24,542
{\an8}- The police
were asking me, you know,

506
00:26:24,584 --> 00:26:26,628
{\an8}who is in my--
in our circle,

507
00:26:26,670 --> 00:26:27,712
{\an8}you know,
who's around us,

508
00:26:27,754 --> 00:26:29,255
{\an8}who's around Amber
all the time?

509
00:26:29,297 --> 00:26:31,132
Who's around Ricky
all the time?

510
00:26:31,174 --> 00:26:33,259
And so, that's when
we thought about Pam,

511
00:26:33,301 --> 00:26:34,886
and I was telling them
about Pam Curry

512
00:26:34,928 --> 00:26:37,138
and the documentary.

513
00:26:37,180 --> 00:26:40,225
- This is my 1st grade
group picture

514
00:26:40,266 --> 00:26:42,477
and these are my friends
and Ms. Riley.

515
00:26:43,937 --> 00:26:47,232
{\an8}- Look, what's that thing
that goes on it?

516
00:26:47,273 --> 00:26:51,027
{\an8}- We had footage
of this little girl alive

517
00:26:51,069 --> 00:26:53,947
{\an8}not some grainy picture
that we were gonna slap up.

518
00:26:53,988 --> 00:26:55,907
{\an8}And back then,
that's what you did

519
00:26:55,949 --> 00:26:59,077
{\an8}in a tragic news story
like this.

520
00:26:59,119 --> 00:27:00,745
That's all the family
had to rely on

521
00:27:00,787 --> 00:27:03,707
is to throw up
a still picture.

522
00:27:03,748 --> 00:27:06,167
We put together a clip reel

523
00:27:06,209 --> 00:27:09,337
of some of the best
identifiable footage

524
00:27:09,379 --> 00:27:11,297
that I had from
shooting the documentary.

525
00:27:12,465 --> 00:27:14,426
- It was heart-wrenching,
the video was.

526
00:27:14,467 --> 00:27:16,344
I mean it was her
blowing out the candles

527
00:27:16,386 --> 00:27:17,762
of her birthday cake.

528
00:27:17,804 --> 00:27:19,681
It was her mom
putting her to bed.

529
00:27:19,723 --> 00:27:21,641
It was her playing
Ring Around the Rosie

530
00:27:21,683 --> 00:27:23,101
out in the yard
with her friends

531
00:27:23,143 --> 00:27:24,769
at her birthday party.

532
00:27:24,811 --> 00:27:26,104
It was her going to school.

533
00:27:26,146 --> 00:27:29,607
I mean, it made her
such a person.

534
00:27:29,649 --> 00:27:31,776
I read, um, 89 books.

535
00:27:31,818 --> 00:27:33,194
89?

536
00:27:33,236 --> 00:27:36,948
- I immediately thought,
"Oh, my gosh, this is it.

537
00:27:36,990 --> 00:27:39,951
"Someone saw that on TV
and that she was targeted.

538
00:27:39,993 --> 00:27:42,120
"You know,
they'd seen her on TV."

539
00:27:42,162 --> 00:27:44,622
And they said,
"None of it's aired.

540
00:27:44,664 --> 00:27:47,959
"Not one bit of it
has aired."

541
00:27:48,001 --> 00:27:51,087
- On the day
that Amber was kidnapped,

542
00:27:51,129 --> 00:27:55,258
we had finished
the welfare documentary,

543
00:27:55,300 --> 00:27:58,887
and it was gonna be airing
the next week.

544
00:27:58,928 --> 00:28:00,972
- Fairy stories.
- Fairy tales.

545
00:28:01,014 --> 00:28:04,267
Fairy tales.

546
00:28:04,309 --> 00:28:05,977
- I mean this just
touched everyone's heart

547
00:28:06,019 --> 00:28:08,480
and I thought this is
the absolute best break

548
00:28:08,521 --> 00:28:10,023
we could possibly get.

549
00:28:10,065 --> 00:28:12,150
Because everyone's
going to remember this now.

550
00:28:15,945 --> 00:28:17,113
{\an8}I won't say it threw us,

551
00:28:17,155 --> 00:28:22,327
{\an8}but it was something
that was highly unusual.

552
00:28:22,369 --> 00:28:24,496
{\an8}We had never been on a case
where somebody had already had

553
00:28:24,537 --> 00:28:25,914
{\an8}a television crew
following them around

554
00:28:25,955 --> 00:28:28,375
{\an8}taking footage of it.

555
00:28:28,416 --> 00:28:30,585
And we used that footage
not only to try

556
00:28:30,627 --> 00:28:33,713
and give people an idea
of what Amber looked like,

557
00:28:33,755 --> 00:28:37,926
but also the idea
of who Amber was.

558
00:28:37,967 --> 00:28:39,844
- Having the footage
of Amber

559
00:28:39,886 --> 00:28:42,847
really showed
the community

560
00:28:42,889 --> 00:28:45,308
the person they needed
to track down

561
00:28:45,350 --> 00:28:48,103
if they see
the black pickup truck

562
00:28:48,144 --> 00:28:49,688
and here's
what she looks like

563
00:28:49,729 --> 00:28:53,024
and her mannerisms.

564
00:28:53,066 --> 00:28:56,444
- That made
a tremendous impact

565
00:28:56,486 --> 00:28:58,029
on the community.

566
00:29:03,576 --> 00:29:06,162
- Eventually there were
just cameras everywhere.

567
00:29:06,204 --> 00:29:09,833
Everywhere I turned
there was a camera in my face.

568
00:29:09,874 --> 00:29:11,960
Don't hurt my baby.
Please.

569
00:29:12,002 --> 00:29:14,045
She's just
an innocent child.

570
00:29:14,087 --> 00:29:18,341
Please.
Please bring her home safe.

571
00:29:18,383 --> 00:29:19,884
Please.

572
00:29:19,926 --> 00:29:22,345
{\an8}- If anybody out
there's seen anything,

573
00:29:22,387 --> 00:29:25,015
{\an8}call the police,
tell them, let them know.

574
00:29:25,056 --> 00:29:28,435
{\an8}- I was on every camera
I could find

575
00:29:28,476 --> 00:29:32,147
{\an8}begging, "Please,
let my little girl go."

576
00:29:36,901 --> 00:29:38,111
You know, she's smart.

577
00:29:38,153 --> 00:29:41,156
She could find her way home,
just let her go.

578
00:29:45,076 --> 00:29:47,454
I didn't eat,
I couldn't sleep,

579
00:29:47,495 --> 00:29:52,792
I couldn't do anything
but watch the TV,

580
00:29:52,834 --> 00:29:57,088
beg for him
to let her come back home.

581
00:29:57,130 --> 00:29:58,340
- Just waiting
for her to come in the door

582
00:29:58,381 --> 00:30:01,718
any minute now,
which is hard.

583
00:30:03,303 --> 00:30:06,181
- It was just a lot
of sitting and waiting

584
00:30:06,222 --> 00:30:09,768
and just gut-wrenching.

585
00:30:09,809 --> 00:30:13,396
It was a helplessness,
a hopeful still.

586
00:30:13,438 --> 00:30:18,360
But she couldn't do anything
but just be there.

587
00:30:21,029 --> 00:30:23,782
What started out
as a welfare documentary

588
00:30:23,823 --> 00:30:28,161
that was really focused on
Donna and Amber and Ricky,

589
00:30:28,203 --> 00:30:31,164
turned into a real
true-crime documentary.

590
00:30:36,836 --> 00:30:41,091
{\an8}- We started getting tips
and leads on Amber's abduction

591
00:30:41,132 --> 00:30:42,801
{\an8}almost immediately.

592
00:30:42,842 --> 00:30:44,219
{\an8}As soon as
it hit the news,

593
00:30:44,260 --> 00:30:47,013
{\an8}people started
calling in with leads.

594
00:30:47,055 --> 00:30:48,473
{\an8}What's your name again?

595
00:30:48,515 --> 00:30:52,102
{\an8}- We never anticipated
the number of leads

596
00:30:52,143 --> 00:30:54,646
{\an8}and calls from
the general public

597
00:30:54,688 --> 00:30:58,566
{\an8}that we were going to get.

598
00:30:58,608 --> 00:31:01,069
- And then they were
also talking to anybody

599
00:31:01,111 --> 00:31:04,322
who they considered to be,
you know,

600
00:31:04,364 --> 00:31:05,657
involved with the family,

601
00:31:05,699 --> 00:31:09,661
which included me
and my photographers.

602
00:31:09,703 --> 00:31:11,579
- The people from
the television affiliate,

603
00:31:11,621 --> 00:31:15,000
they had quite a bit of footage
of her, and of course,

604
00:31:15,041 --> 00:31:16,292
one of the things
you've got to do

605
00:31:16,334 --> 00:31:18,837
in any investigation
is find out who they are

606
00:31:18,878 --> 00:31:23,425
because at that particular time
everybody is a suspect.

607
00:31:23,466 --> 00:31:25,510
- It was still
a little intimidating

608
00:31:25,552 --> 00:31:27,262
that you had to
go through that.

609
00:31:27,303 --> 00:31:30,765
But you wanted to
do what you could to help.

610
00:31:30,807 --> 00:31:32,183
- We identified
who they were

611
00:31:32,225 --> 00:31:33,977
and interviewed
several of them.

612
00:31:34,019 --> 00:31:35,145
There was no question
in our mind

613
00:31:35,186 --> 00:31:37,689
that whoever took her
had nothing to do

614
00:31:37,731 --> 00:31:40,567
with that television crew.

615
00:31:42,694 --> 00:31:44,070
I am hopeful.

616
00:31:44,112 --> 00:31:47,449
I pray all the time that
the little girl won't be hurt.

617
00:31:47,490 --> 00:31:51,536
That's all we got to live on
right now is prayer.

618
00:31:51,578 --> 00:31:53,329
- I have a five-year-old
and a 20-month-old

619
00:31:53,371 --> 00:31:56,374
and I just--
I can't imagine it.

620
00:31:56,416 --> 00:32:00,170
- I think she's probably really,
really scared.

621
00:32:00,211 --> 00:32:02,172
I'm just sitting tight.

622
00:32:02,213 --> 00:32:03,715
I don't know what to do.

623
00:32:03,757 --> 00:32:05,717
You know, I want to help
and I want to go get her

624
00:32:05,759 --> 00:32:07,093
but I can't get her.

625
00:32:07,135 --> 00:32:08,720
You know,
I don't know where she's at.

626
00:32:15,602 --> 00:32:18,063
{\an8}- It was like, I think,
you know,

627
00:32:18,104 --> 00:32:20,982
{\an8}two or three weeks prior to

628
00:32:21,024 --> 00:32:22,484
{\an8}but we didn't
get along at that time

629
00:32:22,525 --> 00:32:29,532
{\an8}so we did mostly
just phone conversations.

630
00:32:29,574 --> 00:32:32,077
{\an8}- I met Richard that night
when Amber was kidnapped.

631
00:32:32,118 --> 00:32:35,080
{\an8}It was a little bit
of a tense situation

632
00:32:35,121 --> 00:32:37,957
{\an8}because he didn't know
what I was doing.

633
00:32:37,999 --> 00:32:41,294
{\an8}He was a little leery of that,
as I'm sure anybody would be

634
00:32:41,336 --> 00:32:43,588
{\an8}but we just kept doing
what we'd been doing

635
00:32:43,630 --> 00:32:45,173
{\an8}for so many months.

636
00:32:53,890 --> 00:32:57,936
{\an8}- No, no.
It-it wasn't abusive.

637
00:32:57,977 --> 00:32:59,229
{\an8}You know,
I may have yelled.

638
00:32:59,270 --> 00:33:01,189
{\an8}I may have yelled in the past,

639
00:33:01,231 --> 00:33:03,817
{\an8}but my dad yelled at me
and he yelled a-at my mom.

640
00:33:03,858 --> 00:33:05,694
{\an8}That's two people
trying to work something out.

641
00:33:05,735 --> 00:33:07,445
{\an8}- One of the things
that is critical

642
00:33:07,487 --> 00:33:09,614
{\an8}in the opening phases
of the investigation

643
00:33:09,656 --> 00:33:13,284
{\an8}is to try and establish
the family dynamics.

644
00:33:13,326 --> 00:33:17,664
{\an8}Amber's gone
but we don't know who took her.

645
00:33:17,706 --> 00:33:20,000
- Richard and I, at the time,
we were battling

646
00:33:20,041 --> 00:33:21,960
and we were
not getting along.

647
00:33:22,002 --> 00:33:24,796
And he was angry with me
for leaving him.

648
00:33:24,838 --> 00:33:28,174
- Nowadays standards,
an argument is-is violence.

649
00:33:28,216 --> 00:33:30,301
And that's not--
to me, that's not true.

650
00:33:30,343 --> 00:33:31,720
An argument's an argument.

651
00:33:31,761 --> 00:33:33,596
- All of these
investigative things

652
00:33:33,638 --> 00:33:34,723
come into play.

653
00:33:34,764 --> 00:33:37,559
It's not a very kind world
to live in.

654
00:33:37,600 --> 00:33:40,937
{\an8}The dad's out of the picture,
where was he?

655
00:33:40,979 --> 00:33:41,980
{\an8}Who does he know?

656
00:33:42,022 --> 00:33:43,273
{\an8}You have to
just suspect anything

657
00:33:49,738 --> 00:33:49,988
{\an8}**

658
00:33:51,197 --> 00:33:52,490
{\an8}We're both innocent.

659
00:33:52,532 --> 00:33:53,783
{\an8}I mean, there's no reason for us
to harm our child.

660
00:33:53,825 --> 00:33:56,369
{\an8}We want our child back.
We want our child found.

661
00:34:01,541 --> 00:34:04,252
- Friends and family
continue to post notices

662
00:34:04,294 --> 00:34:07,005
and seek clues
in the search for Amber.

663
00:34:07,047 --> 00:34:09,424
- We're more upset because
there's nothing we can do.

664
00:34:09,466 --> 00:34:11,051
Nobody knows anything.
That's the thing.

665
00:34:11,092 --> 00:34:14,804
We can't do anything.
You don't know where to look.

666
00:34:19,893 --> 00:34:25,648
{\an8}- Day three, we did not have
an individual identified.

667
00:34:25,690 --> 00:34:27,859
{\an8}Of course,
in any investigation like this

668
00:34:27,901 --> 00:34:30,612
{\an8}you start at the core
and work out.

669
00:34:30,653 --> 00:34:32,989
{\an8}- Less than one percent of
child abduction cases

670
00:34:33,031 --> 00:34:36,659
{\an8}in the United States,
are stranger abductions,

671
00:34:36,701 --> 00:34:39,871
{\an8}children who are taken by
someone that they do not know.

672
00:34:39,913 --> 00:34:43,124
The majority of the cases
in this country

673
00:34:43,166 --> 00:34:45,585
are family abductions.

674
00:34:45,627 --> 00:34:47,837
- We're trying to identify
Richard's movements

675
00:34:47,879 --> 00:34:50,298
for January the 13th.

676
00:34:50,340 --> 00:34:52,592
He told us that--
in the afternoon

677
00:34:52,634 --> 00:34:54,427
that he went down
to the mini warehouse,

678
00:34:54,469 --> 00:34:57,138
going to one of the stalls.

679
00:34:57,180 --> 00:35:00,100
- And we got him
on surveillance video

680
00:35:00,141 --> 00:35:01,476
not a care in the world,

681
00:35:01,518 --> 00:35:05,689
no idea that anything amiss
had happened

682
00:35:05,730 --> 00:35:07,148
but we went down
to the mini warehouse

683
00:35:07,190 --> 00:35:08,316
and searched it anyway

684
00:35:08,358 --> 00:35:10,860
and of course
there was nothing there.

685
00:35:10,902 --> 00:35:12,529
{\an8}- So without a doubt,
we were able to

686
00:35:12,570 --> 00:35:14,489
{\an8}eliminate Richard as a suspect,

687
00:35:14,531 --> 00:35:16,908
{\an8}because of him being on video
at another location,

688
00:35:16,950 --> 00:35:19,494
{\an8}and he physically could not
have been at the location

689
00:35:19,536 --> 00:35:22,497
{\an8}to abduct his daughter.

690
00:35:22,539 --> 00:35:24,708
{\an8}- For a split second,
I did think

691
00:35:24,749 --> 00:35:28,128
{\an8}Richard might have had
something to do with it.

692
00:35:28,169 --> 00:35:31,506
Once Richard got there,
when I seen him face-to-face

693
00:35:31,548 --> 00:35:34,759
and how much shock he was in
that Amber was taken

694
00:35:34,801 --> 00:35:37,595
and how confused he was,
how can this happen,

695
00:35:37,637 --> 00:35:38,763
and I knew right then and there

696
00:35:38,805 --> 00:35:42,183
that he had
nothing to do with it.

697
00:35:42,225 --> 00:35:45,061
- I will say this for him,
that when he was interviewed

698
00:35:45,103 --> 00:35:46,855
he bared his soul.

699
00:35:46,896 --> 00:35:51,401
I mean he just,
anything we asked he told us

700
00:35:51,443 --> 00:35:53,653
because he didn't want us
wasting time on that.

701
00:35:53,695 --> 00:35:55,655
And the best way
to get away from that

702
00:35:55,697 --> 00:35:59,868
is to tell us anything and
everything we need to know.

703
00:35:59,909 --> 00:36:01,536
- Amber, baby,
if you're seeing me,

704
00:36:01,578 --> 00:36:03,747
if you hear Daddy,
we love you,

705
00:36:03,788 --> 00:36:10,378
Mommy loves you.
Miss you,

706
00:36:10,420 --> 00:36:13,923
we need you--
need you to come home.

707
00:36:13,965 --> 00:36:16,343
- I remember thinking that
that must have been

708
00:36:16,384 --> 00:36:17,969
so hard for her.

709
00:36:18,011 --> 00:36:22,223
{\an8}Given that theirs had not been,
from what she told me,

710
00:36:22,265 --> 00:36:24,392
{\an8}an amicable parting.

711
00:36:24,434 --> 00:36:29,105
{\an8}And so I think
she just kept focused on

712
00:36:29,147 --> 00:36:30,565
{\an8}what needed to be done.

713
00:36:30,607 --> 00:36:34,527
{\an8}And she didn't really
let any of that get in her way.

714
00:36:36,279 --> 00:36:37,572
I did love him at one point

715
00:36:37,614 --> 00:36:40,241
and he is the father
of my two children.

716
00:36:40,283 --> 00:36:43,536
I think he knew in his mind
that he--

717
00:36:43,578 --> 00:36:44,746
he should be there

718
00:36:44,788 --> 00:36:49,459
and he should help
support me a-and Ricky.

719
00:36:49,501 --> 00:36:51,544
- It's very typical
for law enforcement

720
00:36:51,586 --> 00:36:54,589
to immediately
interview the family

721
00:36:54,631 --> 00:36:56,925
after a child abduction case.

722
00:36:56,966 --> 00:37:01,971
And then quickly eliminate them
and then work on other people

723
00:37:02,013 --> 00:37:05,100
that may have had
some sort of interaction

724
00:37:05,141 --> 00:37:08,478
with the child.

725
00:37:08,520 --> 00:37:10,772
- Even though
you have every indication,

726
00:37:10,814 --> 00:37:14,526
at least initially that
this was a stranger abduction,

727
00:37:14,567 --> 00:37:17,112
it doesn't mean that
you can just walk away

728
00:37:17,153 --> 00:37:19,531
from other potential leads.

729
00:37:21,408 --> 00:37:22,784
{\an8}- One of the other things
that we look at

730
00:37:22,826 --> 00:37:24,285
{\an8}is the friends of the family.

731
00:37:24,327 --> 00:37:29,040
{\an8}In this case there was a man
named Mike Thompson.

732
00:37:29,082 --> 00:37:31,292
{\an8}- There were people
that immediately

733
00:37:31,334 --> 00:37:32,836
{\an8}voiced suspicion about him

734
00:37:32,877 --> 00:37:34,087
{\an8}when they heard
what had happened

735
00:37:34,129 --> 00:37:35,964
{\an8}that there might be
some involvement there.

736
00:37:37,757 --> 00:37:40,051
{\an8}- We're going to take
Mr. Thompson with us for a while

737
00:37:40,093 --> 00:37:41,886
{\an8}and we're going to talk to him
some more.

738
00:37:41,928 --> 00:37:44,389
{\an8}- Mike Thompson
was frequently part--

739
00:37:44,431 --> 00:37:46,141
{\an8}part of kind of
the family outings

740
00:37:46,182 --> 00:37:47,642
{\an8}and things like that.

741
00:37:47,684 --> 00:37:50,353
{\an8}He kind of held himself out
to be a family spokesperson

742
00:37:50,395 --> 00:37:51,813
{\an8}if needed.

743
00:37:51,855 --> 00:37:53,857
{\an8}- You're here and
you're not hearing anything.

744
00:37:53,898 --> 00:37:57,068
{\an8}It's frustrating and
for Donna it's more frustrating

745
00:37:57,110 --> 00:37:59,779
{\an8}than to the rest of us.

746
00:37:59,821 --> 00:38:01,823
- Especially in
high profile crime,

747
00:38:01,865 --> 00:38:03,199
if we've got someone
who is trying to

748
00:38:03,241 --> 00:38:05,201
actively insert themselves
into the investigation,

749
00:38:05,243 --> 00:38:09,497
one of the first things
I want to know is, why?

750
00:38:09,539 --> 00:38:10,790
One of the things
that we learned

751
00:38:10,832 --> 00:38:12,083
in interviewing Mike Thompson

752
00:38:12,125 --> 00:38:16,546
is that he also
drove a black truck.

753
00:38:16,588 --> 00:38:18,882
- I've got a black truck
so, you know,

754
00:38:18,923 --> 00:38:21,051
they automatically
they have to look.

755
00:38:21,092 --> 00:38:24,054
I welcome the-the opportunity
to, uh, you know,

756
00:38:24,095 --> 00:38:25,055
do whatever is necessary

757
00:38:25,096 --> 00:38:26,222
to show 'em
that they're looking

758
00:38:31,728 --> 00:38:32,896
{\an8}**

759
00:38:38,026 --> 00:38:40,111
{\an8}- We've got certainly
a group of potential suspects

760
00:38:40,153 --> 00:38:42,697
{\an8}we've identified and
people that we're checking on,

761
00:38:42,739 --> 00:38:44,574
{\an8}but whether one of those
is an actual suspect

762
00:38:44,616 --> 00:38:47,952
{\an8}or not it's too early to say.

763
00:38:47,994 --> 00:38:50,413
{\an8}- When Amber was abducted,
there were a lot of people

764
00:38:50,455 --> 00:38:51,623
{\an8}coming in and going

765
00:38:51,664 --> 00:38:53,208
{\an8}and I was just kind of
looking at people.

766
00:38:53,249 --> 00:38:55,877
{\an8}You know, do you know
where my baby is?

767
00:38:55,919 --> 00:38:58,088
{\an8}I wanted answers.
I wanted my baby back home.

768
00:39:03,968 --> 00:39:06,304
{\an8}- Police are still
talking with family and friends,

769
00:39:06,346 --> 00:39:07,806
{\an8}most recently Mike Thompson.

770
00:39:07,847 --> 00:39:09,808
{\an8}Amber's father
stays with Thompson,

771
00:39:09,849 --> 00:39:14,104
{\an8}who also drives
a black pickup truck.

772
00:39:14,145 --> 00:39:16,815
{\an8}- Now, how do you know
Richard and Donna?

773
00:39:16,856 --> 00:39:18,066
{\an8}- I mean,
we've just always been,

774
00:39:18,108 --> 00:39:20,151
{\an8}not just a working relationship,
but you know,

775
00:39:20,193 --> 00:39:22,987
{\an8}our friendship develops and, uh,
you're there for each other.

776
00:39:23,029 --> 00:39:25,031
- When you heard the description
was a black truck,

777
00:39:25,073 --> 00:39:26,866
did-did you suddenly have
the reaction of,

778
00:39:26,908 --> 00:39:29,077
"Oh, why did it have to be
a black truck?"

779
00:39:29,119 --> 00:39:30,495
- I mean, everybody's
focusing on it now,

780
00:39:30,537 --> 00:39:32,789
but you know, I got people,
oh, there's a black truck

781
00:39:32,831 --> 00:39:34,791
and I'm going,
the funny part about it,

782
00:39:34,833 --> 00:39:36,501
when I first got here
on the scene,

783
00:39:36,543 --> 00:39:38,461
the first thing
Saturday afternoon,

784
00:39:38,503 --> 00:39:40,755
there's cops all over here.

785
00:39:40,797 --> 00:39:42,007
And I'm never once questioned.

786
00:39:42,048 --> 00:39:44,718
I'm never once
asked about my black truck,

787
00:39:44,759 --> 00:39:48,096
never,
until sometime late Sunday.

788
00:39:48,138 --> 00:39:50,348
- Mike Thompson
drove a delivery truck

789
00:39:50,390 --> 00:39:51,850
and delivered auto parts.

790
00:39:51,891 --> 00:39:53,935
{\an8}And every time
he made a delivery,

791
00:39:53,977 --> 00:39:55,645
{\an8}there was a time stamp.

792
00:39:55,687 --> 00:39:58,189
{\an8}And on January the 13th,

793
00:39:58,231 --> 00:40:02,527
{\an8}he was 30 minutes,
45 minutes away.

794
00:40:02,569 --> 00:40:03,987
The other part about it was,

795
00:40:04,029 --> 00:40:06,364
Mike Thompson
was friends with Richard.

796
00:40:06,406 --> 00:40:08,533
If he wanted to get Amber
in the car with him,

797
00:40:08,575 --> 00:40:11,995
all he had to do would've been
just pull up and ask her.

798
00:40:12,037 --> 00:40:14,372
- Had it been someone
that she knew,

799
00:40:14,414 --> 00:40:16,458
why do the blitz attack?

800
00:40:16,499 --> 00:40:20,378
There was no attempt at all
to engage Amber in conversation

801
00:40:20,420 --> 00:40:22,255
according to Jimmie Kevil.

802
00:40:22,297 --> 00:40:25,383
That's another reason
why we believe that

803
00:40:25,425 --> 00:40:26,343
it was a stranger,

804
00:40:26,384 --> 00:40:28,720
someone that was
unknown to Amber.

805
00:40:28,762 --> 00:40:31,056
This type of
abduction is rare.

806
00:40:31,097 --> 00:40:34,601
And of course, on one hand
that's good because, you know,

807
00:40:34,642 --> 00:40:36,770
it means the community's
a little safer.

808
00:40:36,811 --> 00:40:40,774
On the other hand,
the case incensed the community.

809
00:40:40,815 --> 00:40:43,485
{\an8}- This took over
pretty much every aspect

810
00:40:43,526 --> 00:40:44,986
{\an8}of the city and community.

811
00:40:45,028 --> 00:40:47,572
{\an8}It was all about Amber.

812
00:40:47,614 --> 00:40:49,783
It wasn't just
her neighborhood.

813
00:40:49,824 --> 00:40:53,495
It was the entire city
just covered in pink bows.

814
00:40:53,536 --> 00:40:56,831
You saw them all over trees
and street signs.

815
00:40:56,873 --> 00:40:59,584
It was all anyone
could talk about.

816
00:40:59,626 --> 00:41:02,962
- The community really
cared about my little girl

817
00:41:03,004 --> 00:41:05,757
and what happened to her.

818
00:41:05,799 --> 00:41:07,008
The waiting's
really killing me.

819
00:41:07,050 --> 00:41:08,968
It's hard to wait.

820
00:41:09,010 --> 00:41:12,347
But I know I have to keep strong
for my little girl.

821
00:41:12,389 --> 00:41:16,434
- I just hope she's okay and
she can come back real soon.

822
00:41:16,476 --> 00:41:18,770
We-we all miss her a lot.

823
00:41:18,812 --> 00:41:20,105
- How could they not
see something?

824
00:41:20,146 --> 00:41:24,067
Look how busy this street is!

825
00:41:24,109 --> 00:41:28,363
{\an8}- You see the fear in their eyes
and as a detective,

826
00:41:28,405 --> 00:41:31,116
{\an8}as an investigator,
as a police officer,

827
00:41:31,157 --> 00:41:32,992
{\an8}it's very frustrating

828
00:41:33,034 --> 00:41:36,454
{\an8}because you want to be able
to take that fear way.

829
00:41:36,496 --> 00:41:40,500
{\an8}You want to be able
to solve that crime.

830
00:41:43,545 --> 00:41:46,297
{\an8}- We knew that a task force
needed to be formed

831
00:41:46,339 --> 00:41:49,134
{\an8}that could control
the leads and tips

832
00:41:49,175 --> 00:41:51,761
{\an8}as far as making sure that
each one was looked at.

833
00:41:51,803 --> 00:41:54,139
{\an8}But again,
not doubling the effort.

834
00:41:54,180 --> 00:41:56,099
- We were a freestanding
task force.

835
00:41:56,141 --> 00:41:59,060
We had 15 detectives
that they had dedicated to us.

836
00:41:59,102 --> 00:42:01,312
I needed people
who were very good

837
00:42:01,354 --> 00:42:03,815
at interview
and interrogation,

838
00:42:03,857 --> 00:42:07,068
who had a very strong
attention to detail.

839
00:42:07,110 --> 00:42:09,320
They didn't let little things
slip by them.

840
00:42:09,362 --> 00:42:11,656
And I needed people
that did not know

841
00:42:11,698 --> 00:42:13,324
the meaning of the word quit.

842
00:42:13,366 --> 00:42:15,160
- While we were still
looking for Amber,

843
00:42:15,201 --> 00:42:17,245
these teams of detectives
and FBI agents

844
00:42:17,287 --> 00:42:21,124
were going out contacting
registered sex offenders.

845
00:42:21,166 --> 00:42:22,876
- This unit
that has come to town

846
00:42:22,917 --> 00:42:25,712
{\an8}has a tremendous amount
of expertise

847
00:42:25,754 --> 00:42:28,840
{\an8}in child abduction cases
and that is why they're here.

848
00:42:28,882 --> 00:42:32,552
{\an8}- We assume that
because she was 9 years old

849
00:42:32,594 --> 00:42:33,970
and it was a female

850
00:42:34,012 --> 00:42:36,389
that there's a sexual
component to this,

851
00:42:36,431 --> 00:42:41,019
and it's what drove
the investigation.

852
00:42:41,061 --> 00:42:42,645
- We started looking at
sex offenders

853
00:42:42,687 --> 00:42:46,691
who had offended against girls
in the age range of seven to 12

854
00:42:46,733 --> 00:42:49,069
and then you expand out
from there.

855
00:42:52,405 --> 00:42:54,532
- We actually mapped this out
on a grid to make sure that

856
00:42:54,574 --> 00:42:58,495
we had contacted
every resident, if possible.

857
00:42:58,536 --> 00:43:00,705
When we interviewed people,
we'd find out,

858
00:43:00,747 --> 00:43:02,499
did they live there
with a family?

859
00:43:02,540 --> 00:43:05,043
Is it a single male
that lives there alone

860
00:43:05,085 --> 00:43:07,796
that could potentially
be a suspect?

861
00:43:07,837 --> 00:43:09,297
- We have every reason
to believe that

862
00:43:09,339 --> 00:43:12,926
this individual may have
committed this crime before.

863
00:43:12,967 --> 00:43:15,553
- You have a high risk grab
right there

864
00:43:15,595 --> 00:43:17,806
in the middle of
that parking lot, you know,

865
00:43:17,847 --> 00:43:19,265
in my mind
I just kind of felt like

866
00:43:19,307 --> 00:43:21,476
maybe he had done this before.

867
00:43:21,518 --> 00:43:23,561
And, of course,
it was also a concern

868
00:43:23,603 --> 00:43:26,481
that he might do it again
in the future.

869
00:43:30,944 --> 00:43:32,487
- We're just trying not to
give up hope

870
00:43:32,529 --> 00:43:34,823
and trying to be strong
for Amber.

871
00:43:34,864 --> 00:43:36,032
Arlington Police...

872
00:43:36,074 --> 00:43:38,493
- Would she be willing to
talk to me?

873
00:43:38,535 --> 00:43:42,372
{\an8}- You don't have the-the luxury
of dismissing anything.

874
00:43:42,414 --> 00:43:44,958
{\an8}Every lead had to be looked at,
no matter how far-fetched

875
00:43:45,000 --> 00:43:48,503
{\an8}or improbable that it was.

876
00:43:49,504 --> 00:43:51,297
{\an8}- I remember
helicopters overhead,

877
00:43:51,339 --> 00:43:53,633
{\an8}and I remember officers
with dogs

878
00:43:53,675 --> 00:43:55,218
{\an8}going through the park.

879
00:43:55,260 --> 00:43:56,761
{\an8}Every time they got
one of those tips

880
00:43:56,803 --> 00:43:57,637
{\an8}and they went out,
you were like,

881
00:43:57,679 --> 00:43:58,930
{\an8}"Okay, is this it?

882
00:43:58,972 --> 00:44:01,433
{\an8}Are they finally
going to find her?"

883
00:44:01,474 --> 00:44:03,727
- I think they're working
as hard as they can

884
00:44:03,768 --> 00:44:07,397
and I think they're doing
all they can to get Amber home.

885
00:44:09,566 --> 00:44:12,610
Give them peace.

886
00:44:12,652 --> 00:44:18,658
Give them hope that
it will end in a happy reunion.

887
00:44:20,660 --> 00:44:22,120
I didn't know what to do.

888
00:44:22,162 --> 00:44:26,791
All I knew I wanted to do
is get my little girl home.

889
00:44:26,833 --> 00:44:29,252
I worried about her
the whole time.

890
00:44:29,294 --> 00:44:30,462
You know,
is she going to get fed?

891
00:44:30,503 --> 00:44:33,631
Is she being taken care of?
Is she warm?

892
00:44:33,673 --> 00:44:36,343
Is she cold?

893
00:44:39,763 --> 00:44:41,348
- The days go on,
the hours go on,

894
00:44:41,389 --> 00:44:44,059
and you don't have to know much
about child abduction statistics

895
00:44:44,100 --> 00:44:47,228
to know that every second
works against you.

896
00:44:47,270 --> 00:44:49,147
Not just every minute
or every hour,

897
00:44:49,189 --> 00:44:51,316
but every second
works against you.

898
00:44:51,358 --> 00:44:53,485
The chances of
finding a child alive

899
00:44:53,526 --> 00:44:56,905
diminish dramatically
as time goes on.

900
00:45:09,417 --> 00:45:11,169
{\an8}**

901
00:45:16,257 --> 00:45:19,177
{\an8}- Wednesday evening,
this spring-like thunderstorm

902
00:45:19,219 --> 00:45:21,012
{\an8}came through and
dropped the temperature.

903
00:45:21,054 --> 00:45:23,473
{\an8}I mean for as warm as it was,
it turned off

904
00:45:23,515 --> 00:45:25,350
{\an8}just bitterly cold
out of the north.

905
00:45:25,392 --> 00:45:27,477
{\an8}But as the front moved through,
which it does

906
00:45:27,519 --> 00:45:30,146
{\an8}typically in Texas
when cold air meets warm air,

907
00:45:30,188 --> 00:45:33,191
{\an8}we have bad, bad storms.

908
00:46:04,806 --> 00:46:07,600
{\an8}- I received a phone call
at about 11:30 at night

909
00:46:07,642 --> 00:46:08,893
{\an8}at my residence.

910
00:46:08,935 --> 00:46:12,897
{\an8}Dispatch informed me that
a body had been found

911
00:46:12,939 --> 00:46:16,526
{\an8}in Arlington.

912
00:46:20,488 --> 00:46:22,866
I was the first
investigative person

913
00:46:22,907 --> 00:46:24,117
that was on the scene.

914
00:46:24,159 --> 00:46:27,954
Patrol was there,
and crime scene was there.

915
00:46:27,996 --> 00:46:29,372
{\an8}- We don't know that much
at this point

916
00:46:29,414 --> 00:46:32,125
{\an8}and we want to be very,
very cautious about

917
00:46:32,167 --> 00:46:34,544
{\an8}the information
that we're putting out.

918
00:46:36,546 --> 00:46:39,382
{\an8}- I walked down to the creek bed
and I noticed

919
00:46:39,424 --> 00:46:43,386
{\an8}a young white female's body
that was floating,

920
00:46:43,428 --> 00:46:46,723
{\an8}but was caught up
in the brush.

921
00:46:46,765 --> 00:46:49,267
{\an8}- The police are saying
it's too hard to tell,

922
00:46:49,309 --> 00:46:51,603
{\an8}you know, who it is.

923
00:46:51,644 --> 00:46:54,105
{\an8}- My husband
said it was a female.

924
00:46:54,147 --> 00:46:55,940
{\an8}She's buck-naked.
She's face down.

925
00:46:55,982 --> 00:47:00,487
{\an8}He said it was a female.

926
00:47:00,528 --> 00:47:02,614
{\an8}- Why has the lead investigator
on the Amber Hagerman case

927
00:47:02,655 --> 00:47:04,199
{\an8}been called here?

928
00:47:04,240 --> 00:47:06,409
{\an8}- Well, I mean, he's one of
our lead homicide investigators

929
00:47:06,451 --> 00:47:08,578
{\an8}and, you know,
we're certainly,

930
00:47:08,620 --> 00:47:11,289
{\an8}we're certainly sensitive
to the fact that

931
00:47:11,331 --> 00:47:14,751
{\an8}we've located a body
that needs to be identified.

932
00:47:14,793 --> 00:47:17,337
I mean, I don't want to
alarm anyone at this point,

933
00:47:17,379 --> 00:47:19,089
but we're certainly sensitive
to the fact that--

934
00:47:19,130 --> 00:47:20,298
that it could be Amber

935
00:47:20,340 --> 00:47:22,258
and we're just not
in a position to say yet.

936
00:47:22,300 --> 00:47:25,136
- Has the family been notified
in any way?

937
00:47:25,178 --> 00:47:27,097
- Uh, we have people en route
over to the--

938
00:47:27,138 --> 00:47:29,099
to the residence
now to notify them

939
00:47:29,140 --> 00:47:32,394
that we have located a-a body.

940
00:47:35,605 --> 00:47:37,524
- My name is
Derrelynn Perryman,

941
00:47:37,565 --> 00:47:40,151
{\an8}and I was the Victim
Assistance Coordinator

942
00:47:40,193 --> 00:47:41,486
{\an8}for the Arlington
Police Department

943
00:47:41,528 --> 00:47:43,780
{\an8}during the Amber case.

944
00:47:43,822 --> 00:47:46,950
I go into the house
and touch base with the family.

945
00:47:46,991 --> 00:47:50,620
I had been given instructions
that we weren't going to be able

946
00:47:50,662 --> 00:47:53,331
to positively identify
the child that was found

947
00:47:53,373 --> 00:47:58,503
until they completed
the crime scene investigation.

948
00:47:58,545 --> 00:48:00,171
{\an8}- I had been with the family
all day

949
00:48:00,213 --> 00:48:01,256
{\an8}and I got in bed

950
00:48:01,297 --> 00:48:03,967
{\an8}and I had hardly
touched the sheets

951
00:48:04,009 --> 00:48:05,885
{\an8}before the phone rang.

952
00:48:05,927 --> 00:48:07,095
{\an8}And I picked up the phone

953
00:48:07,137 --> 00:48:09,180
{\an8}and it was my assistant
news director.

954
00:48:09,222 --> 00:48:14,602
{\an8}And he said, Pam,
they found a body.

955
00:48:14,644 --> 00:48:17,605
{\an8}So I immediately headed
back to the house,

956
00:48:17,647 --> 00:48:22,235
{\an8}and went straight in
with my photographer.

957
00:48:26,281 --> 00:48:27,949
{\an8}- We were all really
watching the news,

958
00:48:27,991 --> 00:48:32,328
{\an8}and they kept talking about
this little body they found.

959
00:48:32,370 --> 00:48:34,122
- So Edie Kocher
and her husband

960
00:48:34,164 --> 00:48:36,207
who found the body,
Stuart Kocher,

961
00:48:36,249 --> 00:48:37,625
are at least themselves
convinced that

962
00:48:37,667 --> 00:48:40,628
what he saw was the body
of a young girl.

963
00:48:40,670 --> 00:48:42,505
Police are not so convinced.

964
00:48:42,547 --> 00:48:48,053
- So we sat in their living room
and they had the news on

965
00:48:48,094 --> 00:48:50,722
all night long.

966
00:48:50,764 --> 00:48:52,891
- It was over and over
and over,

967
00:48:52,932 --> 00:48:54,142
a child's body has been found.

968
00:48:54,184 --> 00:48:56,227
It's probably Amber.
It's probably Amber.

969
00:48:56,269 --> 00:48:58,521
And so, you can imagine
how agonizing

970
00:48:58,563 --> 00:49:02,359
that was to just sit there
and listen to that.

971
00:49:02,400 --> 00:49:07,238
[indistinct TV chatter]

972
00:49:07,280 --> 00:49:10,909
- News 8 Now,
the spirit of Texas.

973
00:49:10,950 --> 00:49:12,160
- We interrupt this program
to bring you

974
00:49:12,202 --> 00:49:16,164
the following News 8
Special Report.

975
00:49:16,206 --> 00:49:18,667
- Arlington Police Department
came to the house this evening

976
00:49:18,708 --> 00:49:21,836
to tell the family that
a body had been found.

977
00:49:21,878 --> 00:49:24,464
Amber's father also is here
at the house with the family.

978
00:49:24,506 --> 00:49:26,424
- I was watching this
on the news

979
00:49:26,466 --> 00:49:28,968
in my parents' home
with my parents.

980
00:49:29,010 --> 00:49:32,013
And that was hard.

981
00:49:34,516 --> 00:49:36,267
- ...family friend
who has been here

982
00:49:36,309 --> 00:49:37,769
throughout the whole ordeal,

983
00:49:37,811 --> 00:49:40,772
as well as Amber's mother,
who is looking quite distraught.

984
00:49:40,814 --> 00:49:44,109
- It was
an excruciating night.

985
00:49:44,150 --> 00:49:46,277
And no,
I wasn't her family.

986
00:49:46,319 --> 00:49:48,905
I felt like I understood,

987
00:49:48,947 --> 00:49:52,200
and I was having
some of those same emotions.

988
00:49:52,242 --> 00:49:56,705
I didn't want it to be her.
Nobody did.

989
00:49:56,746 --> 00:49:58,707
- ...saw a little girl
riding her bike

990
00:49:58,748 --> 00:50:01,501
and then a black pickup
pulled up next to her

991
00:50:01,543 --> 00:50:03,837
and yanked her off that bike.

992
00:50:03,878 --> 00:50:05,797
- I was in contact
with Mike Simonds,

993
00:50:05,839 --> 00:50:08,925
and he said it was
probably Amber,

994
00:50:08,967 --> 00:50:11,720
but we needed to be sure,
and we didn't want to tell them

995
00:50:11,761 --> 00:50:15,640
until we had confirmed that
it was actually her.

996
00:50:15,682 --> 00:50:20,395
So, I talked with the family.
I explained that to them.

997
00:50:20,437 --> 00:50:21,604
At this point I'm told

998
00:50:21,646 --> 00:50:22,897
you've got a couple hours
to rest

999
00:50:22,939 --> 00:50:24,649
if you can even
just close your eyes

1000
00:50:24,691 --> 00:50:29,029
for a couple of minutes.
It's gonna help a little bit.

1001
00:50:34,367 --> 00:50:38,413
- I was there for several hours
and then my pager went off

1002
00:50:38,455 --> 00:50:39,664
and I went out to the car.

1003
00:50:39,706 --> 00:50:42,500
I did have a cell phone,
and Mike Simonds said,

1004
00:50:42,542 --> 00:50:45,253
Yes, you know,
we've identified it's her.

1005
00:50:45,295 --> 00:50:48,840
Um, they identified
some birthmarks.

1006
00:50:48,882 --> 00:50:50,967
And then he said,
"And you have five minutes

1007
00:50:51,009 --> 00:50:54,512
to tell the family before
we announce it to the media.

1008
00:51:04,564 --> 00:51:07,859
[distant screaming]

1009
00:51:11,279 --> 00:51:13,406
- There was a-a scream
and a cry

1010
00:51:13,448 --> 00:51:15,867
that I will never forget.

1011
00:51:17,369 --> 00:51:23,458
[sobbing softly]

1012
00:51:29,673 --> 00:51:32,842
- That was really,
really hard.

1013
00:51:32,884 --> 00:51:36,179
You know,
just my mom and my dad crying

1014
00:51:36,221 --> 00:51:40,892
and my dad never cries.

1015
00:51:46,731 --> 00:51:49,567
- From all visual
that we can see,

1016
00:51:49,609 --> 00:51:51,778
from the description
that we've got

1017
00:51:51,820 --> 00:51:53,905
and from the photographs
that we've seen,

1018
00:51:53,947 --> 00:51:57,117
we feel that this tentatively
is going to be

1019
00:51:57,158 --> 00:51:59,661
the body of Amber Hagerman.

1020
00:51:59,703 --> 00:52:03,081
- We are in the process
of notifying the family as such.

1021
00:52:03,123 --> 00:52:06,001
We are stressing to them and
I want to stress to all of you,

1022
00:52:06,042 --> 00:52:08,545
that a positive identification
will be made

1023
00:52:08,586 --> 00:52:09,963
by the Medical
Examiner's Office...

1024
00:52:10,005 --> 00:52:14,426
- Just the agony of knowing
that yes, that was her

1025
00:52:14,467 --> 00:52:16,720
and she was gone.

1026
00:52:16,761 --> 00:52:19,431
You just can't
even describe it.

1027
00:52:19,472 --> 00:52:20,849
[sobbing]

1028
00:52:20,890 --> 00:52:22,183
- You know, very little
to go on

1029
00:52:27,147 --> 00:52:31,151
{\an8}**

1030
00:52:36,239 --> 00:52:39,284
{\an8}- We decided pretty early on
that we're gonna have to

1031
00:52:39,325 --> 00:52:41,703
{\an8}not air
the welfare documentary,

1032
00:52:41,745 --> 00:52:44,039
{\an8}which was
due to air on Thursday.

1033
00:52:44,080 --> 00:52:49,586
{\an8}And actually, that was the day
we found out she was found.

1034
00:52:53,923 --> 00:52:56,718
{\an8}- When they confirmed
it was Amber's body,

1035
00:52:56,760 --> 00:52:58,720
{\an8}and, you know,
it's everybody's screaming

1036
00:52:58,762 --> 00:53:01,556
{\an8}and crying and
news media is everywhere.

1037
00:53:01,598 --> 00:53:03,433
{\an8}The police had put
the yellow tape

1038
00:53:03,475 --> 00:53:06,895
{\an8}around my parents' front yard.

1039
00:53:06,936 --> 00:53:10,648
{\an8}It was horrible that day.

1040
00:53:11,775 --> 00:53:15,945
And still I'm in denial.
No, this is not my baby.

1041
00:53:15,987 --> 00:53:18,865
I want to see my baby
from my own eyes.

1042
00:53:18,907 --> 00:53:22,744
I wanted to touch my baby.
I wanted to talk to my baby.

1043
00:53:22,786 --> 00:53:27,123
And I did not--
no I did not believe it.

1044
00:53:30,418 --> 00:53:32,921
{\an8}Immediately, of course,

1045
00:53:32,962 --> 00:53:36,091
{\an8}Donna wanted to go
and be with Amber,

1046
00:53:36,132 --> 00:53:37,175
{\an8}and as a mom,

1047
00:53:37,217 --> 00:53:39,219
{\an8}I could certainly
identify with that.

1048
00:53:39,260 --> 00:53:41,846
{\an8}If I hadn't been able to
put my hands on my child

1049
00:53:41,888 --> 00:53:44,182
{\an8}for several days because
they were missing,

1050
00:53:44,224 --> 00:53:46,685
{\an8}that would be the first thing
I would want to do too.

1051
00:53:46,726 --> 00:53:48,353
The Tarrant County
Medical Examiner's Office

1052
00:53:48,395 --> 00:53:50,105
doesn't allow people to visit.

1053
00:53:50,146 --> 00:53:52,273
We contacted
the medical examiner's office,

1054
00:53:52,315 --> 00:53:53,316
and of course,

1055
00:53:53,358 --> 00:53:55,610
they-they did
the autopsy priority

1056
00:53:55,652 --> 00:53:58,029
because we knew that
it was just urgent.

1057
00:53:58,071 --> 00:54:02,742
You know, she really,
really needed to be with Amber.

1058
00:54:11,626 --> 00:54:14,129
{\an8}Now we have a homicide.

1059
00:54:14,170 --> 00:54:17,132
{\an8}First order of business
is you shift into high gear

1060
00:54:17,173 --> 00:54:19,300
{\an8}thinking,
"Okay, what have we got?"

1061
00:54:19,342 --> 00:54:21,594
{\an8}It started off Saturday.

1062
00:54:21,636 --> 00:54:23,471
{\an8}Now we're over here
on Thursday.

1063
00:54:23,513 --> 00:54:27,976
{\an8}We found Amber dead
in this creek three miles away.

1064
00:54:28,018 --> 00:54:31,354
{\an8}Why?

1065
00:54:35,108 --> 00:54:36,526
{\an8}- So right now,
we're pulling into

1066
00:54:36,568 --> 00:54:40,989
{\an8}the apartment complex and
we're going towards the creek

1067
00:54:41,031 --> 00:54:43,867
{\an8}that runs north and south
along the west side

1068
00:54:43,908 --> 00:54:47,662
{\an8}of the apartment complex.

1069
00:54:47,704 --> 00:54:50,040
The first time
that I came out here,

1070
00:54:50,081 --> 00:54:53,501
it made me realize that
the suspect must have known

1071
00:54:53,543 --> 00:54:58,381
that this apartment complex
and the creek were here.

1072
00:54:58,423 --> 00:55:01,676
It just doesn't seem likely
that a suspect

1073
00:55:01,718 --> 00:55:04,846
would just randomly
drive into this complex

1074
00:55:04,888 --> 00:55:07,390
and then just
happen upon a creek

1075
00:55:07,432 --> 00:55:10,852
to leave her body in.

1076
00:55:10,894 --> 00:55:13,396
- The night that
Amber's body was found,

1077
00:55:13,438 --> 00:55:16,024
there were thousands and
thousands of gallons of water

1078
00:55:16,066 --> 00:55:19,027
that washed over her body.

1079
00:55:19,069 --> 00:55:21,279
Based on the condition
of her body,

1080
00:55:21,321 --> 00:55:23,698
we think that
she was put in very close to

1081
00:55:23,740 --> 00:55:26,910
if not exactly
where her body was found.

1082
00:55:26,951 --> 00:55:29,871
There were not injuries
or anything like that

1083
00:55:29,913 --> 00:55:33,208
that would be indicative of
her traveling a long way

1084
00:55:33,249 --> 00:55:36,711
in the water, hitting rocks,
hitting branches,

1085
00:55:36,753 --> 00:55:38,922
and all the things
that you would expect to see

1086
00:55:38,963 --> 00:55:40,799
if she had been
put in the water

1087
00:55:40,840 --> 00:55:44,719
a long ways from
where she was found.

1088
00:55:44,761 --> 00:55:46,471
- It was a large
apartment complex

1089
00:55:46,513 --> 00:55:48,723
and there was a main gate.

1090
00:55:48,765 --> 00:55:53,770
To the west of that main gate,
there was another entrance.

1091
00:55:53,812 --> 00:55:55,897
It, too, had a gate.

1092
00:55:55,939 --> 00:55:59,275
At the time of Amber's
abduction and her recovery,

1093
00:55:59,317 --> 00:56:00,777
that gate was broken.

1094
00:56:00,819 --> 00:56:03,321
So there was unfettered access
into and out of

1095
00:56:03,363 --> 00:56:06,825
the apartment complex
through that gate.

1096
00:56:06,866 --> 00:56:10,412
There was a video camera
at the main entrance.

1097
00:56:10,453 --> 00:56:12,831
On the night that
Amber's body was recovered,

1098
00:56:12,872 --> 00:56:16,251
the wind and the rain,
it was shaking the camera

1099
00:56:16,292 --> 00:56:21,047
and it took visibility down to
where we couldn't see very well.

1100
00:56:21,089 --> 00:56:23,383
- You can see vehicles
coming and going,

1101
00:56:23,425 --> 00:56:27,762
and you do see a dark truck
that enters the complex,

1102
00:56:27,804 --> 00:56:30,265
but the video
just wasn't clear enough

1103
00:56:30,306 --> 00:56:31,933
to be able to determine
whether or not

1104
00:56:31,975 --> 00:56:34,644
that was the suspect vehicle.

1105
00:56:34,686 --> 00:56:36,771
- There was nothing
on that video

1106
00:56:36,813 --> 00:56:39,274
that we could use to
identify a suspect.

1107
00:56:39,315 --> 00:56:42,569
One of our beliefs was that
the suspect was familiar with

1108
00:56:42,610 --> 00:56:47,115
not only the abduction site
but the disposal site as well.

1109
00:56:47,157 --> 00:56:48,575
And that's another one
of the reasons

1110
00:56:48,616 --> 00:56:52,495
why we believed that he was
probably a local resident.

1111
00:56:57,000 --> 00:56:58,543
{\an8}- Only portion
that was submerged

1112
00:56:58,585 --> 00:57:04,883
{\an8}was from her shoulders up.
And maybe-maybe an arm.

1113
00:57:04,924 --> 00:57:06,343
{\an8}And so I ran back to the house,

1114
00:57:06,384 --> 00:57:08,303
{\an8}and, uh, went through
the front door,

1115
00:57:08,345 --> 00:57:11,306
{\an8}a-and yelled at my wife Edie,
I found her.

1116
00:57:11,348 --> 00:57:13,266
{\an8}I found Amber.

1117
00:57:13,308 --> 00:57:15,310
{\an8}- Stuart Kocher
was the witness

1118
00:57:15,352 --> 00:57:19,814
{\an8}that found Amber's body
that night.

1119
00:57:19,856 --> 00:57:22,150
{\an8}His statement was that
after the storm

1120
00:57:22,192 --> 00:57:23,693
{\an8}had passed through the area

1121
00:57:23,735 --> 00:57:25,987
{\an8}that he took his dog
out for a walk.

1122
00:57:26,029 --> 00:57:27,614
His dog went down
to the creek bed area

1123
00:57:27,655 --> 00:57:29,824
and began barking.

1124
00:57:29,866 --> 00:57:33,995
Then he saw Amber's body.

1125
00:57:34,037 --> 00:57:36,539
- And because there'd been
so much coverage

1126
00:57:36,581 --> 00:57:40,460
of Amber being missing and
everybody trying to find her,

1127
00:57:40,502 --> 00:57:44,089
his immediate thought was,
That's probably her.

1128
00:57:46,132 --> 00:57:48,510
- You ask
all sorts of questions like

1129
00:57:48,551 --> 00:57:50,553
"Did you talk to anybody
while you were going out

1130
00:57:50,595 --> 00:57:52,889
to go on this walk?
What'd you do before that?"

1131
00:57:52,931 --> 00:57:55,684
If he was involved in it,
then obviously,

1132
00:57:55,725 --> 00:57:57,143
you're worried about
what happened

1133
00:57:57,185 --> 00:58:01,690
from the abduction time
to the discovery of the body.

1134
00:58:01,731 --> 00:58:03,942
There wasn't anything
in his story

1135
00:58:03,983 --> 00:58:07,112
that was inconsistent.

1136
00:58:07,153 --> 00:58:11,032
He was finally eliminated
by a polygraph.

1137
00:58:12,325 --> 00:58:13,535
- We're just going to
question people

1138
00:58:13,576 --> 00:58:16,788
to see what they saw
and what they observed.

1139
00:58:16,830 --> 00:58:20,417
- We began a canvas,
multiple FBI agents,

1140
00:58:20,458 --> 00:58:25,338
and we had multiple
Arlington PD detectives there.

1141
00:58:25,380 --> 00:58:27,382
- We want to know
who the maintenance people are.

1142
00:58:27,424 --> 00:58:30,385
Who is doing the landscaping
at the apartments?

1143
00:58:30,427 --> 00:58:33,847
What independent
contractors they have.

1144
00:58:33,888 --> 00:58:35,724
We went door to door.

1145
00:58:35,765 --> 00:58:38,768
Before it was over with
we were at

1146
00:58:38,810 --> 00:58:42,564
every single apartment
in that complex.

1147
00:58:42,605 --> 00:58:45,316
- We didn't find
any additional witnesses.

1148
00:58:45,358 --> 00:58:48,236
No one admitted to seeing
anyone parking

1149
00:58:48,278 --> 00:58:51,906
and carrying anything down
through the playground

1150
00:58:51,948 --> 00:58:54,784
into the culvert area
either that night

1151
00:58:54,826 --> 00:58:59,289
or any of the days
leading up to that.

1152
00:59:08,465 --> 00:59:10,592
- I didn't believe that
that was Amber.

1153
00:59:10,633 --> 00:59:14,054
I said that's not my baby.
My baby's not dead.

1154
00:59:14,095 --> 00:59:16,306
You know, I want to
go see my daughter.

1155
00:59:16,348 --> 00:59:20,060
Take me to my little girl.
I want to hold my little girl.

1156
00:59:20,101 --> 00:59:23,063
I want to see for myself,
with my own eyes,

1157
00:59:23,104 --> 00:59:25,357
that this is my little girl.

1158
00:59:25,398 --> 00:59:27,359
And they kept telling me,
no I can't

1159
00:59:27,400 --> 00:59:29,527
'cause they had to
do the autopsy

1160
00:59:29,569 --> 00:59:33,948
and that she was so disfigured
so they had to

1161
00:59:33,990 --> 00:59:37,243
cover her wounds up
so I wouldn't see that.

1162
00:59:37,285 --> 00:59:40,246
And they said I didn't want to
see her the way she was.

1163
00:59:40,288 --> 00:59:41,623
And I told them,
you know, I don't care.

1164
00:59:41,664 --> 00:59:43,041
I want to see my little girl.

1165
00:59:43,083 --> 00:59:44,292
I want to hold my little girl.

1166
00:59:44,334 --> 00:59:47,962
So I didn't get to
see her or hold her,

1167
00:59:48,004 --> 00:59:49,964
until the next day.

1168
00:59:50,006 --> 00:59:52,384
And they took me
to the funeral home

1169
00:59:52,425 --> 00:59:55,345
and I got to kiss her
and hold her hand

1170
00:59:55,387 --> 00:59:57,681
and told her
that everything's okay,

1171
00:59:57,722 --> 00:59:59,974
you know, Mommy's here.

1172
01:00:00,016 --> 01:00:02,435
So they told me
I could hold her hands

1173
01:00:02,477 --> 01:00:06,106
and touch her little face
and that was it.

1174
01:00:06,147 --> 01:00:08,024
But I so wanted to,
you know,

1175
01:00:08,066 --> 01:00:10,568
pick her up
and hold her and...

1176
01:00:10,610 --> 01:00:14,656
[crying]

1177
01:00:14,698 --> 01:00:16,408
Yeah.

1178
01:00:25,375 --> 01:00:31,631
- Amber had
a very severe laceration

1179
01:00:31,673 --> 01:00:35,176
to her throat from one side
to the other.

1180
01:00:35,218 --> 01:00:40,640
Um, it was a--
a very severe cut,

1181
01:00:40,682 --> 01:00:42,308
very violent cut.

1182
01:00:43,560 --> 01:00:46,312
- You've got
all this damage

1183
01:00:46,354 --> 01:00:47,689
to her throat
and neck area

1184
01:00:47,731 --> 01:00:50,108
but not necessarily
a tremendous amount of damage

1185
01:00:50,150 --> 01:00:51,609
elsewhere
on the body.

1186
01:00:51,651 --> 01:00:54,529
- One of the things
that we saw right away

1187
01:00:54,571 --> 01:00:56,197
was that there was
no indication

1188
01:00:56,239 --> 01:01:00,201
of a sexual assault
to Amber's body.

1189
01:01:00,243 --> 01:01:03,371
Just because there's not
evidence of a sexual assault

1190
01:01:03,413 --> 01:01:07,334
doesn't mean that there was
not a sexual component to it.

1191
01:01:07,375 --> 01:01:10,337
- You can't escape
at least the theory

1192
01:01:10,378 --> 01:01:13,298
that the act of killing Amber
was what provided

1193
01:01:13,340 --> 01:01:14,966
a sexual release
for the suspect.

1194
01:01:15,008 --> 01:01:17,552
- There were some
very, very early signs

1195
01:01:17,594 --> 01:01:20,221
of decomposition
that were identified

1196
01:01:20,263 --> 01:01:23,516
that would be more
consistent with the idea

1197
01:01:23,558 --> 01:01:26,936
of her being killed Tuesday
going into Wednesday.

1198
01:01:26,978 --> 01:01:29,105
- There was
no signs of torture.

1199
01:01:29,147 --> 01:01:30,607
There was no signs
of restraint.

1200
01:01:30,648 --> 01:01:33,318
No defensive wounds
that we could see.

1201
01:01:33,360 --> 01:01:35,403
The question now becomes,
all right,

1202
01:01:35,445 --> 01:01:37,489
where was she
being kept alive,

1203
01:01:37,530 --> 01:01:40,158
who did this,
how did he hang on to her?

1204
01:01:41,951 --> 01:01:45,372
[church bells ringing]

1205
